loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more rice, pepper, maggi cubes, oil, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe tien 50 años de edad, esta casado su esposa se dedica a los oficio del hogar, él trabaja en la agricultura, es padre de una niña la cual esta estudiado 6º grado de educación.

Felipe se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 26 años, el trabajo de la agricultura lo aprendio de su padre; quien lo llevaba desde muy temprano al campo a trabajar en los cultivos de maiz, desde que su padre le inculco este trabajo él lo ha realizado y le a puesto mucha dedicación; ya que debido a los cultivos de maiz  a podido darle una educacion a su hija y a logrado sacar adelate a su familia a pesar de la situacion economica que él tiene.

El préstamo lo utilizara para la compra de insumos para la siembra del cultivo como, semilla, abono, fertiizantes, pesticidas y en la preparación de la tierra para la siembra. Él espera que su cultivo dé un buen fruto y asi poder vender el cultivo en el tiempo adecuado para pagar el crédito que ha adquirido en CREDICAMPO y con las ganancia pobra sastifacer las necesidades y comprar una novilla lechera para sacar cuajada y leche, venderlas y obtener un poco mas de ganacias.

Felipe sueña con poseerun negocio y  seguir trabajando la tierra con sus propios fondos economicos y ver a sus hija convertida en toda una profesiona.
texts.en:
Felipe is 50 years old. He is married. His wife does the household tasks. He works in agriculture. He is the father of a little girl who is in the sixth grade of school.

Felipe has been working in agriculture for 26 years. He learned agricultural work from his father, who took him to work in the cornfields at a very early age. Ever since his father taught him this work, he has done it with great dedication, since thanks to his corn crops, he has been able to give his daughter an education, and he has managed to raise his family in spite of his economic situation.

He will use the loan for the purchase of supplies for the planting of crops, such as seeds, compost, fertilizers, and pesticides, and for the preparation of the land for planting. He hopes that his planting will give a good harvest, that he will thus be able to sell his crops in a suitable time to pay off the loan that he has acquired from CrediCampo, and that with the earnings he will be able to satisfy the needs and buy a dairy heifer to get milk and curd cheese to sell and obtain a little more income.

Felipe dreams of having a business and continuing to work the land with his own funds and seeing his daughter become a thorough professional.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, fertilizer, pesticides, and everything necessary to prepare the land.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en: Nicholas is a single man. He describes himself to be experienced. He operates a garage where he repairs motor vehicles. He has been involved in this business for 7 years. His business is located in a viable location and his primary customers are motor vehicle owners. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. He will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy motor vehicle spare parts. His business goal is to be successful within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy motor vehicle spare parts.

loans.name: Vanessa Carolina

texts.es: Vanessa de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos. Vanessa es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora. Hace varios  años se decidió en poner una pequeña tienda que con gran esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado mantener a lo largo de estos años, Cuenta con mucha clientela que la prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que ellos buscan, ella solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para poder invertir en su tiendita y abastecerla con todo tipo de productos como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, café, golosinas, aceite, papel, detergente, y de más productos atractivos para los clientes. Confía que de esta manera logrará darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Vanessa, 31, lives in her own house with her husband and their two children. Vanessa is an enterprising woman and a fighter. Several years ago, she decided to set up a small store that, with great effort and dedication, she has been able to maintain over the years. She has a lot of clientele that prefer her store because she always has what they are looking for. 

She is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL in order to invest in her store and stock it with all types of products such as: rice, beans, sugar, milk, coffee, candy, oil, paper, detergent and other products that are attractive to the customers. 

She is confident that in this way she will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, milk, coffee, candy, oil, paper, detergent and more products

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Maria de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, ella posee una tienda en su lugar de residencia tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona , se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda como golosinas, granos básicos, aceite, arroz, azúcar, refrescos, etc. asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria, 36, lives in her own house with her family. She has a store in her place of residence. She has had this business for many years and that has given her experience in sales, which allows her to obtain a better income. 

She is very well-recognized by the area´s locals. She has gained many customers, since she has the store stocked. She wants to grow her business and make a new investment, but she needs capital, which is why she is requesting a loan. The loan will allow her to buy what is necessary for her store, such as candy, basic grains, oil, rice, sugar, soda, etc. She is sure that she will pay off her debt, and at the same time she is confident that it will give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy candy, basic grains, oil, rice, sugar, soda, etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a single woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes to sell. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in an area with lots of customers and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy fabric, threads and other tailoring materials. Her business goal is to expand business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will open other businesses. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and other tailoring materials.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a 32 year old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 7 years to 14 years. She describes herself to be ambitious and determined. She operates a retail business where she sells cooking gas. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more gas cylinders. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will excel in business. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more gas cylinders.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a  Kiva borrower. She describes herself as experienced. She operates a money transfer business where she offers mobile phone-based money transfer services. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a viable location and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of capital. 

Rose will use the 100,000 KES loan to add float money for customer transactions. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add float money for customer transactions

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a 41 year old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 5 years to 20 years. She operates a farm where she grows tea. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in an area ideal for farming. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy fertilizer. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts to service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is a 47 year old woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells potatoes. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be storage problems. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of potatoes. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be happy. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of potatoes.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be very responsible. She operates a retail business where she sells bed sheets. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a residential place and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inflation of prices. She will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy more stock of bed sheets. Her business goal is to open a boutique within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will live a comfortable life. This is her fifth loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bed sheets.

loans.name: Diborah

texts.en: Diborah is a 36 year old married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be goal-oriented. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes to sell. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Her business is located in a viable location and her primary customers are loyal. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy fabric and other tailoring materials. Her business goal is to open another shop within 5 years. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more tailoring materials.

loans.use: to buy fabric and other tailoring materials.

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en:
Rahab is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as trustworthy. Rahab operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a very busy area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of sufficient capital. 

Rahab will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to be prosperous within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Kalama

texts.en:
Kalama is a 34-year-old married man. He has four children. He describes himself as ambitious. 

Kalama operates a retail business selling charcoal. He has been involved in this business for ten years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge as rain, which affects business. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of charcoal. His business goal is to own a supermarket within five years. He will use the anticipated profits to open a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more rice, pepper, fish, meat, oil, charcoal, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Kabita

texts.en:
Kabita is a married woman, 35 years old, living in Bhawanipatna, the district headquarter of the district of Kalahandi, Odisha, India. She lives with her only son, age about 8 years, and her husband. She is very energetic, hardworking and enthusiastic; she always devotes her time to getting her family ahead. 

Kabita has had her own beauty parlor in her house for the last 5 years. Before starting the beauty parlor, she was helping her husband in a cloth business. She took the training to be a professional beautician and started a parlor. Initially, she started the business with a low profile and limited investment. Gradually she expanded her business and added a few good quality chairs, big mirrors and all types of beauty cream and facial materials. Now she is earning about 6,000 Indian rupees (INR) per month from her business, which is very scanty to manage her family.

Kabita has already taken out loans from Mahashakti two times before.This will be her third loan. With this loan, she will purchase beauty creams, oils, facial items and new chairs. Kabita has a long cherished desire of having a beauty parlor at the market with the cloth shop of her husband.

loans.use: to purchase beauty creams, oils, facial items and new chairs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more red oil and vegetable oil for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more biscuits, candy, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Nathaly

texts.es:
Ella se llama Nathaly tiene 28 años y tomo la decisión de estudiar un curso como auxiliar de salud oral ya que para ella es muy importante superarse y poder ayudar a las demás personas, en cuanto a la atención que se le debe prestar a la cavidad bucal, también lo hace para mejorar la calidad de vida en un futuro cuando empiece a ejercer laboral mente y poder ayudar a la familia a  crecer en un ambiente donde se encuentre rodeado de buenos hábitos de higiene bucal y abrirse nuevos conocimientos  para que cada día tenga mas experiencia  sobre la Salud Oral y poder vivir mejor  económicamente.  
Ella necesita el convenio kiva para  tener más opciones y  para poder terminar con el estudio, para poder demostrar las capacidades que tiene como ser humano, además económicamente es de mucha importancia para ella que se le de esta clase de beneficios para así mismo lograr cumplir lo que desea, que es cumplir con una de las metas que se ha propuesto para tener un buen futuro profesional.
texts.en:
This is Nathaly. She is 28 years old and decided to study in a program to become an assistant in oral health, since for her it is very important to better herself and to be able to help other people. As for the attention that must be given to an oral cavity, she also does it to improve the quality of life in a future when she begins to work, to be able to help the family to grow in an atmosphere where it is surrounded by good oral hygiene habits, to tap into new knowledge so that every day she has more experience in oral health, and to be able to live better economically.

She needs the Kiva agreement in order to have more options and to be able to finish with the course, in order to be able to demonstrate the training that she has as a human being. In addition, it is economically of great importance for her that she be given this type of benefits in order to thus accomplish what she wants, which is to complete one of the goals that she has proposed in order to have a good professional future.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of educational fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 25 year old married woman. She has 6 children. She describes herself to be optimistic. She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes to sell. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a vibrant place and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be finances. 

Beatrice will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy fabric, threads and other tailoring materials. Her business goal is to have more sewing machines within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will open a tailoring school. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fabric, threads and other tailoring materials.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells mattresses. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a vibrant place and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

Beatrice will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy more stock of mattresses. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler of mattresses within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will build a permanent house. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of mattresses.

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en: Timothy is a 38 year old married man. He has 4 children with ages ranging from 3 years to 4 years. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a retail business where he sells and repairs electronics. His business is located in a market area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of electronic spare parts. His business goal is to become a supplier within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have improved life style. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of electronic spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of tea.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, overlock sewing machine, table and an iron.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 45 year old married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be visionary and focused. He operates a retail business where he offers photography and video services. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a promising place and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate financing. 

David will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy photography materials. His business goal is to be a successful camera man within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be a successful businessman.

loans.use: to buy photography materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more grocery products, a generator and to renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Jael

texts.en:
Jael is a 46 year old married woman. She has 2 children. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her primary customers are the general public. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. 

This is Jael's first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline is a 29 year old married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a vibrant place and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

Everline will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to own a big boutique within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will own a permanent house. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 33 year old married man. He describes himself to be focused and determined. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His primary customers are locals. 

James will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. His business goal is to excel within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. He will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: A loan of $ 2,500 helps Atheer to purchase fruits, vegetables and to renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Talaitaua

texts.en:
Talaitaua is a 73 year old married woman with 5 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, yams and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. 

Talaitaua has requested a loan to buy bush knives, a weed-sprayer, a wheelbarrow and chemicals. She has been a member of SBPD since 2013. With her profits, Talaitaua hopes to earn more money to support and help her family.

loans.use: to buy a weedsprayer, a wheelbarrow, bush knives and chemicals, etc.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena, 62 years old, lives in Lao Sta. Cruz, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao; Philippines. She was gifted with 3 children. Elena is engaged in the fishing business: her husband is a fisherman and they own a small fishing boat. 

In need of additional working capital, Elena decided to join Paglaum Cooperative. She has received several loans already and recently requested PHP 20,000 for cocoland redemption, of which she could use the land for planting an agricultural commodity to earn more income. Being a MIGS member (Member in Good Standing) of the cooperative, she has been able to manage her income. She is able to provide for the daily needs of her family. Elena is very thankful because if it were not for Paglaum, she might not have any savings at all, nor be guided properly in her finances. She hopes to own a four-wheel vehicle someday to use for delivering their catch and their agricultural products to all nearby towns.

loans.use: to redeem their pawned cocoland.

location.town: Plaridel-Lao Sta. Cruz, Plaridel, Misamis Occident

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
A $600.00 loan is offered to Francisca to improve her business. She is married and she has five children and she has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as scissors, bags and  kids games. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2002. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Francisca independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future. Her husband is a driver.

loans.use: to buy scissors, bags and  kids games.

loans.name: Djantognerela Group

texts.fr:
Djantognerela est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Koulikoro de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et ont au moins 5 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que des Habits, de Friperies et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur septième prêt de groupe. 
Mamine est un membre du groupe Djantognerela  debout au bout  à  gauche, est une vendeuse de Friperie. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter un Balle de friperie qu’elle vend en détail  à une clientèle diverse. Elle se procure de ses marchandises à Koutiala. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Djantognerela comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 190 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Mamine compte réaliser 205 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Djantognerela is a group of women who come from the Koulikoro neighborhood of Koutiala.  The members of the group know one another well and they all live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other relatives.  On average, they are 34 years old, with five children each.

This group of women sell various items such as clothes (new and used), and other goods.  In order to expand their businesses, they have decided to join the loan program offered by Soro Yiriwaso.  This is their seventh group loan.

Mamine, a member of the group, sells used clothing.  In the photo, she is the woman standing first from the left.  She is planning to use her loan to buy one bale of used clothes which she will resell on a retail basis to a diverse group of customers.  She purchases her merchandise in Koutiala.

While the other members of the group are expecting to make an average profit of 190,000 CFA francs each during this loan cycle, Mamine is expecting to make a profit of 205,000 CFA francs.  

The members of the group will use their earnings not only to repay their loans but also partly to cover their personal expenses and to increase their businesses.  They all wish to strengthen their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso in order to prevent a shortage of stocks.

loans.use: to buy used clothing.

loans.name: Muoi's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Muoi was born in 1980, is living with her husband and her two daughters in Mai Son district, Son La province. She has been a member of the Institution since January 2007.

Her family is living by cultivation and animal husbandry. Her family annual income is just enough for food and cover costs of her children’s education.  With her frugal nature, she can accumulate a small amount of money, and in 2013, she bought a hilly land to grow coffee.

Investment cost for coffee plantation is huge; including the purchase of organic fertilizers is essential.  So, she needs to borrow a loan for this purpose.  She wishes this loan would help coffee grow better, bring economic benefits to her family and help her earn money to prepare her children’s education at high levels.
Muoi and seven other members of the Group hope there will be a green village from coffee and bring the steady source of income for the local people.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers for coffee trees

loans.name: Hoang Tuoi's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Tuoi was born in 1973, her family has 5 members, including her husband and 3 children. Her eldest daughter married but still living with them, and her two sons are both obedient and laborious. 

Because of her family circumstances her oldest son just finished grade 7 before staying at home to support family, and the youngest son is in grade 12. 
 
Her main family income is animal husbandry, producing 3 herds of pig in a year. After minus the costs it is just enough to buy food to eat and save very little money. However, the child is in his senior year and the examination for university is coming soon that causes more expense for the family. In addition to animal husbandry, she and her husband also go to work for other families by cutting weeds and till the fields to cover her family living costs.

To prepare for the extraordinary learning costs incurring, she looks for an on-time support from individuals and organizations to her youngest son for a full education so he can have a brighter future than her two other children who were more disadvantaged in life. She and her family promise to try more to be able to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: to pay for her child's education

loans.name: Nhan's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Nhan was born in 1982, is the Kinh national ethnic person. In 2009, on the way to pick up her child at school, her husband got accident and died on the way to the hospital. So, she now lives with her 8 year-old daughter only.

With the hilly land of her family, she wakes up early and stays up late to care for bud tea trees, but it is just enough to cover food and her daughter’s education costs. Despite her efforts to feed her daughter by herself, she still has not enough money to improve quality of soil and improve crop yield with the hope to have money for her daughter growth-up and education.

She wants to borrow this loan to buy organic fertilizers for getting high yield from tea trees.  Her family’s economy and 4 other members families will more develop with stable incomes.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Phuoc's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Phuoc is 32 years old now, and her family lives in Mai Son district, Son La province. She married at the age of 19 and now have one beautiful little girl. 
	
Her family's main income is cultivation and animal husbandry. Therefore, the accumulated little money is not enough to rebuild the toilet and water tank for cooking and drinking, so she has to borrow more.
	
She has plans for raising money for the repayment period on time in accordance with regulations. She expected more of the loan amount will somewhat improve the lives of family activities and contributing to a clean environment of the village.
	
Phuoc is currently the leader of group with 3 members. Almost all members and local villagers are in this movement of building water tank to clean water and repairing their toilets to improve the general environment of the area.

loans.use: to rebuild the toilet and water tank for cooking and drinking

loans.name: Van's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Van was born in 1990, is living with her husband and two children in Mai Son district, Son La province. Her eldest daughter is now 4 years old and her youngest son is 2 years old. Despite her young age, but she has been being involved in the Institution for 5 years.

The main income of the couple is cultivation on two main industrial trees at local are  high yielding cassava and coffee, therefore, it is just enough to eat and feed their two little children. Every year, she tries to save money to invest for the next seasons. She wants to expand the area of cultivation, but not have enough money to buy organic fertilizers to complete her desire.

She hopes this loan will improve her family income, and her children can have good living conditions. She will work harder and work for other families to earn money to repay for the Institution on time. She serves as a group leader.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers

loans.name: Rosa Elba

texts.es: Rosa tiene 36 años de edad y reside junto a su esposo, dos hijos de 16 y 3 años y su hija de 9 años de edad. Rosa se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos desde hace mucho tiempo. De esta forma colabora con los gastos del hogar y junto a su esposo mantienen la economía del hogar. Rosa y su esposo desean terminar su vivienda dado que por falta de recursos económicos no han logrado comprar los materiales para la construcción del techo y esta es la razón por la cual solicitan este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y plines para construir el techo de la vivienda lo entes posible.
texts.en:
Rosa is 36 years old and lives with her husband, her two sons, ages 16 and 3, and her daughter, age 9. Rosa has worked providing domestic services for a long time. This activity allows her to help with the household expenses, and along with her husband, they both bring all the economic support to the house. 

Rosa and her husband wish to finish building their house. Because of the lack of economic resources, they haven’t been able to buy the needed materials for the construction of the roof. This is the reason why they are requesting a loan from FUSAI, which they will use to purchase galvanized sheet and poles, so they can start as soon as possible with the construction.

loans.use: to buy: galvanized sheet and poles to build the roof of her house.

loans.name: Juana Candelaria

texts.es: Juana de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a vender licuados en su lugar de residencia ya tiene mucha clientela pues vende sus productos a un buen precio con las ventas que realiza logra obtener buenas ganancias que le sirven para cubrir los gastos de su hogar y otras necesidades que se le puedan presentar, Juana solicita un crédito para poder comprar mas ingredientes para prepara sus licuados como: naranjas, guineos(bananos), melón, fresas, zanahorias, leche, huevos, azúcar, etc. ya que últimamente ha tenido mucha demanda y así obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia un mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juana, 38, owns the home where she lives with her husband. She sells smoothies out of her home and has a lot of customers because she sells them at a fair price. She makes a good profit that helps her cover the household expenses and other necessities that arise.

Juana asks for a loan to buy more smoothie ingredients like oranges, bananas, melons, strawberries, carrots, milk, eggs, sugar, etc because demand has been high lately. She wants to earn more money so that she can give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy oranges, bananas, melons, strawberries, carrots, milk, eggs, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Ndèye Oury Ba

texts.fr: Ndeye Oury est une promotrice qui habite à coté du guichet. Elle est mariée et mère de famille, elle évolue dans la commercialisation des produits textiles  et  a une expérience de plus de 20ans sur cette activité. Elle sollicite ca montant pour acheter des textiles comme les bazins, les tissus pour homme pour les revendre à ses clients.  Elle prend en charges les dépenses quotidiennes de ses enfants car son mari ne travaille plus. Elle démarre ses journées à partir de 8h pour les finir vers les couts de 19h. Elle veut importer une grande quantité de tissus pour les vendre en gros et ouvrir un grand magasin. Ainsi elle pourra  prendre le monopole dans le marché et diversifier ses produits. De ce fait elle va augmenter ses revenus et épargner de l’argent.
texts.en: Ndeye Oury is an entrepreneur who lives close to one of the local branches of the UIMCEC.  She is married and has a family.  She sells fabrics and has more than 20 years of experience in her business.  She is requesting this loan to buy textiles such as damask and men's fabrics.  She will resell her goods to her customers.   Since her husband is no longer working, Ndeye Ouri is the one who manages her children's daily expenses.   She works from 8AM until about 7PM.  She wants to import large quantities of fabrics to resell in bulk, and would also like to open a large store.  This will allow her to have a monopoly at the market and to diversify her goods.  Thanks to this loan, she will increase her income and save some money.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for men and women.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Djekafo est un regroupement de femmes de Koutiala qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 37 ans et ont au moins 5 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, de Bananes  youyou, Riz, Tomates, teinture et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso pour la première fois. 
Ami qui est un membre du groupe Djekafo  debout au bout à  gauche, est une teinturière. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des produits nécessaire (indigo, colories, potasses) pour la teinture de bazin de toutes couleurs à la  demande de la clientèle. Elle se procure de ces produits au grand marché. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Djekafo comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 95 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Ami compte réaliser  105 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
Djekafo is a group of women who come from Koutiala and live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other relatives. On average, they are 37 years old, with at least five children each.

This group of women sell various items such as bananas, fritters, rice, tomatoes, dyes and other various items.  In order to expand their businesses, they have decided to join the loan program offered by Soro Yiriwaso. This is their first group loan.

Ami, a member of the group, is involved in textile dyeing. In the photo, she is the woman standing first from the left. She is planning to use her loan to buy the supplies she needs (indigo, dyes, potassium hydroxide) to dye damask fabrics in a variety of colors, according to the demand of her customers'.  She buys her merchandise at the Grand Market.

While the other members of the group are expecting to make an average profit of 95,000 CFA francs each during this loan cycle, Ami is expecting to make a profit of 105,000 CFA francs.

The members of the group will use their earnings not only to repay their loans but also in part to cover their personal expenses and to increase their businesses.

loans.use: to buy textile dyeing supplies.

loans.name: Deysi Del Carmen

texts.es: Deysi de 57 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, es muy conocida en la zona donde reside por su humildad y su entrega al trabajo, nunca se ha dejado vencer y siempre ha salido adelante con sus dificultades. Con esfuerzo y dedicación posee una tienda en la que vende productos de primera necesidad, es muy dedicada a su labor y muy servicial a la hora de vender, es por eso que posee clientes que la buscan y la prefieren por sus productos. Se ha visto en la necesidad de surtir un poco mas la tienda debido al aumento de demanda y no tiene el capital para realizarlo, es por eso que la clienta solicita un crédito para comprar más productos como granos básicos, producto instantáneo, golosinas, bebidas, etc. Confía en Dios de que pronto la ayuda solicitada, será otorgada, y no tendrá más preocupación que llevar el sustento diario a su hogar.
texts.en: Deysi, 57, lives in her own home with her husband. She is well known in the area for her humility and her dedication to her work. She has never let herself be beaten and always has come out ahead of difficult situations. With effort and dedication, she owns a store where she sells basic daily goods. She is committed to her work and is ready to serve, which is why she has customers who seek her out and prefer her products. She sees the need to stock her store a little more because of increasing demand, but she doesn't have the capital to do it. Because of this, she asks for a loan to buy more products like grains, quick foods like instant soups, snacks, drinks, etc. She trusts in God that help will be given to her and she won't have to worry anymore about how to sustain her home day to day.

loans.use: to buy more products like grains, fast foods, snacks, drinks, etc

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo is 55 years old, married, and a resident of Cartagena Proper, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao, Philippines. He earns a living through raising livestock such as pigs, chicken, cattle, ducks, and other animals.

Ricardo has been a member of PMPC for 2 years and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the Cooperative. He is now applying a loan of 14,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy feed for his livestock.

He deeply wishes to remain a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to buy feed for his livestock

loans.name: Kotognonkontala Group

texts.fr:
Kotognonkontala est un regroupement de femmes du quartier  Médina Coura de la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 39 ans et ont au moins 3 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, de Savon, Pommes de terre, Tasse, Friperie  et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso pour la première fois. 
Djeneba deuxième personne assise de la gauche vers la droite compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter un Balle de friperie qu’elle vend en détail  à une clientèle diverse. Elle se procure au grand marché. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Kotognonkontala comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 90 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Djeneba compte réaliser  100 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
Kotognonkontala is a group of women who come from the Médina Coura neighborhood of the city of Koutiala.  The members of the group know one another well and live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other relatives. On average, they are 39 years old, with at least three children each.

This group of women sell various items such as soap, potatoes, cups, used clothing and others. In order to expand their businesses, they have decided to join the loan program offered by Soro Yiriwaso. This is their first group loan.

Djeneba, second from the left in the front row, is planning to use her loan to buy a bale of used clothing which she will resell on a retail basis to a diverse group of customers.  She buys her merchandise at the Grand Market.

While the other members of the group are expecting to make an average profit of 90,000 CFA francs each during this loan cycle, Djeneba is expecting to make a profit of 100,000 CFA francs.

The members of the group will use their earnings not only to repay their loans but also to cover their personal expenses and to increase their businesses.

loans.use: to buy used clothing.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en: The featured micro-entrepreneur is Aileen. She is 36 years old, is married, and lives in Tamban, Baliangao.  She has a coco farm and earns a promising income of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month. She signed up for membership with Paglaum MPC in 2007. Recently, she reached out to Paglaum for a loan to buy farm inputs. She also plans to use Paglaum to save the profit earned from her business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

location.town: Calamba-Tamban Punta Miray Baliangao Misamis Occid

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Soutoura est un regroupement de femmes de Koutiala qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 37 ans et ont au moins 4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, de Bananes, Arachide, Pagnes, Poissons (fumé et frais), Mil, Pomme de terre, Charbon de bois, Friperie  et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso pour la première fois. 
Awa,  deuxième personne assise de la gauche vers la droite, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des paniers poissons fumés au fur et à mesure qu’elle vend en détail  à une clientèle diverse. Elle se procure au grand marché. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Soutoura comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 95 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Awa compte réaliser  110 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Soutoura is a group of women who come from Koutiala and live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other relatives. On average, they are 37 years old, with at least four children each.

This group of women sell various items such as bananas, groundnut, pagnes (traditional African fabrics), fish (smoked and fresh), millet, potatoes, charcoal, used clothing etc.   In order to expand their businesses, they have decided to join the loan program offered by Soro Yiriwaso. This is their first group loan.

Awa, second from the left in the front row, is planning to use her loan to buy  some baskets of smoked fish which she will gradually resell on a retail basis to a diverse group of customers. She buys her merchandise at the Grand Market.

While the other members of the Soutoura group are expecting to make an average profit of 95,000 CFA francs each during this loan cycle, Awa is expecting to make a profit of 110,000 CFA francs.

The members of the group will use their earnings not only to repay their loans but also to cover their personal expenses and to increase their businesses.  They wish to strengthen their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso in order to prevent a shortage of stocks.

loans.use: to buy smoked fish.

loans.name: Prescilla

texts.en:
Prescilla is 46 years old and lives in Lumbia, Pagadian City. She is married with five children.

To earn a living, Prescilla has a business selling balut and pugo (quail eggs). She earns about PHP 9,000 each month doing this type of work. Prescilla has requested a loan to buy additional balut and pugo to sell.

Prescilla has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she would like to build a store for her business.

loans.use: to buy additional balut and pugo (quail eggs) to sell

loans.name: Maria De Lourdes

texts.es: Maria de 34 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hijo quien es menor de edad. Maria tiene un negocio de venta de ropa usada ó de segunda, en donde ofrece variedad de prendas de vestir como: faldas, vestidos, blusas, pantalones, etc. ubicado en su lugar de residencia, en  una zona muy transitada y conocida por los habitantes del municipio. El puesto de Maria es muy visitado ya que las personas siempre encuentran lo que buscan, la amabilidad y el buen trato es lo más importante. Su sueño es ver crecer su negocio por lo que ha decidido hacer un préstamo a INTEGRAL para poder comprar más fardos de ropa usada y tener más variedad de prendas de vestir Como: pantalones, faldas, blusas, camisetas, shorts, entre otros. Con el propósito de atraer a más compradores y lograr un mayor nivel de ventas así como un mayor nivel de ingresos para tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria is 34 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and their young son. Maria has a business selling used and second-hand clothes, offering a variety of items such as skirts, dresses, blouses, pants, etc., out of her home, which is in a busy and well-known area of town. Her sales post is visited often because people always find what they are looking for, and because of Maria's friendliness and, most importantly, customer service. Her dream is to grow her business, which is why she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Apoyo Integral to purchase more packages of used clothing in order to have a wider selection of pants, skirts, blouses, T-shirts, shorts and others articles. Her goal is to attract more buyers and achieve a higher level of sales and income so she and her family can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more packages of used clothing such as pants, skirts, blouses, T-shirt, shorts and other items.

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es: Dora de 33 años de edad es una persona muy trabajadora, quien se dedica de lleno a su negocio, todo con el único deseo de salir adelante y de esta manera brindarle una vida mejor a su familia. Dora vive con su grupo familiar en casa propia. Ella posee una venta de frutas y verduras, la cual esta ubicada en el mercado que esta cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, ella solicita un préstamo para poder comprar papayas, guineos, peñas, aguacates, mangos, etc. ya que de esta manera ella podrá vender más, lo cual es su prioridad, para darle una vida mejor a su familia
texts.en: Dora is 33 years old and a very hardworking woman who devotes herself completely to her business, all with the sole desire to make headway and provide a better life to her family. Dora lives with her family in her own home. She has had a post selling fruits and vegetables at the market near her home for a number of years. She is requesting the loan to purchase papayas, bananas, avocados, mangos, etc., to increase her sales, which is her priority, in order to give her family a better life.

loans.use: to purchase papayas, bananas, avocados, mangos, etc.

loans.name: Melchorita

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Melchorita works hard to support her family.

She has a furniture making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling firewood. Melchorita is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like wood, paints, nails, etc  for her furniture making business.

Melchorita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like wood, paints, nails, etc

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Gina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is taking a loan of $600 to improve her second-hand clothng business, which helps her to generate income for her family. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $300.

She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as shirts, long pants and shorts.  

She is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy shirts, long pants and shorts

loans.name: Adama's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe crée depuis Décembre 2011, est constitué de 30 membres qui habitent tous dans la même zone. Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Adama qui se trouve debout à l’extrême droite de la photo et levant le bras,est âgée de 50 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants dont 01 garçon et 03 filles. Elle évolue dans le commerce de fonio, d'arachide,de maïs, de bissap et de piment.

Avec son financement, elle compte acheter 02 sacs d'arachides à 10000f l'un, 01 sac de maïs à 12000f et le reste sera destiné à l'achat du fonio.

les objectifs visés pour son bénéfice sont de subvenir aux besoins de ces enfants et aider son mari dans la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
This group was founded in December 2011 and is made up of 30 members who all live in the same area.  Their main business activity is retail sales.

Adama (standing on the far right of the photo, with her hand raised) is 50 years old.  She is married and has four children, one son and three daughters.  She sells fonio (a type of millet), peanuts, maize, hibiscus flowers (used to make a drink) and chillies.

Adama will use her loan to buy two sacks of peanuts for 10,000 francs CFA each, one sack of maize for 12,000 francs CFA and the rest will be used to buy fonio.  She intends to use her profits to provide for the needs of her children and help her husband with the expenses of their household.

loans.use: to buy fonio, peanuts and maize for resale.

loans.name: Luz De Maria

texts.es: Doña Luz de 43 años de edad, viven en casa propia con su esposo quien tienen una peluquería cerca de su residencia, Ella posee una tienda de productos comestibles como pan, refrescos, aceites, verduras, frutas, golosinas y también de primera necesidad como: jabón y shampoo entre otras cosas tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación. Doña Luz solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir aún más la tienda de manera que pueda atender mejor a sus clientes y de esta misma forma mejorar sus ventas lo cual es su prioridad para sacar adelante su hogar.
texts.en: Luz is 43 years old and lives in her own home with her husband. They run a hair salon out of their home. Luz also has a general store in the home, selling foods such as bread, drinks, oils, vegetables, fruits and snacks as well as primary-need articles such as soap and shampoo. Luz is requesting the loan in order to stock her store even more so she can better tend to her customers and increase her sales, which is her priority in order to make headway for her family.

loans.use: to purchase bread, drinks, oils, vegetables, fruits, snacks, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: May Lani

texts.en:
May Lani is 30 years old and lives in San Jose, Pagadian City. She is married with 1 child.

May Lani has an internet cafe and earns PHP 30,000 each month doing this type of business. She has requested a loan to buy additional computer units for her internet cafe.

She has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, she hopes to expand her business in another barangay (district).

loans.use: to buy additional computer units for her internet cafe

location.town: Pagadian - San Jose District, Pagadian City

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy shoes, bags, hair ties and slippers

loans.name: Laysa

texts.en:
Laysa is 28 years old, married with 5 school-aged children and lives in Calamba-Del Pilar, Baliangao, Mis. Occ.  

She has been engaged in flower vending for 5 years. In need of capital, she joined Paglaum this year and has applied for a loan to purchase flower fertilizers.  

The profit that she earns from this business will be used to pay for her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase flower fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farming supplies to tend to her coffee crops.

loans.name: Rochelle

texts.en:
Rochelle is 32 years old and married.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like snack foods, sugar, soap, canned goods and other groceries.

Rochelle has borrowed and paid back 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from pre-paid mobile load.

Rochelle aspires to saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like snack foods, sugar, soap, canned goods and other groceries

loans.name: Menalyn

texts.en:
Menalyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling ginger in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional baskets of ginger to sell for her business buying and selling ginger.

Menalyn has been in this business for three years. She earns more income from furniture making.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional baskets of ginger to sell

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 39 years old and married.

She earns a living by farming citrus in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farming supplies.

Perla has been farming citrus for five years and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farming supplies

loans.name: Badegna Group

texts.fr:
BADEGNA est un  groupe  constitué de  6 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles nucléaires dans le quartier  HEREMAKONO NORD de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 5ème prêt. Les quatre précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  chaussures à l’image de MAÏMOUNA qui est la seule femme assise  dans la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 80 paires  de chaussures  avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Badegna group consists of six married women who on average are 32 years old with three children. They live in nuclear families in the North Heremakono neighborhood of Bougouni.

They became acquainted through neighborhood ties, friendship and commerce. To strengthen their financial capacity so they can better conduct business, they joined the Soro Yiriwaso institution where they are on their fifth loan. The four previous loans have been repaid in full.

This group of women trades shoes like Maïmouna who is the only woman sitting in the photo. She intends to use her loan to buy 80 pairs of shoes from wholesalers in Bougouni. She conducts her retail sales at the market and at home, for cash and on credit, to a mixed clientele.

She expects to attain average monthly profits of 20,000 CFA francs to be reinvested in the business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: buy shoes

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJIGUIYA est constitué de cinq femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 27 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles nucléaires dans le quartier  HEREMAKONO NORD de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 4ème prêt. Les trois précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait de la restauration à l’image de BINTA qui est la femme assise devant  dans la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, cent kg de fonio, vingt kg de poissons frais et vingt Kg de grains d’arachide avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Djiguiya group consists of five married women who on average are 27 years old with three children. They live in nuclear families in the North Heremakono neighborhood of Bougouni.

They became acquainted through neighborhood ties, friendship and commerce. To strengthen their financial capacity to better conduct their business, they joined the Soro Yiriwaso institution where they are on their fourth loan. The three previous loans have been fully repaid. 

This group of women prepares food like Binta, who is the woman sitting in the front of the picture. She intends to use her loan to buy one hundred kilos of fonio, twenty kilos of fresh fish and twenty kilos of peanuts from wholesalers in Bougouni. She conducts her retail sales at the market and at home, for cash and on credit, to a mixed clientele.

She hopes to attain average monthly profits of 25,000 CFA francs, to be reinvested in the business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: buy ingredients for food preparations

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    BENKAN est constitué de six femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le quartier  MASSABLACOURA de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 6ème prêt. Les cinq précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  condiments à l’image de ROKIA qui est la 4ème femme debout  dans la photo de la droite vers la gauche. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, neuf paniers de tomates, deux cent cinquante kg de potirons et cent cinquante kg de choux avec les grossistes  de Sikasso. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Benkan Group is made up of six married women who are, on average, 31 years old and have four children.  They all live in traditional, extended families in the Massablacoura neighbourhood of the town of Bougouni.  They know one another through friendship, business and neighbourhood connections.

The members all want to improve their business performance so they work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their sixth loan.  The previous loans were all fully and correctly repaid.

Rokia (standing fourth from the right in the photo) sells food ingredients.  She will use her loan to buy nine baskets of tomatoes, 250 kilos of pumpkins and 150 kilos of cabbages from wholesalers in Sikasso.  She sells her goods at the market and from door to door, to various customers on a cash or credit basis.  Rokia expects to earn an average of 35,000 francs CFA a month, and will use this money to invest in her business and repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients for resale.

loans.name: Adjelevi

texts.fr: Agée de 50ans, madame Adjélévi se bat chaque fois pour donner le meilleur d'elle - même à sa famille. Pour cela, elle revend des habits depuis 1985 et s'approvisionne au Grand Marché de Lomé. Pour répondre aux besoins des clients, elle fait son cinquiéme crédit à WAGES pour acheter plus de marchandises. A l'avenir, elle espère améliorer son niveau de vie et permettre à la famille de s'épanouir. Elle est mariée à un électricien.
texts.en:
Adjélévi is a 50-year-old woman who always gives the best of herself.  She works hard to support her family.  In order to do this, she has been selling clothes since 1985.  She buys her supplies at the main market in Lomé. 

Adjélévi works with the field partner, Wages, to improve her business and respond to the demands of her customers.  This will be her fifth loan and she will use it to buy stock for her shop.

In the future, Adjélévi would like to increase her family's standard of living and make them all more comfortable.  She is married to an electrician.

loans.use: to buy jewellery and ready-to-wear clothing for sale in her shop.

loans.name: Mariama Penda's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe crée depuis Décembre 2012, est constitué de 18 membres qui sont tous dans la même localité. Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Binta qui se trouve debout a l’extrême droite de la photo et levant le bras,est âgée de 38 ans,est mariée et mère de 07 enfants dont 04 garçons et 03 filles.

Avec son financement,elle compte acheter 05 sacs de fonio a 25000f le sac.

les objectifs visés pour son bénéfice sont de contribuer dans la dépense quotidienne et la prise en charge familiale et aussi renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
This group, created in December 2012, consists of 18 members who are all from the same locality. Their main activity is trade.

Binta, who is standing at the far right of the photo and raising her arm, is 38 years old, married and the mother of seven children of whom four are boys and three are girls. 

With her funding she plans to buy five bags of fonio at 25,000 francs per bag. 

Her objectives for using the profits are to contribute towards daily expenditures and family care, and also to bolster her savings.

loans.use: buy goods

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes is 65 years old and lives in Tamban, Punta Miray, Baliangao. She is married with three adult-aged children. She has been engaged in coco farming for five years doing this type of work.  She joined Paglaum in 2001 and earns the amount of 7,000 every harvest of coco. She applied for a loan to purchase fertilizer and farm inputs. Lourdes hopes to improve their living conditions in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase  fertilizer and farm inputs

location.town: Calamba-Tamban Punta Miray Baliangao Misamis Occid

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business farming rice in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizer for her business farming rice.

Nida has been in this business for four years. She earns more income from a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now is requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Nida has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Lorenca

texts.en: Lorenca is taking a loan of $1,500 to improve her business. She is married and she has six children. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, such as body lotion, oils, sugar, salt, shampoo and soap. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $200. Lorenca is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy body lotion, oils, sugar, salt, shampoo and soap.

loans.name: Lalyn

texts.en:
Lalyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business farming rice in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizer and other farm equipment for her business farming rice.

Lalyn has been in this business for eight years. She earns more income from food vending.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm equipment

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Antonina is 48 years old and lives in Kinangay Norte Clarin Mis Occ. She is married and has three school-aged children.

Antonina has a sari-sari store business that supports her family and she has been doing this for five years. She has requested a loan to pay for the tuition fee of her daughter. Antonina has been a member of PMPC for  two years. In the future, Antonina hopes to expand her business and will be happy to see all her children earn their degrees.

loans.use: to pay for the tuition fee of her daughter.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy telephone charge cards and fabric for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy products for sale in her hardware shop.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is 51 years old and lives in Segatic Daku Clarin Mis Occ. She is a widow with two adult-age children.

Cecelia has a retail business of different merchandise and earns approximately PHP 6000 each month doing this type of business. She has a requested a loan to purchase materials for house repair.

Cecelia has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Cecelia hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials for house repair

loans.name: Armelita

texts.en:
Armelita is 51 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a 26,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Armelita has borrowed and paid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and sell charcoal business for three years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Loselyn

texts.en:
Loselyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who farms rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to pays for laborers' salaries in farm preparation.

Loselyn has been in this business for three years, and earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to pay for laborers' salaries in farm preparation.

loans.name: Erika Andrea

texts.es:
Ella es Erika Andrea y desea contar  los objetivos que desea alcanzar con el programa Cosmetología y Estética Integral que actualmente se encuentra estudiando en la institución.
Escogió esta carrera porque considera que es un excelente medio para ayudar a personas con diversos problemas o inconformidades personales, de forma que se sienten consentidos, adquieren tranquilidad y se sienten más a gusto con aquellas inconformidades o problemas que opacan la vida. 
Con este programa desea en el futuro incentivar y ayudar a las personas que tiene problemas de autoestima respecto a lo físico y salud mental, de igual forma también aplicar el arte en este objetivo a través de actividades como teatro, danza, pintura y escultura, entre otras.
Solicita el subsidio por que los gastos son altos ya que estudia Negocios en la tarde, el subsidio le servirá para invertir el restante en las fotocopias, trabajos en general y transportes.
texts.en:
This is Erika Andrea who wants to tell us about the goals she wishes to reach through a Cosmetology and Integral Esthetics program that she is currently studying.

She chose this career because she believes it is an excellent way to help people with diverse personal problems and issues, so they will feel better about themselves and more comfortable with their situation.  With this program she hopes to encourage and help people in the future with their self-esteem problems surrounding their physical or mental health.  She also wants to apply this program's art activities such as theater, dance, painting and sculpture, among others.

She is requesting a loan to cover the high costs she has, because she also studies business in the afternoons.  The loan will help pay for photocopies and general work and transportation costs.

loans.use: To pay one semester of school costs.

loans.name: La Paix Virunga Group

texts.fr: La cliente Rukara est une commerçante et membre de la banque communautaire «La paix Virunga», entrepreneur, âgée de 50 ans, mariée et mère de12 enfants, qui  9 étudient et 3 autres sont  déjà maries. Elle est une vendeuse des légumes et épices. Elle installe sa marchandise au marché central de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu de ses familiers. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le  prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 20 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Son conjoint est sans emploi. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter des oignons, citrons, ails, aubergines, poivrons, concombres, des amarantes, choux, etc. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. En définitif, elle remercie  fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs exclues de système bancaire classique, surtout; pendant ce moment difficile  poste conflits à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Rukara is a retail merchant and a member of the "La Paix Virunga" communal bank. She is a 50-year-old entrepreneur, married with 12 children, of whom nine attend school and three are already married. She is a vendor of vegetables and spices.

She displays her goods at the central market of the city. She first started her business with capital received from family. Later she was granted a loan from the Hekima MFI. She has been performing that activity for the past 20 years. Her spouse is unemployed.

This new loan will serve to buy onions, lemons, garlic, eggplant, peppers, cucumbers, amaranth, cabbage, etc.

She wants to educate, clothe and feed her children. Finally, she wishes to thank Hekima for empowering women entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system, especially during this difficult post-conflict period in the Eastern part of the country.

loans.use: buy onions, lemons, garlic, eggplant, peppers, cucumbers, amaranth, cabbage, etc.

loans.name: Chanda

texts.en:
Chanda, 39 years old, is from Jarmundi. She is married and a mother of three children: two sons and a daughter who go to school. 
Jarmundi village is located at Deoghar, Jharkhand. The population has been increasing for the last decade in this place and so is the number of houses. Hence, there is a good demand for mason work. 

Her husband is a mason who has been doing this work for the last 10 years and earns INR 9,000 per month. From agriculture, he earns INR 15,000 per annum and the family even does goat rearing from which they earn INR 5,000 per annum.
 
Now, the family is finding it difficult to meet their expenses. Chanda wants to help her husband in his business. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy different equipment for construction (roofing). Chanda wants to save enough money for her children's education and for their bright future.

loans.use: to buy different equipment for construction

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cosmetic products for resale.

loans.name: Griselda Beatriz

texts.es: Griselda tiene 23 años de edad y habita junto a su madre y hermanos en casa familiar. Griselda se gana la vida mediante la elaboración y venta de tortillas en su hogar de residencia. Griselda es una joven responsable y trabajadora quien desea mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del techo de la vivienda y para repellar las paredes de un cuarto para lo cual necesita comprar materiales como: lámina galvanizada, polines, arena y cemento.
texts.en: Griselda, 23, lives with her mother and siblings in the family home.  She earns a living making and selling tortillas from home.  Griselda is a responsible, hard-working young woman who wants better living conditions.  She has decided to request a loan through FUSAI to repair the roof of her home and plaster the walls of one of the rooms.  She needs to buy materials such as metal sheeting, beams, sand and cement.

loans.use: To buy metal sheeting, beams, sand and cement to repair the roof of her house, and to plaster the walls of one of the rooms.

loans.name: Massan

texts.fr: Massan femme de 51ans exerce comme activité la vente des pagnes, des casseroles et tapette au marché. Ayant de nombreux clients et ne voulant pas les décevoir, elle sollicite un second crédit à WAGES pour acheter plus de marchandises afin d'atteindre ses objectifs. Elle espère à l'avenir réinvestir dans l'activité et s'occuper de sa famille. Elle est mariée et mère de famille.
texts.en:
Massan is a 51-year-old woman whose business is to sell pagnes (colorful West-African fabric), pots and flip-flops at the market.

As she does not want to disappoint her numerous customers, she is requesting a second credit loan from WAGES to buy more goods and meet her objectives.

She hopes in the future to reinvest in the business and take care of her family. She is a married mother.

loans.use: To buy 25 handbags, fabrics and pagnes, 20 pairs of shoes, and various other items

loans.name: Mariama's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes, qui sont des amies et résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe Mariama (celle dont la main est levée sur la photo) âgée de 46 ans n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Mariama est mariée à un électricien auto nommé Sébastin. Le couple a cinq enfants, dont certains scolarisés et trois à leur charge. Mariama vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Pour ce faire, Mariama vend des œufs par la technique de livraison et son à son domicile depuis vingt ans environ. Mariama s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Mariama ensemble avec les membres de son groupe sollicite pour la deuxième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three friends who all live in the same neighbourhood.  The group representative is Mariama (seen in the photo with her hand raised).  She is 46 years old and did not attend school.  She is married to an electrician called Sébastin and they have five children, some of whom currently attend school.  They are still responsible for three of their children.  Mariama lives with her husband and their children and between them they provide for the expenses of their household.

Mariama has been selling eggs for 20 years now.  She sells them from her home and also delivers them.  She buys her supplies at a market in Benin.

In order to satisfy the demands of their customers, the members of the group work with the field partner, Alidé.  This will be their second loan, the previous loan was fully and correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy trays of eggs for resale.

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is a very energetic woman who completed a beauty course and opened a beauty parlor five years ago in Jarmundi village, Deoghar, Jharkhand. There is a good demand for beauticians, especially during wedding seasons. She earns around INR 6,000 per month. 

Rani is married and the mother of three children: two sons and a daughter who are all studying in school. Her husband is a driver and he earns INR 5,000 per month. Since there is lot of competition in her locality, Rani wants to buy parlour equipment and expand her business to attract customers for which she is seeking a loan of INR 15,000. Her daughter also helps her in this business. Rani also conducts training programs and provides job opportunities to other women in her village.

Rani hopes to save enough for her children’s education and for their future. She also wants to buy a four-wheeler for her husband so that he can start a car rental business.

loans.use: to buy beauty parlor equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm suppliers for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Maria Binda

texts.es:
María Binda tiene 38 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el Caserío el Tongo, una zona rural del Distrito de La Matanza, es un lugar donde sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio cuenta con servicios básicos como son agua y luz, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.
