Ella se dedica a la venta de chicha de jora y comida, actividad que realiza hace más de 03 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, contando con clientela fija, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de maíz amarillo para la preparación de chicha de jora, sacos de azúcar y variedad de pescados para la preparación de piqueos y de esta manera ofrecer en mayor cantidad a sus clientes para generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Binda, 38, lives with her husband and children in Caserío el Tongo, a rural area in the district of La Matanza.  It is a place where the locals work in agriculture, livestock farming and commerce.  It has basic utilities such as water and electricity, and is located in the province of Morropon which belongs to the Piura Region along the northern coast of Peru.

Maria sells "chicha de jora" (a corn-based drink) and food, and has been in business for over three years.  She works out of her home and says she has a fixed customer base.  The loan she is requesting, for 2,000 PEN, is to buy yellow corn to make chicha de jora, sacks of sugar and a variety of fish to make little snacks.  This will allow her to offer more to her customers and generate more income for the family.

loans.use: To buy corn to make "chicha de jora" (corn drink), sacks of sugar and a variety of fish.

loans.name: Nilima

texts.en:
Nilima is an entrepreneurial woman who lives with her family in Jarmundi village in Deoghar, Jharkhand. She is married and has two daughters and a son who are studying at the nearby school. Her husband is running a sweet shop.
 
Nilima has a small grocery shop. Being an enterprising woman, she decided to expand her grocery store, which will help her to improve the family income, as it was difficult to feed the family and to provide education for her children, too. Now, she earns a gross profit on an average of INR 400 per day. From agriculture, she earns an average gross profit of INR 28,000 per annum and from dairy, she earns INR 4,000 per month, which has made their life a little easier. However, her struggle to provide good living is yet far from over, as another grocery shop beside the road is giving her tough competition.

She, along with her husband, wants to diversify her business by providing more alternatives to her customer and improve the service. Hence, she wants to borrow INR 15,000 to buy rice, wheat, oil etc in bulk. She hopes to save enough for her children’s education and her daughter’s wedding.

loans.use: to buy rice, wheat and oil in bulk

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 48 years old and lives in Lutao, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children, who are now at their adult age. 

Fe has been engaged in fish “bagoong” processing and hog raising for years and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She is also supported by her husband who is a fisherman. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing construction materials for house repairs and renovations.  

Fe has been a member of PMPC for almost three years. In the future, she hopes to expand her hog-raising business.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for house repairs and renovations.

loans.name: Napthali

texts.en:
Napthali is 28 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is married with two children, who are now of school age.
 
Napthali has has been operating a rice mill and a little piggery business for two years. His wife works with him as the managing partner. He is also employed as a seaman. They earn approximately PHP15,000.00 each month doing this type of work. 

He has requested a loan to be used to purchase 50 sacks of rice palay for his drying, milling, wholesaling and retailing business. 

Napthali has been a member of PMPC since last year. In the future, Napthali hopes to expand his family's business.

loans.use: to purchase 50 sacks of rice palay for his drying, milling, wholesaling and retailing business.

loans.name: Babylyn

texts.en:
Babylyn is 40 years old and married with three children, who are in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Babylyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to pay for the laborers' salaries for harvesting rice. Babylyn has been farming rice for three years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to pay for the laborers' salaries for harvesting rice.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is 37 years old and is married with four children, three of whom are in school.

Cherry works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a general store in the Philippines for three years and earns additional income from buying and selling crabs. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her store, like snack foods, sugar, soap, shampoo, canned goods, etc . Cherry has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Cherry aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her store, like snack foods, sugar, soap, shampoo, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Ro-Ann

texts.en:
Ro-Ann is 23 years old and has two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like snack foods, sugar, soap, shampoo and other groceries. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Ro-Ann has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

Ro-Ann aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store, like snack foods, sugar, soap, shampoo and other groceries.

loans.name: Mary Galla

texts.en:
Mary Galla is 44 years old and lives in Tuburan, Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with 4 children.

Mary Galla has a store that sells goods. She had been this business for 10 years. She requested a loan to buy more products to sell like bags of rice, cases of soft drinks and canned goods.

Mary Galla has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future she wants to build a branch of her store.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell like bags of rice, cases of soft drinks and canned goods.

location.town: Pagadian - Tuburan, Pagadian City Zamboanga Del Su

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy is 37 years old and lives in Balangasan District, Pagadian City. She is married with three children.

To earn a living, Ivy has a business selling breads, biscuits, cakes, cookies,etc. She earns about PHP 80,000.00 each month doing this type of work. Ivy has requested a loan to buy 10 sacks of flour and margarine, and to buy wood and lumber to be used for an extension to her bakery.

Ivy has been a member of PMPC for almost two years. In the future, she would like to have more branches of her bakery around the country.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of flour and margarine, and to buy buy wood and lumber for an extension to her bakery.

location.town: Pagadian - Balangasan District,  Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Last year (2013), Vicky joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and she appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers. Vicky has been operating a "Sari-Sari" Store (General Store) business for 8 years to earn additional income. She is married with 1 child and they live in Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao in the Philippines.
She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 15,000. This loan is intended to buy additional inventories for her "Sari-Sari" Store.
Vicky dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life for her family and an adequate income from her business.

loans.use: to buy additional inventories for her "Sari-Sari" Store (General Store).

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is 50 years old, married and a resident of Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao in the Philippines. She earns a living through "Sari-Sari" store (General Store) business. She has been in this business for 15 years and it is doing well.

Last year Florencia became a member of PMPC and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying for a loan of PHP 50,000 to  restock inventories, particularly basic commodities, for her "Sari-Sari" store (General Store) business.

Florencia deeply wishes to maintain a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to restock inventories for her "Sari-Sari" store (General Store) business

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 32 years old, married and a resident of Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao in the Philippines. Her husband is a tricycle driver. They have 5 children, of which 2 are in school.  Starting with capital of PHP 3,000, she opened a Sari-Sari (General Store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Apart from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefit given by the co-op. She became a member last April 2013 and has taken her first loan. 

Now, she is applying for PHP 25,000 to buy additional stocks for her Sari-Sari (General Store), particularly basic commodities.  In the future, Arlyn wants to own a mini-mart someday, and will be fully satisfied if she sees her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy additional goods for her "Sari-Sari" store (General Store) business.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is from Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao in the Philippines. She is 34 years old and is married with 3 children. 

In 2011, Ligaya applied for her membership with PMPC.  Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to become a member. She maintains the status of being a member in good standing, and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Recently, Ligaya has requested financial assistance of PHP 30,000 to buy more sacks of cassava root crops to sell. Through this, she hopes to increase her income and expand her business.  She has found assistance for their financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for which she is very thankful, with all of her heart.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of cassava root crops to sell.

loans.name: Amorita

texts.en: Amorita is 45 years old, married and a resident of Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao in the Philippines. Starting with capitalization of PHP 5,000, she opened a Sari-Sari store (General store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefit given by the co-op. She became a member in June 2010 and has since taken out three loans. She wishes to maintain a member in good standing, and be able to manage her finances. If not for PMPC, she might not have any savings for the future. She only wants to live a happy and comfortable life and see her children holding their diplomas some day.

loans.use: to restock inventories for her "Sari-Sari" store (General Store) business.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines, which she has been running for ten years now.

She has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other fishing materials for her business. Corazon has successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, Corazon would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other fishing materials for her business.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Monica works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling root crops and vegetables.

Monica successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.  She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Monica has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Jeneth

texts.en:
Jeneth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell in her buy-and-sell charcoal business.

Jeneth has been in this business for 2 years. She earns additional income from buy-and-sell ginger.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Jeneth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Edda

texts.en:
Edda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store in the Philippines. Edda has been in this business for three years. She earns more income from selling food and fish.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. She is now borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as canned goods, sugar, soap, snack foods, milk, coffee, etc.

Edda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as canned goods, sugar, soap, snack foods, milk, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Adoracion

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Adoracion works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish.  

Adoracion is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like wood, bamboo, fishing nets, etc for her fishing business.

Adoracion has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like wood, bamboo, fishing nets, etc.

loans.name: Vanna's Group

texts.en:
Vanna, a resident from Sangke district of Battambang province, is 34 years old and a widow. She needs to support her little daughter who is too young for school. She strives for a living via a clothes tailoring business and runs a small bike / motorbike repair shop. She has been involved in these income generating activities for eight years. 

This is not Vanna's first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has successfully repaid her previous loan, which enabled her to improve her lifestyle better than before. Now, she is seeking a loan of 1,200,000 KHR whereas her joint borrower is applying for a loan of 1,500,000 KHR. 

As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy more fabric to support her tailoring business. She strongly hopes that she can gain more income so as she can expand her business on a larger scale than before.

loans.use: to buy more fabric to support her tailoring business.

loans.name: Madalena

texts.en: Madalena is requesting a loan of $ 600 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as  children's shoes, adult shoes and children's bags.  She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $ 350.  She is a hardworking woman and hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy children's shoes, adult shoes and handbags child.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is 35 years old and married with two children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Marjorie requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing materials like fishing nets, gasoline etc.

Marjorie has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Marjorie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing net, gasoline etc.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Nelia works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Nelia is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of vegetables to sell through her buy-and-sell vegetables business.

Nelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years, and earns additional income from selling food.

Daisy is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell in her business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell in her business.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Annabelle works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice. Annabelle is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, milk, coffee, etc in her general store business.

Annabelle has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, milk, coffee, etc

loans.name: Orlina

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Orlina works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. Orlina is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Orlina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 30 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cosmetics and other diverse products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fresh food products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy various products and office equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bread and accessories.

loans.name: Carrefour La Vie Group

texts.fr: Le groupe CARREFOUR LA VIE est composé de trois personnes, qui sont des amies et résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe Monique (celle dont la main est levée sur la photo) âgée de 32 ans n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Monique est mariée à un vulgarisateur nommé Didier. Le couple a cinq enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Monique vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Pour cette raison, Monique vend des condiments à son domicile depuis dix ans. De façon secondaire, Monique vend également divers produits et du charbon de bois. Monique s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et de renforcer son activité, Monique ensemble avec les membres du groupe CARREFOUR LA VIE sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The Carrefour de la Vie ("Crossroads of Life) group is made up of three people, who are friends and live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, Monique (the one with her hand raised in the photo), is 32 years old and did not go to school. She is married to an extension agent called Didier and the couple has five children, some of whom are at school and all in their care. Monique lives with her husband and children. The couple cover the various household expenses between them. For this reason, Monique has been selling condiments from home for the past ten years. As a secondary activity she sells various products, including charcoal. She gets her supplies in a Benin market. With a view to satisfying customer demand and boosting her business, Monique, together with the other members of the Carrefour de la Vie group, is requesting a first loan from Alidé.

loans.use: to buy condiments and charcoal.

loans.name: Celma

texts.en:
Celma is thankful for the financial assistance previously extended to her. She was able to buy more products for her variety store. Her income from the business is assisting with her family's everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Celma would like to apply for another loan of 18,000 Philippine pesos to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed in the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Celma hopes to be more successful in business and dreams of having good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Lida Janneth

texts.es: Lida es una vendedora en una pequeña salsamentaría que tiene su nacimiento hace casi 11 años cuando su padre decidió montarla y tener un negocio cerca de su casa para generar un ingreso y poder estar cerca de su tan amada hija. Una vez falleció su padre Lida asumió el negocio y es hoy en día el único ingreso económico en su hogar, con este local paga gastos como servicios públicos, arriendo y gustos personales, pero Lida dijo basta se cansó de solo producir lo necesario de solo vivir con lo justo ella tiene la determinación de hacer crecer su salsamentaría de generar ingresos, esa auto meta que ella misma se impone de ser mejor cada día de demostrar que puede lograr más cosas, de que con lo poco tiene lo puede convertir en algo grande y significativo que lo puede lograr con un apoyo económico para surtir su tienda, y hacerla más atractiva al público.
texts.en: Lida is a small general store that started 11 years ago when her father decided to open it and have a business close to home to generate income an be close to his beloved daughter. Once her father died, Lida took over the business and today it is in her household's only income. With this locale, she pays for expenses such utilities, rent, and personal expenses. But Lida said she had enough of barely producing only what she needed to live. She is determined to make her store grow. This is a goal she has set for herself to be better every day and show that she can achieve more things. With what little she has, she wants to make it into something big and significant to stock her store and make it more attractive to the public.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business and make it more attractive to the public.

loans.name: Candelaria De Jesús

texts.es:
Candelaria de 26 años de edad, es madre soltera, estudio hasta tercer año de bachillerato, vive con sus 2 hijos que estan estudiando en un centro educativo y su hermana. Candelaria  tiene un negocio donde se dedica a la venta de gaseosas, jugos, boquitas, etc,  desde hace dos años, trabajo que aprendio de su madre, tambien trabaja cortando caña.

  El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar lamina y madera para mejorar su vivienda y asi tener mas seguridad. Candelaria sueña con ver a sus hijos profecionales, grandes y fuertes.
texts.en:
Candelaria is 26 years old. She is a single mother and went to school up to the third year of high school. She lives with her 2 children, who are in an educational center, and her sister. Candelaria has had a business for two years where she sells sodas, juices, snacks, etc. She learned this work from her mother. She also works cutting sugar cane. 

The loan she is asking CREDICAMPO for is to buy sheeting and wood to do some home improvement and have more security. Candelaria dreams of seeing her children graduate from college, big and strong.

loans.use: to buy sheeting and wood to do home improvement.

loans.name: Wilmer Geovanny

texts.es: Wilmer de 26 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene 1 hijo de 3 años, el cual no vive con é.  Wilmer vive solo con su compañera de vida que se dedica a los oficios domesticos. Wilmer solo estudio noveno grado. Wilmer se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganaderia, trabajo que aprendió de su madre. El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para compra de alimentación para sus animales y asi poder engordarlos para obtener mas ingresos con la leche que se venda y así poder tener una mejor calidad de vida . Wilmer, sueña con tener mas vacas para darles trabajo a otras personas que lo necesiten.
texts.en: Wilmer is 26 years old. He is married and has one 3 year old child. He doesn't live with him. Wilmer lives alone with his life's companion who takes care of the home. Wilmer only went to school through the ninth grade. Wilmer works in agriculture and cattle. He learned this wok from his mother. The loan he is asking for from CREDICAMPO, is to buy feed for his animals and thus be able to fatten them up to obtain more income with the milk he sells and have a better quality of life. Wilmer dreams of having more cows to give work to other people who need it.

loans.use: to buy feed for his cattle.

loans.name: Koemsrey's Group

texts.en:
A villager from the Koh Sotin district of Kampong Cham province, Koemsrey is 42 years old and single. She earns a living growing maize, sesame and tobacco. This is her main business, which she has been engaged in for eight years. 

She had never been with Vision Fund (Kiva’s partner) but she formed a group of three to apply for a new loan. As the group's leader, she will use her entire loan portion to buy seed and fertilizer and to pay for plowing for her crops. 

With this loan, she highly believes that she can gain more income to upgrade her lifestyle better than before.

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizer and to pay for plowing for her crops

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: La señora Delia es una persona humilde, responsable y trabajadora vive en la provincia de Quillacollo, actualmente tiene una humilde casa que fue herencia de sus padres, tiene cincuenta y ocho años de edad,  es soltera y vive con sus hermanos, se dedica a la lechería desde hace más de veintisiete años y también a la agricultura en un terreno que heredo junto con sus cinco hermanos donde produce maíz, la señora hace diez años que sufrió un accidente y quedo afectada su pierna, lo cual le dificulta para la realización normal de sus actividades, pero esto no impidió que salga adelante, actualmente solicita un crédito para la compra de alimento (chala) para su ganado bovino, con esto quiere abastecerse de este insumo para la actividad de la lechería y así continuar trabajando e incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Señora Delia is a humble, responsible and hard-working person. She lives in Quillacollo province, and currently has a humble home that was inherited from her parents. She is fifty-eight years old, single and lives with her brothers. She has worked in dairy for more than twenty-seven years, as well as agriculture with land which she inherited along with her five brothers and where she produces corn. The woman suffered an accident ten years ago which affected her leg, making it difficult for her to carry out her jobs normally, but this didn't stop her from moving forward.

She is currently asking for a loan to buy food (corn husk) for her cattle. She wants to stock up on this product for her job in dairy and in this way continue working and increasing her income.

loans.use: to buy food (corn husk) for her cattle.

loans.name: Jose Alex

texts.es:
José Alex tiene 33 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de carga, transportando todo tipo de materiales y mobiliario en su vehículo, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de piezas para su motor de su carro y de esta manera seguir brindando este servicio y generar ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
José Alex is 33 years old and lives together with his wife and children in the Oyotún district, a community dedicated to farming, commerce and animal husbandry, located in the Chiclayo province, which belongs to the Lambayeque region in the northern coast of Peru.

He provides cargo transportation services, transporting all kinds of materials and furniture in his vehicle. He has requested a loan to Edpyme Alternativa for 1 500 nuevos soles, which he will use to buy parts for the engine of his vehicle, and thus be able to continue providing this service and generating an income for his family.

loans.use: to buy parts for the engine of his vehicle and thus be able to keep providing this service

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Dentro de una casa con paredes de tablas viejas y llenas de rótulos de Tropigas, se encuentra María, una mujer multifacética que a sus 39 años ha decidido emprender con todos las oportunidades que le ha entregado la vida. Inició alquilando una habitación, luego encontró la oportunidad de incorporarse en la comercialización de gas licuado de petróleo y sin descuidar sus anteriores ingresos, comenzó a vender frijoles cocidos. Cabe resaltar que su deseo de superación personal nunca la alejó de sus estudios, lo que le permitió llegar hasta la universidad.
María proviene de una familia con escasos recursos económicos, pero muy unida, lo que le ha servido de motivación para salir adelante junto con ellos. Su producto lo comercializa en su casa, con el apoyo de su hermano, lo que le da seguridad en su trabajo. Sin embargo, necesita del préstamo para comprar cilindros de Tropigas, de manera que incremente sus ventas y haga crecer su negocio. Pero sus sueños no terminan ahí, pues piensa seguir agrandando sus ingresos con la instalación de un cibercafé en un futuro.
texts.en:
Living in a house with walls made from old wooden boards and full of Tropigas signs, María is a multifaceted woman, that at her 39 years of age has decided to start businesses with all the opportunities that life has provided her. She started by renting a room of her home, then she found an opportunity to start selling liquefied petroleum gas, and without stopping with any of her businesses, she started selling cooked beans. It must be said that her desire for personal growth never took her away from her studies, which allowed her to go to university.

María comes from a family with scarce economic resources, but one that is very close, which has served as a motivation for her to get ahead together with them. She sells her products from her home with the help of her brother, which gives her job security. However, she needs this loan in order to buy Tropigas gas tanks, so as to increase her sales and to grow her business. Nevertheless, her dreams do not end there, since she plans to continue increasing her income with the installation of an Internet cafe in the future.

loans.use: to buy gas tanks from Tropigas

loans.name: Edwin Rogelio

texts.es:
Edwin Rogelio tiene 33 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Oyotun, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de transporte público en su propia mototaxi, trasladando a sus pasajeros a zonas aledañas a su distrito, su esposa se dedica a la crianza y venta de patos y cuyes son una familia emprendedora, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de repuestos para su vehículo y una segunda parte para la compra de útiles escolares para sus hijos y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Edwin Rogelio is 33 years old and lives with his wife and children in the Oyotun district, a community dedicated to agriculture, trade and ranching, located in Chiclayo Province, in the Lamayeque Region on Peru's Northern coast.

He offers a public transport service in his own motorbike taxi, transporting passengers to the outer areas of his district. His wife works raising and selling ducks and guinea pigs - they are an entrepreneurial family.

He has asked for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles to buy spare parts for his vehicle, and also to buy school supplies for his children, and in this way generate a higher income for his family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his vehicle; and a second part to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José tiene 41 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en su casa propia de material rustico, en el Caserío Mangaypa, una zona rural del distrito de Pomahuaca, una comunidad de clima cálido, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, cuanta con clientela en su comunidad, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para darle mantenimiento a su cultivo de café y de esta manera tener una producción oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes y generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
José is 41 years old and lives with his wife and children in his own house which was built out of rustic material. José and his family live in Mangaypa village, a rural area of the Pomahuaca district with a warm climate in the Jaén province of the Cajamarca region in Peru's northern highlands. Here the people make a living in farming, cattle-raising and business.

José makes a living in farming, specifically he grows coffee. He has customers in his community. José has applied for a loan of 1000 Nuevo Soles in order to buy manure to look after his coffee crops and to have a good yield to offer to his customers on time. With this loan, José wants to increase his income for his family.

loans.use: to buy manure to look after his coffee crops.

loans.name: Saida

texts.es: La señora Saida tiene 26 años de edad, convive con el señor José en la ciudad de Cochabamba, tiene 3 hijos dependientes de sus ingresos, los cuales están en etapa escolar y son alumnos destacados por sus buenos rendimientos, la actividad principal de la señora es la producción de leche cruda para lo cual cuenta con 3 cabezas de ganado lechero, la producción total es entregada a un rescatista, por otro lado el señor José es albañil actualmente no está trabajando porque se le cayó un ladrillo en el pie y camina con dificultad pero pronto se recuperara y volverá a sus actividades normales para poder llevar dinero a su casa, el motivo del presente crédito es para la compra de ganado lechero y alimento para los mismos, ambos demuestran ser personas muy responsables y con ganas de superarse en la vida para poder brindarles a sus 3 hijos mayor bienestar y más comodidades.
texts.en:
Saida is 26 years old and lives with José in the city of Cochabamba. Saida has three children who depend on her income. They are all in school and good students with good grades. Saida produces milk. She has three dairy cows and delivers her product to a wholesaler. Saida's husband is a builder. He is currently not working as a brick fell on his foot and he has difficulty walking. He will quickly recover, however, and return to his usual work in order to bring home an income.

Saida is applying for this loan in order to buy a dairy cow and fee for the cows. Both Saida and her husband are very responsible people and have a desire to get ahead in life so that they may offer their three children better well-being and a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and feed.

loans.name: William Alberto

texts.es:
William Alberto tiene 45 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos ene l distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposa se dedican a la crianza y venta de cerdos, aves de corral, además venden leche fresca y ocasiones se desempeña en labores agrícolas en las chacras de sus vecinos, es un padre trabajador que se esfuerza para dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compa de una vaca lechera para ofrecer la leche fresca a sus vecinos y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
William Alberto is 45 years old and lives with his wife and children in the Cayaltí district, in the Chiclayo province of the Lambayeque region on Peru's northern coast. Here the people make a living in farming, cattle-raising and business.

Alongside his wife, William works raising and selling pigs and poultry. In addition he sells fresh milk and sometimes works as a farm labourer in his neighbours' fields. William is a hard-working father who is putting in the effort to offer his family a better quality of life. He has applied for this loan of 3000 Nuevo Soles in order to buy a dairy cow to sell fresh milk to his neighbours. By doing this, William can earn a higher income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to sell fresh milk to his neighbours.

loans.name: Nohemi

texts.es:
Doña Nohemí es una señora humilde, emprendedora, luchadora con una edad de 38 años, casada y madre de 3 hijos quienes le ayudan en las diferentes actividades del campo. Con un grado de estudio de primaria incompleta cursado hasta el cuarto grado agradecida por el apoyo moral y financiero por parte de sus padres a pesar de las muchas dificultades en esa época pues los ingresos generados no eran los necesarios para cubrir con todos los gastos y decidieron enseñarle a trabajar la tierra que por más de 10 años ha practicado. Otra forma de generar ingresos en su hogar es por medio de la venta de ropa de segunda ubicada en su casa de habitación. La tierra que trabaja fue adquirida con trabajo, buena administración y deseo de superación ubicada aproximadamente a una hora de camino. 
Sus metas poder terminar de apoyar a sus hijos con sus estudios para que se conviertan en personas profesionales y de provecho, con mejores oportunidades en la vida que el trabajo de campo, seguir ampliando sus parcelas de tierra y cultivar más para generar mayores ganancias. Ella ha solicitado financiamiento para la compra de fertilizantes y foliares para asistir sus cultivos de café y poder sembrar una nueva plantilla para seguir ampliando su cafetal.
texts.en: Nohemi is a humble, enterprising and hardworking 38 year old woman. She is married and is mother to 3 children, who help her in the different activities at the fields. She attended elementary school but did not complete it, having done up to fourth grade. She is thankful for the moral and financial support given by her parents despite the many difficulties at that time because the produced income was not enough to cover all expenses; and they decided to teach her to work the land, which she has done for more than 10 years. Another way of generating income in her household is through the sale of second hand clothing, which she does from her home. The land she works was acquired through work, good management and the wish to improve. It is located approximately at one hour distance. Her goals are to be able to support her children with their studies so they become professionals and good people with better opportunities in life than the life at the fields; to keep on increasing her land plots and grow more in order to generate more income. She has requested a loan to buy fertilizers and foliar fertilizers to help her coffee crops and be able to grow new plants in order to make her coffee plantation bigger.

loans.use: To buy agriculture inputs to help her coffee crops

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Trabajadoras está en su ciclo número  7 del programa de comité, todas están poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder ayudar a su familia por medio del trabajo en grupo. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, donde a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio del esfuerzo de todas van mejorando su situación de pobreza.
Fanny es miembro de este grupo, ella se dedica a hacer y vender comidas que ella misma hace. Es una mujer muy luchadora, que con sacrificio y esfuerzo está saliendo adelante, está creciendo y luchando ya que lo hace por su familia, para darles lo que ella no pudo tener.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar carne, pollo, jamón, queso, huevo, choclo, y mandioca, con lo que podrá seguir trabajando y luchando. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo de seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The group “Mujeres Trabajadoras” (Working Women) is in its seventh loan cycle with the committee program. All of the members are putting forth their best effort by working as a group so that they can help their families. They have taken the poverty elimination survey. Through continuous work and effort, all of the members are improving their poverty situation.

Fanny is a member of this group. She sells food that she prepares herself. She is a very determined woman who is forging ahead through sacrifice and effort. Fanny is growing and striving on behalf of her family since she wants to give them what she was not able to have. She is requesting a loan in order to buy beef, chicken, ham, eggs, corn, and cassava so that she can continue working and striving. Fanny appreciates the opportunity she has received so that she can keep growing.

loans.use: to buy beef, chicken, ham, eggs, corn, and cassava for preparing her dishes.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 47 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has two children, who are now at adult age.

For their source of living, Jocelyn is engaged in processing coffee and “tablea” (made of cacao), and a retailing business. She earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month, doing this business activity. She has requested a loan, which she will use to purchase an additional 1,000 packs of processed coffee and “tablea,” for retail sale.

Jocelyn has been a member of PMPC for almost three years. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to expand her business to other, nearby municipalities.

loans.use: to purchase an additional 1,000 packs of processed coffee and “tablea,” for retail sale.

loans.name: Cerila

texts.en:
Cerila works hard to support her family. She is single, and she has a repair shop business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 24 years.

Cerila requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional materials, like iron rods, galvanized iron, and welding rods.

In the future, Cerila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials to use at her repair shop, like iron rods, galvanized iron, and welding rods.

loans.name: Rosas Rojas (Paute) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Rosas Rojas está formado por 8 mujeres quienes viven en el cantón de Paute, siendo este cantón reconocido por su clima que es cálido, por ser  la mayor productora de flores, también por estar en este lugar la hidroeléctrica más grande del país, su gente es trabajadora y siempre luchar para salir adelante con sus familias.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Jhoanna,  tiene 20 años de edad, vive en unión libre y fruto de esa unión ha concebido dos hijos de 3 y 1 año de edad, su esposo labora como empleado público, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de sus suegros.
Doña Jhoanna pasa al cuidado de sus hijos pero aportar en la economía de su hogar se dedica a la cría de cuyes, pollos y cerdos, también se dedica a la agricultura y lo que cosecha es para el consumo de su hogar y para la venta. El dinero de su crédito es para la compra de cuyes, pollos, alimento de animales y semillas
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Rosas Rojas” (Red Roses) consists of eight women who live in the canton of Paute, which is known for its warm climate and for being a major producer of flowers. This area also has the largest hydroelectric dam in the country. The people are working class and are always striving to help their families get ahead.

One member of this group is Sra. Jhoanna. She is 20 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children (ages 3 and 1). Her husband is a public employee. They do not own a home, so they currently live at the house of her in-laws.

Doña Jhoanna passes the time by looking after her children, but she also contributes to the household finances by raising guinea pigs, chickens, and pigs. She also engages in farming and the crops that she produces are set aside for both household consumption and for sale. The money from her loan will be used to buy guinea pigs, chickens, animal feed, and seeds.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, chickens, animal feed, and seeds.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
A loan of $800 is offered to Maria, to improve her business. She is married, and she opened her kiosk in 2009 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, like soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko), cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, rice, noodles, milk and soap. Maria is generating a good income from selling.

She has been thinking of running a big business, after years of involving herself in doing business. Maria is living in a town, with her family.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell, like soft drinks, coffee, and sugar

loans.name: Sophin's Group

texts.en:
Sophin is 49 years old and married. She has two children who still need her support, as they remain in school. Having engaged in her current business for more than 20 years, she is able to earn around 40,000 KHR per day.

Sophin is a new borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now, she leads a group of two, to get a loan. She will spend her entire portion of the loan to pay for plowing the land and to buy potash for her crop. She strongly believes that she can expand her business, to a larger scale.

loans.use: to pay for plowing the land and to buy potash for her crop.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase school supplies for his business.

loans.name: Edwin Antonio

texts.es: Edwin tiene 25 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida. Él es un hombre trabajador quien se dedica al cuido y venta de plantas ornamentales. El negocio lo tiene desde hace 4 años y es así como se gana  la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Edwin ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea invertir en su negocio en la  compra de mayor cantidad de plantas que le permitan lograr atraer a más clientes que prefieran sus hermosas plantas y que le permita incrementar sus ventas e ingresos y de igual forma lograr mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Edwin is 25 years old and lives in his own house together with his life partner. He is a hardworking man whose job is caring for and selling ornamental plants. He has had this business for four years; this is how he earns his living and sustains his household. 

Edwin decided to request this loan from FUSAI because he would like to invest in his business by buying a greater quantity of plants, which will allow him to attract more customers who will like his beautiful plants. This will allow him to increase his sales and thereby manage to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a variety of ornamental plants for his nursery business

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
Juan José es un pequeño productor de la zona norte de Nicaragua. En su pequeña finca de 11.2 Ha cultiva café, granos básicos; y malanga. En promedio genera dos empleos durante el año. El café que produce en un área de 3.5 Ha está certificado por Comercio Justo.

Su meta es incrementar su producción este ciclo, para lo cual está solicitando un financiamiento para la compra de fertilizantes y abonos que le permitan asegurar el manejo adecuado a su plantación de café. Juan José está seguro de que la mejor manera de salir adelante es trabajando y produciendo con calidad, lo cual continuará realizando para brindarle mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan José is a small producer in the northern zone of Nicaragua. On his small, 1.2 hectare farm, he grows coffee, staple grains, and malanga (taro). On average, he employs two people throughout the year. His coffee is grown on a 3.5 hectare area and is Fair Trade certified. 

His goal is to increase his production this season, so he has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer and manure. This will allow him to be sure that he can effectively manage his coffee plantation.

Juan José is certain that the best way to move forward is to work and produce quality goods, which he will continue to do so that he can provide the best quality of life to his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and manure for his coffee crops.

loans.name: Edwin Alexander

texts.es:
Edwin es un joven emprendedor de 25 años, que en compañía de su amigo decidieron iniciar un negocio de artesanías, en el cual fabrican agendas, carteras, cofres y varias figuras en miniatura.
En estos momentos se encuentran solicitando un crédito para adquirir una sierra eléctrica y algunas herramientas de mano, que les permitirá trabajar mas cómodamente, ya que le ha tocado utilizar el servicio de sierra en una ebanistería cercana a su lugar de trabajo.
El taller lo tienen ubicado en la casa de su amigo y desde allí salen las mas grandiosas ideas artesanales.
El mayor desafío que enfrenta este emprendedor joven es el poco valor que la gente en general le da a sus creaciones, y su mayor sueño es poder ampliar su negocio fabricando variados objetos que puedan comercializar en el mercado de las artesanías.
texts.en:
Edwin is a young, 25-year-old businessman who decided to begin an artisan crafts business with his friend. They make agendas, wallets, chests, and miniature figurines. 

They are requesting a loan to purchase an electric saw and some hand tools that will allow them to work more comfortably. They currently have to use the saw at a local cabinetmaker's shop. Their workshop is located in his friend's home, which is where their great ideas for artisan crafts come from.

The greatest challenge that Edwin faces is the low value that people place on his creations. His greatest dream is to be able to expand his business and create various objects that he can sell in the artisan market.

loans.use: to obtain an electric saw and some hand tools.

loans.name: Liezl

texts.en:
Liezl works hard to support her family. Liezl is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like shampoo, bread, spices, eggs, noodles, etc.

Liezl has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Liezl would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like shampoo, bread, spices, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina works hard to support five children. She is married and has a buy and sell oyster business in the Philippines.

Lina requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a backup light in case of emergency.

Lina is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 38 years old and married with two children, who are in school. Liza works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Liza has been in this business for 10 years.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 50 years old with four children, two of whom are in school. Susan works very hard to provide for them.

Susan runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

Susan has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future, Susan would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Cyril

texts.en:
Cyril is 37 years old and married with two children who are in school. Cyril works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, biscuits, eggs, shampoo, etc.

Cyril has been in this business for 8 years.

In the future, Cyril would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, biscuits, eggs, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Brittany

texts.en: Brittney is a 23-year-old single lady with no children. She would like to start her small business, selling elei lavalava in her community. In order to do this, Brittney needs a loan to buy fabric paints, brushes, fabric, stencils and an elei carved board. She hopes to use her profits to save for family needs. She has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy fabric paints, brushes, fabric, stencils and an elei carved board.

loans.name: Lotutamaiti

texts.en:
Lotutamaiti is 20 years old and single with no children. She has a small garden where she grows pineapples, cucumbers, taro and taamu that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years. Lotutamaiti needs a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, chemicals, a knife, a spade and weedspray for her garden. 

 Lotutamaiti will use the profits from her sales to support her family. She has been a member of SBPD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, chemicals, a knife, a spade and weedspray.

loans.name: May Rose

texts.en:
May Rose works hard to support two children. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Mary Rose requested a loan of 1,800 PHP through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with bright light when studying at night.

May Rose is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, but she is also helping the environment and reducing health risks for her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Armida

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Armida works hard to support her family.

Armida has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pre-paid mobile load services. Armida is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Armida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream, which is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 61 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Erlinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell such as soft-drinks, biscuits, milk, etc.

Erlinda has borrowed and repaid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns income from buying and selling vegetables.

Erlinda aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell such as soft-drinks, biscuits, milk, etc.

loans.name: Hen's Group

texts.en: Hen is 33 years old and a married mother blessed with three children, one small child and two schoolchildren. To secure decent food for her family, she grows cassava and plants rubber trees which has returned her about 33,000 KHR per day. This is the second cycle for Hen and her joint borrower. She has repaid her past loan with success and now her lifestyle is getting better than before. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing and to buy seed. She strongly believes that she can grow her crop timely.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and to buy seed.

loans.name: Roeur's Group

texts.en:
Roeur is 49 years old and a married mother blessed with six children. Her residential area is Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province where her rice is grown. This business, which she has occupied for ages, has generated her about 36,000 KHR per day. 

This is the first loan for Roeur with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She joined a group of three to get new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her crops. She highly believes that she can plant her crops timely with a good yield in return.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for her crops.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a horse for transporting materials.

loans.name: Sokeng's Group

texts.en:
Sokeng, aged 30 and a mother of three children, is a local farmer who grows cassava on two hectares of farmland as the main source of income to deal with her daily cost of living. The several years’ involvement of her past loan has returned her about 34,000 KHR per day. 

Sokeng has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the past two cycles with successful repayment. Now, she leads a big group consisting of six borrowers. The total amount of her entire group loan is 9,800,000 KHR, of which 1,800,000 KHR is her loan portion. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing, to buy herbicide, and to pay for labor costs. She highly believes that she can gain a good yield better than before so she can gain more money to lease an additional hectare of farmland to expand her cash crop.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, to buy herbicide, and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Pheat's Group

texts.en:
A married mother of five children, Pheat is a resident from Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province. 

She does rice cropping as the main source of income, which generates about 19,700 KHR per day. This is not the first loan for Pheat with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loan with success and her living condition is getting better than before. 

For this cycle, she leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy a decent motorbike to support her business as well as for commuting. She hopes that purchase will help her to reduce transportation costs so she can use that money to support her family instead.

loans.use: To buy a decent motorbike to support her business.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Maa Bastaren Group

texts.en:
In the year 2014, eleven active women from a remotely located village named Jholapathar of Nuapada district in Odisha, India, formed a Self Help Group named Maa Bastren to access loans from Mahashakti Foundation and expand their business. Subhagini is one of them. The 28-year-old lady standing third from right with raised hand in the photo is Subhagini. She lives with her husband and a son.
 
Subhagini has been running a general grocery shop in her village for the last ten years with all daily needs items like rice, dough, oil, potato, onion, soap, shampoo, tea, biscuits, etc. Her husband helps her in the business. Currently, she is earning a monthly income of 5,000 INR, but according to her, this is not sufficient to materialize her dream. 

As per her statement, she was able to increase the variety of items in her shop, but not the inventory. So the present loan of 16,000 INR will be used to purchase items like rice, wheat, lentils, oil, soap, potato, etc. for her general store. She hopes this will definitely help her to reduce her purchasing and transportation costs as she will replenish her stock frequently and add extra income to her family. Subhagini hopes to save enough to give better education to her son. 

The other ten members are also running micro enterprises like vegetable vending, vegetable cultivation, general store, etc.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing of rice, wheat, lentils, oil, soap, potato, etc. for her general store.

loans.name: Chakadola Shg Group

texts.en:
Bhairabi, the lady standing middle with raised hand in the photo, is a very active woman of 25 years of age. She resides with her family in the village named Samserpadar of Nuapada district in Odisha, India. Bhairabi hails from a very poor Schedule Caste family of Below Poverty Line.

Bhairabi herself has been running a general grocery shop in a wooden cabin in her small village for the last seven years with the help of her husband who is also a very hardworking fellow. Bhairabi sells items like soap, shampoo, washing powder, sugar, tea, oil, etc. in her shop. She started the business with a small investment of her own. At that time her monthly net income was around 2,000 INR. It was very difficult on her part to maintain the family. So in the year 2009 she with four other women of her village and formed a Joint Liability group and contacted Mahashakti Foundation for loan to develop her business. 

In the mean time she has already availed two loans from Mahashakti Foundation and has repaid them successfully. She has also added different daily need items in her shop as per the demand of the customers. She is very happy that with the loan support she has been able to expand her business and established it. 

Currently, she is earning a monthly income of 5,000 INR. As per the statement of Bhairabi, this small income is not at all sufficient to manage the family along with educational expenses of her children. So she wants to increase her income by expansion of her existing business. 

In 2014 she motivated other women members of her village and formed a Self Help Group of 16 women for a fresh loan. From the present loan she has purchased items like rice, wheat, lentils, oil, soap, potato, onion, etc. for her general store. This will help her to reduce her purchasing and transportation costs as she will replenish her stock frequently from a distance of 15 kilometer. She hopes that this investment will give her more income and that with enough savings she will be able to construct a house for her family as well as a permanent cabin for her business. 

The other 15 members of the group also do business like general store, vegetable vending, milk business etc.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing of rice, wheat, lentils, oil, soap, potato, onion, etc. for her general store.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is taking a loan of $800 to improve her business. She is running a second hand clothing store that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as long sleeve and short sleeve shirts, trousers, shorts, and maternity clothing. She opened her second hand store a year ago with her own working capital of $600. Maria is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy long sleeve and short sleeve shirts, trousers, shorts, and maternity clothing.

loans.name: Chhotimaa Group

texts.en:
Chhoti Maa (SHG) was formed in January 2014 consisting of 12 rural poor women members who belong to Below Poverty Line. This group is located in a rural village named Palsada of Nuapada district of Odisha, India. 

Vegetable cultivation and vending is the primary source of livelihood of most of the members of this group as the village is situated near a river. Hemalata is one of the members of this group.  The lady standing second from left in the front row with raised her hand is Hemalata. She is a very active young lady of 25 years of age.
 
Hemalata has a vegetable cultivation farm of one hector. She and her husband manage the farm. Her husband is an active and cheerful farmer. They produce vegetables like brinjal, cauliflower, carrot, cabbage, chilly, cucumber, papaya, ladies finger, onion, etc. in the farm. She sells her products to the traders of the nearest town who come to take vegetables from her farm. Hemalata tells that she earns a minimum amount of 5,000 INR per month from this business, which is insufficient to meet the day-to-day expenses of her family as well as the farm expenses. 

Hemalata wants to expand her business by taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. She will use the present loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs like seeds and pesticides for her farm. She expects a good return from her business by expanding her cultivation. Hemalata dreams of constructing a house and purchasing a water pump for better irrigation to her farm. She also hopes to give her whole family a bright future through her hard work.
 
The other 11 members of this group are also involved in business like vegetable cultivation, general grocery shop, vegetable vending, and tailoring businesses.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing of fertilizer and farm inputs like seeds and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Paepae

texts.en: Paepae is a 35-year-old married woman with 5 children. She makes and sells fish in her community to earn a living. She has 5 years of experience with this business. Paepae needs a loan to buy a spear, a canoe, fishing line, fishing gear, a torch and snorkeling boots. She plans to use her profits to support and help her family. Paepae has been a member of SPBD since March of 2014.

loans.use: to buy a torch, a spear, a canoe, fishing line, fishing gear and snorkelng boots.

loans.name: Asovale

texts.en:
Asovale is a 53-year-old married woman with six children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, yams and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. 

Asovale has requested a loan to buy bush knives, a weed sprayer, a wheelbarrow and chemicals. She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. With her profits, Asovale hopes to earn more money to support and help her family.

loans.use: to buy a weed sprayer, a wheelbarrow, bush knives and chemicals

loans.name: Nive

texts.en:
Nive is 20 years old and single, with no children. She has a small garden where she grows pineapples, cucumbers, taro, and taamu that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years.

Nive needs a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, chemicals, bush knives, spades, pickaxes, and weed spray. She joined as a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2014. Nive will use the profits from her sales to support her family.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, chemicals, bush knives, spades, pickaxes, and weed spray.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
As a widow parent of two children, Eva works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Eva is borrowing 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional needles, thread, fabric and other materials needed for her tailoring business.

Eva has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional needles, thread, fabric and other needed materials

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda works hard to support her family. Gilda is married and has a buying and selling of oysters business in the Philippines.

She requested a 19,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional oysters to sell.

Gilda has been in this business for 35 years now.

In the future, Gilda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional oysters to sell

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lorna is 43 years old and has three children who are in school.

She has a buying and selling of rice business in the Philippines. Lorna requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Lorna has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Jocelen

texts.en:
Jocelen is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jocelen is 43 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Jocelen has a roasted whole pig vending business in the Philippines. Jocelen requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional pigs and ingredients for her business.

Jocelen has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Jocelen would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs and ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Nermilyn

texts.en:
Nermilyn works hard to support her family. Nermilyn is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Nermilyn requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like noodles, biscuits, coffee, etc. to sell.

Nermilyn has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, Nermilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like noodles, biscuits, coffee, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 45 years old and single. She works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like coffee, milk, spices, etc. to sell.

Marlyn has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Marlyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like coffee, milk, spices, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Pelenatete

texts.en: Pelenatete is 27 years old and has two children. She grows taros and bananas to earn a living. Pelenatete has requested a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, bush knives, a wheelbarrow, a tarpaulin and a pick axe for her business. She joined SPBD in 2013. Pelenatete will spend her profits her children's education.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, bush knives, a wheelbarrow, a tarpaulin and a pick axe.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing at wholesale, including t-shirts and jeans among other items to sell.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of 13 children, Merlinda works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Merlinda is borrowing PHP 30,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional spare parts for her motorcycle transport business.

Merlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Jenely

texts.en:
Jenely is 30 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Jenely is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Jenely has been farming vegetables for ten years and also earns additional income from a general store and raising livestock.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable farming business in the Philippines. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requested an additional loan to further build her business. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her vegetable farming business.

Rosenda has been in this business for 13 years. She earns additional income from pig fattening.

Rosenda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 45 years old and married with four children.

Teresa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock, such as snack foods, soft drinks, noodles, canned goods, etc., to sell.

Teresa has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns additional income from vulcanizing, raising pigs and buying and selling firewood.

Teresa aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock, such as snack foods, soft drinks, noodles, canned goods, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for advertising for his business.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 36 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Mary Ann runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Mary Ann has borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell charcoal business for five years and also earns income from a general store.

Mary Ann aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Maria Esthela

texts.es: María es una señora de 63 años de edad, ella vive con su esposo, una hija y 2 nietos que están asistiendo a la escuela, María se dedica a criar chanchos desde hace unos 8 años, dice que empezó con este negocio gracias al  crédito que le otorgo Fodemi, ella tiene 11 hijos pero ya todos son independientes ya que sus padres supieron sacarlos adelante y actualmente María  y su esposo se dedican a la crianza de chanchos y a la agricultura para  tener una vejes digna y para ayudar con la educación a sus nietos, el crédito lo van a invertir en la compra de chanchos para incrementar su negocio.
texts.en: María is a 63 year old woman who lives with her husband, a daughter and two grandchildren who go to school. María has been raising pigs for 8 years. she says that she started thanks to a loan granted to her by Fodemi. She has 11 children but all of them are independent as their parents knew how to get them ahead. Today María and her husband raise pigs and farm to have a dignified old age and to help with the education of the two grandchildren. The loan will be used to buy pigs to increase their business.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to support her coffee crop.

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
Gilberto es un joven de 29 años, esposo y padre de un niño de 9 años que estudia en la escuela de la comunidad donde viven, en el norte de Nicaragua. Desde hace unos diez años se dedica a la actividad ganadera y a la caficultura. Su finca es de 35 Ha. de las cuales 8 Ha. Las ha destinado a la producción de café, el cual produce bajo los criterios de certificación de Comercio Justo. En el último ciclo, la producción de este joven fue de 280 quintales de café pergamino.

Su visión es incrementar el área y volumen productivo de su cafetal, para incrementar sus ingresos y garantizar la estabilidad económica de su familia. Como parte de ese proceso, Gilberto está solicitando un crédito que le permita asegurar en este ciclo, la compra de fertilizantes y abonos que contribuyan a la nutrición de las plantas y lograr así una mayor productividad.

Este pequeño emprendedor está seguro que la caficultura es un rubro rentable, que le permitirá tener mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Gilberto is 29 years old, married and the father of a 9 year old son who studies in the local school where they live in the North of Nicaragua. For the past ten years he has been rising cattle and growing coffee. His farm is 35 hectares, 8 of which are used for growing coffee. He grows coffee under Fair Trade Certification criteria. Last year his production was 280 quintals of parchment coffee.

His dream is to increase the area and productive volume of his coffee plantation to increase his income and guarantee the financial stability of his family. As part of this process Gilberto is requesting a loan which would allow him to secures this cycle buying fertilizer and manure which contribute to the nutrition of the plants and provide a higher production. This small entrepreneur is sure that his coffee plantation is a profitable undertaking that will allow him to have more income for his family.
