loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is a 21-year-old single woman with one child. She has a small plantation and grows taro, ta'amu, yams and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. 

Ana has requested a loan to buy bush knives, a weed sprayer, a wheelbarrow and chemicals. She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. With her profits, Ana hopes to earn more money to support and help her family.

loans.use: to buy a weedsprayer, a wheelbarrow, bush knives and chemicals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food products like rice, sugar, wheat, cereals, conserves and fresh vegetables.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: As a married parent of two children, Mercy works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Mercy is borrowing PHP20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets for her fishing business. Mercy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia is 22 years old and married, with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. In the picture, Eugenia is posing with the driver of her motorcycle. 

Eugenia has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle.

Eugenia has been in this business for two years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida works hard to support her family. Loida is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy wood, paints, nails, bamboo, etc., for her new fishing boat.  Loida has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Loida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy wood, paints, nails, bamboo, etc. for her new fishing boat

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 42 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock, such as soft drinks, biscuits, coffee, etc., to sell.

Rowena has borrowed and repaid ten loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Rowena aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock, such as soft drinks, biscuits, coffee, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Cheryl works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice grains. Cheryl is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock like eggs, noodles, chips, etc. for her general store business.

Cheryl has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like eggs, noodles, chips, etc.

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell dry goods business in the Philippines.

Paz requested a PHP 17,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase stocks of dry goods to sell, like shorts, blouses, mirrors, and t-shirts.

Paz has been in this business for 30 years now. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of dry goods to sell, like shorts, blouses, mirrors, and t-shirts.

loans.name: Yeny

texts.es: Yeny tiene 33 años de edad y habita junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos de 15 años, 13 años, 8 años y 4 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos y cerdos  desde hace 12 años de edad.  Este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos y es el que le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de pollos y cerdos dado que desea mejorar sus ventas y e ingresos así como sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en: Yeny is 33 years old and lives with her husband and their four children of 15, 13, 8, and 4 years of age. She has raised and sold chickens and pigs since she was 12 years old. This business is her primary source of income, and it allows her to provide for her family. She decided to request this loan to invest in buying more chickens and pigs, as she wants to improve her sales and income, as well as her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens and pigs to sell.

loans.name: Savali

texts.en: Savali is 38 years old and married with two children. She makes and sells pancakes to earn a living, and has been doing this for two years. Savali has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, sugar, yeast, baking soda, and dripping oil for her pancake. She plans to use her profits to improve her business. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sugar, yeast, baking soda, and dripping oil for her pancake business.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en: Carolina is 63 years of age, widowed, and a mother of six. Carolina has a lot of business and could make more income, but due to insufficient capital she would like a loan amounting to 40,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to purchase hog feed for her hogs. With the remaining portion of the loan, Carolina will purchase some rice and corn grains to sell. She's hoping that her hog raising business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase hog feed for her hogs and to purchase some rice and corn grains to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn  owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting rice for sale, with the help of her husband, to earn a living.  For more than seven years in farming, the couple earns a good income to sustain their living. Jocelyn has been a member of GDMPC since the year 2010, and with her generated income, she successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying fertilizer. To improve the farm and prepare for the next cropping, she took a new loan to purchase fertilizer and organic pesticides. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the farm to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and organic pesticides

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha is 50 years old and married with one child.

Juditha works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to resell in her general store.

Juditha has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 30 years, and earns an income from vending fruits and vegetables.

Juditha aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to resell in her general store.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Susan works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from a general store. Susan is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to resell in her buy-and-sell fish business.

Susan has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to resell.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell through her general store business, like shampoo and groceries.

Elsie has been in this business for four years. She earns additional income from a restaurant.

Elsie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 44 years old and two of her children are currently in school.

Elvira has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, seasonings, fish, vegetables, and spices for her business.

Elvira has been in this business for 40 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, seasonings, fish, vegetables, and spices for her business.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 41 years old and married.  She has two children.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock, like coffee, milk, sugar, soap, etc.

Fe has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from a restaurant.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock, like coffee, milk, sugar, soap, etc.

loans.name: Leoniza

texts.en:
Leoniza is 40 years old and widowed.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from boarding house. Leoniza is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase stocks to resell, such as canned goods, eggs, milk, spices, soaps, etc. for her general store business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 33 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks to resell, such as canned goods, eggs, milk, spices, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Pedro Duvey

texts.es:
Pedro es una persona con ganas de superarse, desde hace tiempo trabaja como comerciante vendiendo comidas rápidas y bebidas, pero ahora quiere iniciar un negocio de producción y venta de pollos de adelanto y huevos aprovechando un lote que le prestó su madre.
Es un negocio rentable en su región y desea aprovechar esa oportunidad que le presenta el mercado.
Pedro solicita dinero para construir un galpón y abastecerse con pollos, así podrá aumentar sus ingresos, ayudarle a su madre y generar empleo.
Su mayor sueño es expandir su negocio y fidelizar a sus clientes, también desea comercializar sus animales a las grandes industrias agrícolas.
El desafío mas grande que manifiesta es la situación económica en estos momentos, ya que no posee los recursos suficientes para iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Pedro is a person with a great desire to get ahead. For quite some time he has worked as a vendor selling fast food and drinks, but he now wants to start his own business raising and selling chickens and eggs to take advantage of the land that his mother has lent him. 

This is a profitable business in the region and he hopes to seize the opportunity that the market has presented for him. Pedro is requesting money to build a shed and chickens in order to increase his earnings, help his mother and create employment. His greatest dream is to expand his business and gain the loyalty of his customers. He also hopes to sell the animals to the larger agricultural industry. His greatest challenge is the economic situation that he has found himself in at the moment, as he does not have sufficient resources to start his business.

loans.use: to build a shed and buy chickens.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Doña Gladys una mujer común del barrio que tomo la decisión de tener su propio negocio con la intención de generar un ingreso que le ayude a suplir sus necesidades, ya sean personales, arriendos, servicios públicos entre muchas otras que se le presentan, comenzó con su negocio de distribución de comida hace más o menos 6 años ayudada por familiares y amigas quien la enrolaron en el negocio de preparación de comidas, hoy en día Gladys vive solo con su esposa, pero ella no espera a que este le regale  un dinero para suplir una necesidad, ella sabe que está en toda la capacidad de producir su propio capital. Solcita una ayuda para adecuación de un local pero ya en la calle, ya que todos sos productos son elaborados en la casa lo que le generaría mayor ventaja pues en este medio pasan un gran volumen de personas lo que le generaría más clientela, con la única intención de acercase a su sueño mona un restaurante con el que logre una estabilidad económica y poder compartirla con su nieta y seres queridos
texts.en: Doña Gladys a typical woman in her neighborhood who made the decision to open her own business with the intention of earning more money in order to pay for basic necessities, be they personal, renting, public services or one of many other living expenses. She began her business distributing food about 6 years ago. She was helped by friends and family who signed on to helping her start up her business selling food. Today, Gladys lives alone with her husband, but she is not waiting for him to give her money to pay for living expenses, she knows that she needs to make her own money. She is asking for a loan to find a better locale because currently all her food is prepared in her home. Moving location would be a big advantage because she would be able to serve a greater number of people and get closer to her dream of having her own little restaurant. This will help her to achieve economic stability that she will be able to share with her granddaughter and loved ones.

loans.use: find a locale for her business.

loans.name: Rosa Mariana

texts.es: Son ya 15 años que Rosa se dedica a la crianza de chanchos, ella es una mujer soltera que con 41 años de edad tiene 4 hijos de 26, 24,15 y 10 años de los cuales los dos menores se encuentran estudiando, para sacar adelante a sus hijos esta mujer luchadora también se dedica a trabajar al campo, con el dinero del crédito va a comprar chanchos que comenta que es un buen negocio, la aspiración de Rosa es criar más animales e incrementar sus ingresos para darles la educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa has already been raising pigs for 15 years. She is 41 years old and is a single mother with 4 children aged 26, 24, 15 and 10. The two younger ones are at school. In order to bring up her children this hard-working woman also works in farming.

She will use the money from the loan to buy pigs and says it is a good business. 

Rosa's dream is to raise more animals and increase her income so she can give her children an education.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: José Januario

texts.es: Esta es la historia del señor José un hombre que debido a su edad no pudo conseguir un trabajo pero este no se podía quedar quieto pues tenía que alimentar a su familia conformada por su esposa y 4 hijos, con la ayuda de un pequeño capital que ahorro pro sus trabajos anteriores monto una pequeña tienda y ya mucho tiempo después con la ayuda de un crédito logro establecer una tienda ya con variedad de surtido, esta tienda tiene un gran punto a favor y es que es la única en este sector puesto que su competencia cerro, pero don José se enfrenta a un gran reto y es que están llegando almacenes de gran cadena a su barrio residencial razón por la cual solicita una ayuda crediticia para la compra de un refrigerador pues el que tiene ya está copado además que quiere darle más variedad de surtido a su negocio. Don José tiene un gran sueño y es poder conformar un supermercado y cree que este paso es el inicial para acercarlo a su sueño, ya que piensa que nada mejor que un supermercado manejado por alguien común del barrio que sabe las necesidades de sus semejantes.
texts.en:
This is the story of José, a man who could not find work because of his age but could not  stay still as he had to feed his family. He has a wife and four children. With the help of a small capital sum which he saved from his previous work, he set up a small shop. A good while later, with the help of a loan, he was able to establish a shop with a variety of stock. The main point in favour of the shop is that it's the only one in the area, since his competition closed.

However, José is facing a big challenge because major chain stores are starting to open in his residential area. This is why he is asking for a loan to buy a refrigerator, since the one he has is already full, and he also wants to increase the variety of stock in his shop. 

José's main dream is to set up a supermarket and he thinks this is the first step towards realising his dream. He thinks there is nothing better than a supermarket run by an ordinary member of the local community who understands the needs of his neighbours.

loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator, since the one he has is very full, and buy stock for the shop.

loans.name: Jose Esteban

texts.es:
José Esteban es un pequeño productor de una comunidad de Jinotega. Tiene dos hijos junto a su esposa. Cuenta con una pequeña área de café de 0.52 Ha. La cual  ha trabajado en los últimos años. Su finca está bien diversificada ya que además de café cultiva malanga y granos básicos. Anteriormente se dedicó a la horticultura, pero debido a los químicos nocivos que utilizaba para el control de plaga; decidió cambiar de actividad. 

Actualmente, José Esteban está solicitando un crédito para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes que le permitan mejorar la nutrición de su cafetal, y con lo que podrá obtener mejores resultados en la cosecha del próximo ciclo agrícola, para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Jose Esteban is a small producer in Jinotega. He and his wife have two children. He works with a small area of coffee plants of 0.52 hectares, in which he has worked the past few years. His farm is well diversified, and in addition to coffee he also grows potatoes and basic grains. He previously worked in horticulture, but he decided to change his work due to the harmful chemicals used for pest control.

Currently, Jose Esteban is requesting a loan for the purchase of fertilizers that would allow him to improve the nutrition of his coffee plants, and with which he could obtain better results from the next harvest cycle for the well-being of his family.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Sieni

texts.en:
Sieni is 24 years old and single with one child. She wants to start a small business making and selling rice and curry in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy bags of flour, rice, oil, onions and potatoes. 

In the future, Sieni hopes to earn more money from her business to help her family. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, rice, oil, bags of onions and sacks of potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer at wholesale.

loans.name: Nonito

texts.en:
Nonito supports his family with the small amount of income he generates from his farm. With this, he was able to improve their living and had successfully re-payed his previous loan used for farming. He always wants to provide the best for the family. Recently, he took a new loan to purchase fertilizer and organic pesticides to have a greener farm.

Nonito hopes to improve his farm, and wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and organic pesticides.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane takes care of their farm with her husband and children, where they grow bananas and coconuts. They've been farming for six years and earn well to sustain their living. With her generated income, Mary Jane's previous loan, used for farming, was successfully repaid.

Recently, Mary Jane took a new loan to purchase fertilizer and new seedlings. This will help her to improve her farm.
 
In 2011, Mary Jane joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) and it helps her to improve their living situation and their ability to engage in business. She hopes for a bountiful harvest and to expand her cultivated area.

In the future, Mary Jane wants to improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and new seedlings.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of ready-to-wear to sell for her ready-to-wear business.

Flordeliza has been in this business for 7 years. Flordeliza earns additional income from raising pigs and general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Flordeliza has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ready-to-wear to sell

loans.name: Haydee Yamires

texts.es:
Haydee de 42 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado de educación, su pareja con quien está acompañada desde hace 23 años se dedica a la agricultura,  tienen en común 3 hijos uno de ellos esta aparte ya porque está acompañado,  dos están en casa estudian educación media y en sus tiempos libres le ayudan al padre a realizar los trabajos de la agricultura en casa del cliente solamente viven cuatro personas. 

Haydee se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos, como: queso fresco y leche, que le compra a algunas personas la leche  y luego revende ella  de forma que obtenga una ganancia y le genere un ingreso a su economía y ayudar así a su esposo con los gastos que se generan en el hogar se ha dedicado a este negocio desde hace unos 23 años, su padre de ella le enseño la actividad el trabajo de la cliente lo desarrolla en el municipio más cercano a su casa recorre 23 kilómetros en bus todos los días, para vender sus productos y su horario de trabajo es de 6 horas al día. 


El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de leche que es de donde ella saca el queso y el requesón para luego vender. El préstamo le ayudara a mejorar la venta, porque tendrá más productos que vender y por tanto mejoraran los ingresos.

El principal sueño de la cliente es ver a sus hijos terminar una carrera universitaria, ya que ella no lo logro a la misma vez desea mejorar su negocio poniendo un puesto de venta en el municipio donde podrá establecer un negocio formal,  para el futuro Haydee desea seguir trabajando junto a su familia y salir adelante hacer crecer su negocio comprando más insumos para la venta.
texts.en:
Haydee is 42 years old. She studied until the third grade. Her partner, who she has been with for 23 years, works in agriculture. Together they have 3 children, one of which lives on their their own with their partner, and two of which live at home and are in secondary education. In their free time they help their father carry out agricultural work in the home where only four people live.

Haydee sells dairy products such as cheese and milk, which she buys and then resells. In this way she makes a profit, generates income, and helps her husband with household expenses. She has been working in this business for about 23 years. Her father taught her the trade and developed their business in the town near their home. They traveled 23 kilometers by bus every day in order to sell their products. She works for 6 hours a day.

The loan will be invested in the purchase of milk, which is where she gets her cheese and curds to sell. The loan will help her improve her sales, as she will have more products to sell and thus she will improve her income.

Her main dream is seeing her children complete a college education, as she herself was not able to do so. At the same time, she wants to improve her business by placing a stall in the town where she can establish a formal business. For the future, Haydee wishes to continue working with her family and to continue growing her business by purchasing more supplies for sales.

loans.use: purchase more milk.

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe is 34 years old and married, with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Maria Fe has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell charcoal business for two years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.

She aspires to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: June

texts.en: June works hard to support her family. June is married and has a business direct-selling Avon products in the Philippines. June has requested a PHP10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more Avon products to sell to her customers. June has been in this business for nine years now. June would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more Avon products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Lycie

texts.en:
Lycie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional bundle of fishing net for her fishing business.

Lycie has been in this business for 4 years. Lycie earns more income from buying and selling charcoal.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional bundle of fishing net

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines.

Felipa requested a loan of 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional materials and gears for her business. She has been in this business for 50 years now.

Felipa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and gears for her business.

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
Jinky is 35 years old and married with six children, five of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Jinky has been in this business for three years.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Sally requested a loan of 16,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional peanut, butter, egg, etc.

Sally has been in this business for 12 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional peanut, butter, egg, etc.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en: Jonalyn, 28 years of age, is married to an agricultural technician. They have been blessed with two children. She has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost three years. She earns a net income of 500 PHP daily. Due to insufficient funds for her business, she would like to avail a loan amounting to 20,000 PHP to purchase sugar, coffee, creamer, and beverages to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, coffee, creamer, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
As a married parent of one children, Rebecca works hard to support her family. She has a buy and sell vegetable business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. 

Rebecca is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell for her buy and sell vegetable business.

Rebecca has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Alexis Geovanny

texts.es:
Alexis de 33 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado de educación, está acompañado su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos tienen en común 1 hija de 3 años de edad, no estudia.


Alexis se dedica a la agricultura desde que estaba muy pequeño, su padre le enseño la actividad al cultivo de maíz, frijol, maicillo entre otros productos propios de la agricultura,  el cliente tiene otra actividad económica y es la un trabajo de medio tiempo en una administradora de agua que distribuye en todo el municipio donde él vive, desempeñándose como fontanero.

Pero su actividad más fuerte es la agricultura, porque ese ha sido su principal fuente de ingreso y alimentación; la distancia que recorre es poca su terreno donde trabaja está en el mismo terreno donde vive,  por lo que se le dificulta es el acercar los insumos para siembra,  recorre 13 kilómetros en bus para llevarlos y su horario de trabajo es de 7 horas al día.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar insumos agrícolas semillas, abonos, fertilizantes. Entre otros propios de la agricultura. Esto mejorara la producción, porque con el préstamo el cliente podrá comprar más insumos y podrá sembrar más productos  y tener mejores ingresos.

Sus sueños son poder producir granos agrícolas más y poner un negocio en el municipio de donde es originario y así tener mejores ingresos para cubrir necesidades puntuales de su familia.
texts.en:
Alexis is 33 years old and studied as far as fourth grade at school. He has a partner and she does domestic work. They have a 3-year-old daughter who is not at school.

Alexis has worked in agriculture since he was very young. His father taught him how to grow corn, beans and sorghum as well as other agricultural crops. He has another job, working part time as a plumber for a water board which supplies all of the town where he lives. 

His strongest role is in agriculture, as this has been his main source of income and food provision. He does not have to travel far, as the land he works on is the same place where he lives. What he finds difficult is getting the agricultural supplies to his home. He travels 13km by bus to fetch them and works 7 hours a day.

He will use the loan requested to buy agricultural supplies such as seeds, manure and fertilizers, among other things. This will increase his production, because using the loan he will be able to buy more supplies, sow more crops, and make more income.

His dream is to produce more grains and set up a business in his home town, so he can have a better income to cover his family's occasional needs.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertilizers etc.

loans.name: Yon Alexander

texts.es:
Yon ha trabajado toda la vida en el campo como mayordomo de finca y recolector de café, pero desde hace ya 3 años decidió iniciar con su propio negocio de producción y venta de ganado, esta actividad la aprendió desde muy pequeño de sus abuelos y tíos.
En estos momentos cuenta con un pequeño lote de ganado pero desea ampliar su negocio con mas animales; por esta razón solicita un crédito para comprar 2 cabeza de ganado  y así aumentar su capital.
Su mayor sueño es poseer un terreno donde pueda tener sus animales ya que siempre ha tenido que utilizar pastos prestados.
Su mayor desafío es la falta de capital para trabajar y el precio tan bajo de la carne en su región.
Este hombre luchador es soltero y no tiene hijos pero siempre vela por la salud y bienestar de su madre que tiene una edad bastante avanzada.
texts.en:
Yon has worked his whole life in the countryside as a farm manager and coffee picker, but three years ago decided to start his own business raising and selling cattle. He learned this activity at a very young age from his grandparents and uncles. 

At the moment, he has a small cattle lot but wishes to expand his business with more animals. For this reason he is requesting a loan to buy two head of cattle, and in this way increase his capital. 

His greatest dream is to have a parcel of land where he can keep his animals, as he has always had to use borrowed pastures. His greatest challenges are lack of working capital for his business, and the very low price of meat in his region. This determined man is single and has no children, but he is always looking out for the health and well-being of his mother, who is quite elderly.

loans.use: To buy two head of cattle.

loans.name: Fetuao

texts.en:
Fetuao is an 18-year-old single lady with one child. She has a small garden and grows vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for one year.

Fetuao has requested a loan to buy weed spray, seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, etc. She has been a member of SBPD since March of this year. With her profits, Fetuao hopes to improve her business and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy weed spray, wheelbarrow, chemical, and seeds.

loans.name: Pule

texts.en:
Pule is a 32-year-old married woman with one child. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu (giant taro), yams, and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years.

Pule has requested a loan to buy bush knives, weed sprayer, wheelbarrow, chemicals, etc. She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. With her profits, Pule hopes to earn more money to support and help her family.

loans.use: to buy weed spray, wheelbarrow, bush knives, and chemicals.

loans.name: Mandakh

texts.en:
Mr. Mandakh, 54 years old, lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering taxi service to local people since 2001 during his free time.  Until 2009, he had worked at a power plant as an engineer. His wife currently works at kindergarten. Their two daughters both study at a university in China. This autumn his son will begin to study at college. 

He is facing a hard time generating enough income to providing for his children. 

He is now requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to buy spare parts such as an ignition box, a voltage regulator, and a brake drum for repairing and updating his car, so that he can render proper service to people in need of taxi service. 

It is the only work he can do for his family, so a proper car is the most important asset for him.

loans.use: to repair and update his car taxi

loans.name: Nimela

texts.en:
Nimela is a 33-year-old married woman with eight children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu (giant taro), yams, and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years.

Nimela has requested a loan to buy bush knives, weed sprayer, wheelbarrow, and chemicals. She has been a member of SBPD since March of 2014. With her profits, Nimela hopes to earn more money to support and help her family.

loans.use: to buy weed spray, wheelbarrow, bush knives, chemicals, etc.

loans.name: Gremar

texts.en:
Gremar joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in 2014.  He is 20 years old, and lives in Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao, Philippines. 

Gremar appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op, most especially the Student Education Assistance Loan program  (SEAL) because it caters to college students coming poor families who do not have enough funds to sustain their education. From his desire to finish his college education, he availed the SEAL program. 

He is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 15,000. This loan is intended to pay for all the school obligations in college like tuition fees and other miscellaneous expenses.

He dreams of nothing more than to hold his diploma and land a good job.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees for college, and other miscellaneous expenses

loans.name: Jose Nelson

texts.es: José tiene 40 años de edad y habita en condiciones muy humildes junto a su  esposa y sus tres hijos de 17 años, 15 años y 7 años de edad quienes a la fecha se encuentran estudiando en la escuela pública de su localidad. José trabaja como jornalero desde hace mucho tiempo y su esposa se encarga del trabajo doméstico de su hogar. Es así como lleva el sustento diario y mantiene la economía de su familia. José solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un pequeño cuarto para la cocina y para cambiar el techo de la vivienda el cual se encuentra deteriorado. Con el monto solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos.
texts.en:
Jose is 40 years old and lives under very basic conditions with his wife and three children of 7,15 and 17 years old who are currently studying at the local public school. Jose has been working as a day laborer for a long time and his wife maintains their home. This is how they provide for everyday essentials and maintain the family's finances. 

Jose is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in the construction of a small room for the kitchen and to change the deteriorated roof of the house. With the requested funds he will buy galvanized sheet metal, wood and nails.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal, wood and nails to build a room for the kitchen and to change the roof of his home

loans.name: Ian Laureene

texts.en:
Ian Laureene joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in 2014. She is 20 years old, and she appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op, most especially the Student Education Assistance Loan program (SEAL). From her desire to finish her college education, she availed herself of the SEAL program. 

She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 15,000. This loan is intended to pay for all her school obligations like tuition fees and other miscellaneous expenses.

She dreams of nothing more than to hold her diploma and land a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees in college

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is a 39-year-old member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative from Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She industriously cares for her fishing activities. Juanita is married and has seven children. She personally takes charge of their business, and their children work for them as support. The business is doing well. Juanita has humbly taught her children the techniques of how to enjoy the business and at the same time make earnings from it. The ups and downs of the business is nothing but a normal situation for her. Sometimes they have business losses, sometimes a good return. She is a savvy business woman.

Now, Juanita sees a good opportunity to expand their business. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) from Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for capital to buy additional nets and fishing accessories. She deeply wishes for a good education to her kids and for them to have businesses on their own.

loans.use: to buy additional nets and fishing accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of cooking oil, rice, sugar, milk, and other items.

loans.name: Rhiza

texts.en:
Rhiza lives in Balanlinao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and has nine children. Her husband is a fisherman who never gets tired of supporting their big family. In 2013, she applied for membership to Paglaum MPC. Hearing all the benefits of being a member, she didn't hesitate to become one.  

Recently, she has asked for a loan of PHP 6,000.00. This loan is intended to buy a boat engine for fishing. Fishing is their main source of income. Through this loan, Rhiza believes the family will raise more income and expand their business.  Rhiza has found comfort in meeting their financial needs through Paglaum MPC. She is very thankful with all her heart. 
She maintains herself as a credible member in good standing and she always pay her loans on a timely manner.

loans.use: to buy a boat engine for fishing

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is a married woman who has six children. She describes herself as organized and honest. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are regular customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en: Luisa is married with five children and helps her husband manage their own farm for a living.  To earn additional income, she started her business buying and selling coconuts. She buys coconuts in bulk from her neighbors and resells them in town. She earns a good income from this. To improve her business, she joined GDMPC and took out a new loan to buy additional coconuts to resell. She plan to buy another coconut farm to expand her farming business and wants to improve the general living situation of her family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy additional coconuts to resell

loans.name: Hervie

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of five children, Hervie works hard to support her family. She has a butcher shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Hervie is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to purchase additional meat to sell for her butcher shop business.

Hervie has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional meat to sell

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business weaving bamboo  in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional bamboo for her business.

Clarita has been in this business for four years. She earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional bamboo

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Sofia requested a loan of 27,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Sofia has been in this business for nine years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 44 years old and married with six children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Merlinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 18,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional items like soap, shampoo, eggs, and noodles.

Merlinda has been in this business for nine years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like soap, shampoo, eggs, and noodles.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Belinda requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase canned goods, soap, egg, noodles, etc.

Belinda has been in this business for 18 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business. In the future, Belinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, soap, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Hanelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Hanelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns income from farming vegetables. Hanelyn is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, egg, milk, and sugar for her general store business.

Hanelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, egg, milk, and sugar.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business weaving bamboo in the Philippines. She is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional bamboo for her business. Divina has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from farming rice.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional bamboo

loans.name: Marcia Del Rocio

texts.es: Marcia tiene 31 años, vive con su esposo y su hija de 9 años, ella es una mujer luchadora que se dedica a vender ropa en su casa, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 4 años, comenta que  es bueno tener su pequeño negocio ya que mientras que atiende a las actividades de su hogar también atiende a sus clientes, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mercadería para implementar en su negocio, su esposo es chofer pero si le apoya en esta actividad, la meta de Marcia es que su negocio llegue a ser un gran almacen y que su hija termine sus estudio.
texts.en:
Marcia is 31 years old and lives with her ​​husband and nine-year-old daughter. She's a determined woman who sells clothes at home. She has been doing this for four years. She says it's good to have her small business because she can attend to household tasks at the same time as serving her customers.

She's going to use the loan to purchase merchandise for her business. Her husband is a driver, but although she supports him in this activity, Marcia's goal is for her business to become a large store and for her daughter to finish her studies.

loans.use: to buy clothing merchandise in order to expand her store and pay for her daughter's studies

loans.name: Martha Celia

texts.es:
Martha tiene 50 años de edad, es una pequeña productora de café de la zona Norte de Nicaragua. Su finca es de 10 hectáreas de las cuales 0.7 destina al cultivo de café, el cual está certificado por Comercio Justo.

Para este ciclo productivo, Martha requiere un financiamiento que le permita garantizar la compra de insumos y fertilizantes que necesitan sus plantaciones para asegurar una buena cosecha, y con ello mejores ingresos que le permitan cubrir sus necesidades y reinvertir en el establecimiento de nuevas áreas, ya que su meta es llegar a tener 2 hectáreas productivas de este rubro.
texts.en:
Martha is 50 years old and a small coffee producer in the northern part of Nicaragua. Her farm measures 10 hectares, of which 0.7 hectares is used for growing coffee. Martha is a certified Fair Trade grower.

For this production cycle, Martha is requesting a loan that will allow her to purchase supplies and fertilizers that she needs so that she can secure a good harvest from her plants. With the additional income she will earn, she will able to cover her needs and reinvest in the establishment of new crop fields. Her goal is to have to have two hectares of productive coffee plants.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive en  casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se caracteriza por ser un hombre honesto, trabajador y sobre todo muy emprendedor. Hace varios años que logro establecer una pequeña tiendita cerca de su lugar de residencia y gracias a Dios y a su arduo trabajo y dedicación el negocio es muy reconocido en la zona por lo que ya cuenta con mucha clientela. Para el  es muy importante mantener activo este negocio ya que es su principal fuente de ingresos. Es por esta razón que ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de mercadería para la tienda tales como: huevos, golosinas, azúcar, arroz, leche, frijoles, pan dulce y de más artículos que parezcan atractivos para los clientes. De esta manera espera lograr su sueño de seguir mantenido activo su negocio y por consecuencia seguir trabajando por un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
This borrower lives in his own home along with his wife and two children. He is known for being honest and hardworking, but above all else, he is a very enterprising man. Several years ago he established a small store near his home. Thanks to God and through hard work and dedication, his business is now well-known in the area and has many customers. He believes that it is very important to keep his business active since it is his main source of income.

For this reason, the borrower has requested a loan from Apoyo Integral so that he can invest in the purchase of merchandise for his store such as eggs, snack foods, sugar, rice, milk, beans, sweet bread, and other products that are attractive to customers. He hopes to achieve his dream of maintaining an active business. This would allow him to continue working for a better future.

loans.use: to buy eggs, snack foods, sugar, rice, milk, beans, sweet bread, and other products to sell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma started her sari-sari store business when she requested a loan from ASKI. She is 37 years old, married, and has two children attending school. She wishes to grow her business for a continuous source of income whereby she can make profits that serve as her children's allowances for school. 

Emma’s husband is a farmer. They grow corn and rice on their farm. Their income from farming is an additional source of income to support their daily living and their children's needs in school. 

In regard to her wish, Emma believes that borrowing a loan of PHP 33,000 is an opportunity for her to grow the business. She will use the loan to buy grocery items like condiments, spices, drinks, powder juice, and powdered milk to sell. She hopes to increase her sales and income as well.

loans.use: to buy grocery items like condiments, spices, drinks, powder juice, and powdered milk to sell.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Hardworking mother is the term that best describes Fe, 54 years old, residing in Eastern Looc, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Fe has four children and is married to a carpenter. The wage that her husband earns isn’t enough to sustain the daily needs in their family, so Fe started to engage in a food vending business. She has been in the business for more than 3 years now.

Fe wants to expand her food vending business. She wants to gain more profit and to have enough to sustain her family, especially for her children, and she would like to be able to send her children to college.

In order for Fe to make her wish possible, she needs a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) additional capital, which she will use to expand her business. She intends to buy meat, rice, and toppings, as well as all the ingredients, utensils and other things that needed in the business. Fe hopes to live a comfortable life someday with her family.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients and cooking utensils for her food vending business.

loans.name: Sammary

texts.en:
Sammary is a 33-year-old married woman with 3 children. She describes herself to be ambitious and determined. She operates a retail business where she sells farm chemicals. She has been involved in this business for 5 years.

Sammary's business is located in a competitive area and her primary customers are local customers. She will use the loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy more stock of farm supplies. Her business goal is to excel within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her business and family living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock of farm supplies.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 46 years of age and a resident of Usocan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with kids. They have a little fishing business from which to earn a living. With their business they meet many challenges, but they realized that it is good to face the challenges rather than get discouraged.

Myrna and her husband work hard in selling their catch to the market. Sometimes there are wholesale buyers from other towns and cities who come to buy their fish. With their savings, they welcome the idea of expanding their business. They have requested from Paglaum MPC a loan of 14,900 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy another boat engine for fishing and from which to increase the volume in which they can catch fish. They feel assured of Paglaum’s help, should there be a need for working capital in the future. Myrna smiles at the thought of seeing their children get their own diplomas one day.

loans.use: to buy a boat engine for fishing.

loans.name: Jhony Martin

texts.es:
Jhony Martin tiene 22 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Morropon una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia del mismo nombre, que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica al comercio de tamarindo y fruta de temporada, también brinda servicio de transporte público en su propia mototaxi, es un joven emprendedor, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 4 000 nuevos soles para la compra de fruta de estación en mayor cantidad y de esta manera ofrecerlo a sus clientes y generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Jhony Martin is 22 years old. He lives in the district of Morropón, a community with a hot climate located in the province of the same name, which is part of the Piura region of Peru's northern coast. The population works in agriculture, commerce, and ranching. 

Jhony earns his living selling tamarind and seasonally-available fruits. He also provides public transportation services in his mototaxi. He is a an enterprising young man. 

Jhony has requested a loan of 4,000 nuevos soles [PEN] from Edpyme Alternativa for the purchase of a greater quantity of seasonal fruit so that he can offer them to his customers and generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to by a greater quantity of seasonal fruit

loans.name: Flor

texts.en:
Flor is 61 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional stock of products to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, and soap. Flor has been in this business for 34 years.

In the future, Flor would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of products to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, and soap.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Meet Juliana, a wife and a mother to four children. She has been farming for the past 17 years. She makes ends meet selling eggs and various crop varieties. She runs a retail shop too. 
In farming she loves the harvesting part because she is able to reap the fruits of her labour and it gives her good income. Her biggest challenge is that the cost of farm inputs is high.
Juliana chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because their interest rates are a bit lower than for other microfinance institutions. During the training she learnt never to divert funds use. This loan will help to increase farm productivity because of the farm inputs she will buy.This will help improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: to purchase farm implements.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Virginia works hard to support her family.

She has a pumpboat transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Virginia is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her pumpboat transport business.

Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her pumpboat

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos, es un caficultor del departamento de Jinotega. Cuenta con una pequeña finca de 4.2 Ha; la que trabaja con su familia, y en la cual tienen 2.1 Ha. de café, actividad a la cual se ha dedicado por más de 10 años; y es el principal ingreso económico para cubrir las necesidades de su esposa y sus tres hijos. 

Durante el tiempo que lleva trabajando con PAC, este pequeño productor ha estado integrado al proceso de certificación de Comercio Justo, ha logrado incrementar su área productiva, así como su producción; obteniendo un aumento del 50% en el último año, que ha derivado en la mejora de sus ingresos económicos. 

Para el ciclo 2014-2015, Carlos está solicitando un financiamiento para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes; que le permita darle el mantenimiento a su finca como parte de la mejora continua que pretende lograr año con año, y con lo cual está seguro seguirá mejorando la productividad de su café y sus ingresos para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is a coffee grower in the department of Jinotega. He has a 4.2 hectare lot which he farms with his family; 2.1 hectares are dedicated to coffee. He’s been farming for more than ten years, and it is his main source of income to finance the needs of his wife and three children.

During the time that Carlos has been working with PAC, as a small producer of coffee he has received the qualification Comercio Justo. As well he has increased the area under cultivation and also coffee production. In fact, this last year he has increased production by 50% resulting in an improvement in his financial situation.

For the 2014-2015 cycle Carlos is seeking a loan to buy manure and fertilizer which will allow him to improve the condition of his fields as part of a yearly plan of continued improvements. He is certain that this will lead to greater coffee production and more income for the wellbeing of his family.

loans.use: buy manure and fertilizer

loans.name: Bella Ruth

texts.en:
Bella Ruth is 56 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Bella Ruth requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase meat, chicken, fish, vegetables and other ingredients.

Bella Ruth has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Bella Ruth would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase meat, chicken, fish, vegetables & other ingredients

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is a farmer living in the Muranga area of Central Kenya with his wife and two children all of school going age. Farming has been his major source of income and he has been doing it for the past ten years where he produces and sells milk, eggs, and tea. His biggest challenge is during seasons of low sales.

Andrew chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer low interest rates on their loans. During the training, he learned how to grow his income as a smallholder farmer. This loan will ensure that there is more supply of milk and thus more income. This will improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase dairy animal

loans.name: Mohira

texts.ru:
Мохире 32 года. Она независимая замужняя женщина, проживающая в городе Худжанд. Мохира замужем за бизнесмена, занимающийся купле-продажей машин. У них двое детей. С ними еще живет мать мужа. 
Пять лет назад Мохира самостоятельно открыла свой маленький бизнес. Она занимается продажей детской одежды и одежды для младенцев. Ей очень нравится ее бизнес, приносящий ей ежедневный доход и она хочет расширить его. Мохира просит кредит для того чтобы приобрести сезонную детскую одежду с целью увеличения количества продаж. Она надеется на вашу поддержку, благодаря котрой она будет продолжать свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Mohira is 32 years old.  She is an independent, married woman, living in the city of Khujand.  Mohira is married to a businessman, involved in buying and selling cars.  They have two children.  The husband's mother also lives with them.

Mohira opened her own small business five years ago.  She is involved in reselling children's and infant clothing.  She likes her business very much.  It yields her a daily income and she wants to expand it.  Mohira is requesting this loan to purchase seasonal children's clothing in order to increase the inventory of clothing.  She hopes for your support, thanks to which she will be able to continue her business.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal children's clothing for resale

loans.name: Avei

texts.en:
Avei is 47 years old and a partner, with four children. She runs a small business, selling pancakes in her community and she has been doing this for five years. 

Avei has requested a loan to buy a bag of flour, a bag of sugar, cooking oil, a fryer, etc. She joined South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2009 to gain access to capital. 

With her earnings, Avei will save more for unexpected emergencies and for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a bag of flour, a bag of sugar, cooking oil, a fryer, etc. for her pancake business.

loans.name: Diane Ermione's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes, qui sont des amies et résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe Diane Ermione (celle dont la main est levée sur la photo) âgée de 28 ans n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Diane Ermione ne vit plus avec son mari. Diane Ermione a avec un enfant, scolarisé et à sa charge. Diane Ermione vit seule avec son enfant. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assumées par dame Diane Ermione. Pour ce faire, Diane Ermione vend des friperies de façon ambulante depuis trois ans, ce qui lui permet de répondre aux besoins de son enfant et à ses propre besoins. Diane Ermione s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Diane Ermione ensemble avec les membres de son groupe sollicite pour la première fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three members who are friends and who live in the same district. The group representative, Diane Ermione (the woman with her hand raised in the photo), is 28 years old and did not have the opportunity to attend school. Diane Ermione no longer lives with her husband.
Diane Ermione has one child, who receives an education and who lives under her care. Diane Ermione lives alone with her child. The various household expenses are met by Diane Ermione. In order to meet her child's and her own expenses, Diane Ermione has been selling clothes as a travelling vendor for the past three years. Diane Ermione gets her supplies from a market in Bénin. In her quest to satisfy her customers, Diane Ermione, together with the other members of her group, are requesting their first loan from Alidé.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: El Paraiso Group

texts.es: El grupo está integrado por tres socios trabajadores, coordinado por el señor Orlando de 56 años de edad, casado y padre de cuatro hijos se dedica a la compra-venta de cerdo, los comercializa en su domicilio y cuenta con la ayudad de su esposa para la comercialización, el crédito lo requiere para la compra de cerdos por pies. Los otros socios son la señora Martha de 59 años propietaria de una librería en su domicilio y el señor Virgilio propietario de una pulpería en su domicilio. Estos socios representan diversas formas para ganarse el pan de cada día.
texts.en:
The group is made up of three working members and coordinated by Orlando, who is 56 years old, married and father of four children. Orlando makes a living buying and selling pigs which he does out of his home with the help of his wife. He needs the loan to buy live pigs. 

The other group members are Martha and Virgilio. Martha, 59 years old, owns a bookstore which she runs out of her home and Virgilio owns a small grocery store also run out of his home. These members portray varied forms of earning their daily bread.

loans.use: to buy live pigs.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim operates a food stall/restaurant selling beverages. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years. She is 47 years old and married with two children. She lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Kim’s first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Kim faces in her life is not having a clean water system and a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to buy brick, cement and sand to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Kim hopes to build a new house, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to buy brick, cement and sand to build a toilet.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is 51 years old and married, with two adult-aged children. She is from Punta Sulong, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. 

She has been in the fishing business, which primarily provides for the family, for eleven years. She has a monthly income of PHP 10,000 doing this type of work. 

In 2005, Marieta signed up as a member of PMPC and took several loans, which she paid in full. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase additional fishing net. 

Marieta hopes to save more, which she intends to use as support in times of emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is 40 years old and a mother of five. They are currently residing in a rural community, planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. She also engages in the hog-raising business to have an additional source of income. 

Adela aims to improve this business and increase her income to satisfy their daily necessities and finance the education of her children. Due to capital insufficiency, she would like to avail a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy hog feed, vitamins and vaccines needed in hog-raising. She believes that someday, she will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins and vaccines needed in hog-raising.

loans.name: Deyvi Jesus

texts.es:
Deyvi Jesús tiene 23 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el Caserío de Chilcal Alto, una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposa se dedican a la crianza y venta de animales de corral patos, pollos, también brinda servicio de jornalería, ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Deyvi Jesús is 23 years old. He lives with his wife and children in Chilcal Alto, a rural area in the district of Oyotún. This community works farming, trading, and raising livestock. It is located in Chiclayo province, in the region of Lambayeque, on Peru's northern coast.

He and his wife work raising and selling animals like ducks and chickens. He also works as a laborer. He has requested a loan of 500 nuevos soles to buy balanced feed for his animals so that he can generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for his animals.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe works hard to support her family. Fe is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase soft drinks, canned goods, charcoal, vinegar, etc. to sell.

Fe has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Fe would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, canned goods, charcoal, vinegar, etc. to sell

loans.name: Milena Mildred

texts.es: Milena es ya toda una señora de 33 años de edad técnica en veterinaria y cuidado de mascotas, inicio con un negocio hace 10 meses, pero es un negocio algo curioso poco visto en la ciudad de Medellín, y es la venta de ropa para mascotas, este negocio  poco común con el que espera causar gran impacto debido a la conciencia que hoy en día estamos tomando por las mascotas, Milena aprovechando esta nueva evolución de pensamiento enfoco su local, teniendo como principal publico nuestros peludos amigos. Como toda nueva emprendedora tiene un problema y es que carece de recursos para innovar su negocio y causar un impacto más grande en su público y futuro clientes, solicita una maquina fileteadora para iniciar sus propios diseños y el producto le salga más económico pues sería ella misma quien los diseñaría y los confeccionaría, ella solo espera que apoyen este proyecto dado que como toda persona tiene un sueño y el de Milena es poder distribuir su producto en los principales almacenes de la ciudad que la conciencia pro el cuidado de las mascotas llegue al mayor número de personas.
texts.en: MIlena is already a woman of 33. She is a veterinary and animal care technician. She began a business 10 months ago, but it is a somewhat curious business that is seldom seen in the city of Medellin, and it is the sale of clothing for pets. This business is very unusual, but with it she hopes to have a big impact due to the awareness that we have for pets today. Milena is taking advantage of this new evolution in thought with regard to her shop, having as her principal public our furry friends. Like every new entrepreneur, she has a problem, and that is the lack of resources to innovate her business and have a bigger impact on her public and her future customers. She is asking for an overlock sewing machine to begin her own designs, and the product will be more economical since she will be the one who designs and makes them. She only hopes that you will support this project, given that like everyone, she has a dream, and that of Milena is to be able to distribute her product to the principal stores of the city and that the awareness of the care of pets is reaching a greater number of people.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine to make clothing for pets

loans.name: Hiếu

texts.en:
Mrs. Hiếu works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. Hiếu has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Hiếu is 35 years old and is married with two children. Hiếu lives in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hiếu first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

The main hardship that Hiếu faces in her life is not having a water tank and a water filter.

She is requesting a loan to buy a water tank and a clean water filter.

With her business profit, Hiếu hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to buy a water tank and a clean water filter

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of kanga (African garments)

loans.name: Betania Group

texts.en:
Kipara is in his late thirties and has a boy and a girl who are in school. He is single and earns a living for his family by running a cleaning service, polishing and cutting women's nails. He has been in this service for seven years now and is able to earn very good monthly returns. Kipara works from 10 am to 9 pm daily.

From Tujijenge, Tanzania, this is Kipara’s fifth loan request, which he will use to buy equipment for his business. He used his previous loans (all of which he repaid successfully) to buy work equipment (including foot washing brushes, nails, painting items, etc.).  He earned extra income, which he used to pay for school fees and home, food, and rent expenses.  Kipara dreams of owning another successful business. 

Kipara will share this loan with his loan group, Betania, which has a total of four members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy equipment for his business.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is a 45-year-old married man. He has two children. Justus describes himself as determined. He operates a farm where he grows tea and has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in an area ideal for farming. Justus describes his biggest business challenge as inadequate capital. 

Justus will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy fertilizer and other farm inputs. His business goal is to expand within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm inputs for his tea farm.

loans.name: Simon

texts.es:
Simon tiene 69 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el Caserío de Santa Tereza, una zona rural del distrito de Callayuc, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de cafeto de la variedad catimore, desde hace tres años, junto a su esposa se han esforzado en el cultivo de café, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos y pago de mano de obra a jornaleros por el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Simon is 69 years old. He lives together with his wife and children in the community of Santa Tereza, a rural area in the district of Callayuc. The population works in agriculture, commerce, and ranching. It is located in the province of Jaén, which is part of the Cajamarca region of Peru's northern mountains.

Simon has earned his living in agriculture, especially in the cultivation of coffee plants of the catimore variety, for three years. He and his wife have put great effort into their coffee crop. He has requested a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles [PEN] for the purchase of fertilizer and to pay day laborers in order to maintain his coffee crop and thereby generate a greater income for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for day laborers to maintain his coffee crop.

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely is 42 years old, married, and works very hard to help her husband. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like rice, soft drinks, chips, eggs, noodles, spices, etc.

Mely has been in this business for four years. In the future Mely would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like rice, soft drinks, chips, eggs, noodles, spices, etc.

loans.name: Cresi

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Cresi works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Cresi is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets and gasoline for her fishing business.

Cresi has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets and gasoline

loans.name: Astrid Janeth

texts.es:
Astrid, una mujer emprendedora y activa de 29 años de edad, es un ejemplo a seguir, especialmente para su pequeño hijo de 6 años, pues se caracteriza por ser una persona honesta, trabajadora y carismática.
Desde hace 8 años se dedica a trabajar como comerciante independiente, vendiendo mercancía como ropa, calzado, bolsos y otros productos que le encargan; su trayectoria le ha permitido ser reconocida en el sector y su principal clientela está conformada por amigos, vecinos y familiares; brinda la facilidad de comprar en plan separe, lo que le permite a sus clientes adquirir el producto y pagarlo a cuotas; de esta forma genera los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.
El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para invertir en su negocio, comprará mercancía al por mayor (jeans, camisas, tenis, bolsos); con el fin de ampliar la variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes y satisfacer los diversos gustos, logrando aumentar su ventas y los ingresos.
Astrid manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es acreditar aún más su negocio y aumentar la variedad de artículos para acceder cada día a nuevos mercados; así mejorará la rentabilidad de su actividad y podrá brindar una  mejor calidad de vida a sus familiares.
texts.en:
Astrid is an enterprising woman who is 29 years old. She sets an example to follow, especially for her little six-year-old son, as she is characterized by being an honest, hardworking, and charismatic person.

She has been working as an independent sales person for 8 years, selling merchandise such as clothing, footwear, handbags, and other products that people request. Her career has allowed her to become known in the area, and her principal clientele comprises friends, neighbors and relatives. She offers the option of a partial purchase plan that allows her customers to buy a product and make payments. In this way she generates enough resources to support her husband with the financial responsibility of their home.

The loan that she is requesting is support for investing in her business: she will purchase wholesale merchandise (jeans, shirts, tennis shoes, and handbags) in order to expand the variety of products that she offers to her clients, and please differing tastes. This way, she will be able to increase her sales and her earnings.

Astrid says that her main desire is to establish her business even more, and increase the variety of items in order to access new markets every day. This way, she will improve the profitability of her occupation, and she will be able to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale merchandise (jeans, shirts, tennis shoes, and handbags)

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina is 52 years old and married with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc.

Merlina has been in this business for 30 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Giana

texts.en:
