Giana is applying for a loan of $600.00 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 29 years old.She is married, and she has three children. She is running a Rental in front of her house and will use the loan to  paper, ink dye, rulers, markers, and a printer. She is making good money from her sales business, and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future.
Giana lives in a town, near the school; her Rental is located in a strategic place where many students  come to copy Their documents  goods. Giana is happy with the loan because it is offered to poor people and will improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To  paper, ink dye, rulers, markers, and a printer

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en:
Wilfreda works hard to support her family. Wilfreda is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Wilfreda has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Wilfreda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Aloida

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Aloida works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables and raising livestock.

Aloida is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more packs of foods to sell for her food vending business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. Aloida hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of foods to sell

loans.name: Berning

texts.en:
Berning is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a mud crab vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for nine years. She earns additional income from pig fattening.

Berning is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional mud crabs to sell for her business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. Berning dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional mud crabs to sell

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en: Florentina is a 24-year-old single mother with one child. She wants to start a small business, selling elei lavalava (painted sarongs) in her community. In order to do this, Florentina needs a loan to buy fabrics, brushes, paint rollers, fabric color paints, and stencils. Florentina hopes to use her profits to save for her family's needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, brushes, paint rollers, fabric color paints, and stencils

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 46 years old, married and from Nyandarua. They have four children who are between the ages of 26 and 19 years old.

Margaret is a farmer, and has been in it for many years. 

She has applied for her first loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable her buy fertilizer and seedlings.

She hopes to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane lives in Nyandarua South with her four children. For many years, she has earned a living as a farmer and is applying for her first loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy fertilizers to use on her farm. she is optimistic that her farm will do better after accessing the loan. Jane's goal is to continue farming and boost her source of income so that her family can have a better future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Pius

texts.en:
Pius is 56 years old. He is a livestock trader. Pius needs a loan of KES. 67,500 to purchase bulls for trade. He has been in the livestock trading business for the last 20 years. He desires to expand his business further by getting more bulls for trade.

Pius has successfully paid back all his previous loans, and in fact this is his seventh loan. In the future, he hopes and dreams to have a reliable business that can supply all his basic needs. 

He is married and together with his wife, he has four children. With the profits from the loan,  Pius anticipates to have an expanded business that will sustain his children's education as well as get his wife a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy bulls for trading

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer is 58 years old, from Nyandarua South and is married. They have two children who are aged 14 and eight years old.

Jenifer is a farmer and has been in it for many years. She has applied for her third loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable her to buy seedlings and fertilizers to use on her farm.

She hopes to borrow more in the future so as to expand her farming projects.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 33-year-old married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be focused and visionary. 

She operates a farm where she grows potatoes, tomatoes and other vegetables. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a productive area, and her primary customers are local consumers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy seedlings and farm inputs. 

Her business goal is to be a successful farmer within five years.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and farm inputs.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for nine years. Edna earns additional income from direct selling of Avon products.

Edna is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like sugar, eggs, soap, charcoal, shampoo, oil, etc. at her general store business. She has successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business. Edna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. Edna dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like sugar, eggs, soap, charcoal,  shampoo, oil, etc.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en: Florencia appreciates the loans she has received from Kiva. She is now requesting a loan of KES 20,000 to buy plastic chairs for her playgroup class.

loans.use: to buy plastic chairs for her playgroup class

loans.name: Muhabat

texts.ru: Мухабат 45 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Мухабат - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав 15 лет назад с 25,000 сом (KGS), благодаря целеустремленности и трудолюбию Мухабат, на сегодняшний день у нее есть: 2 дойные коровы, 2 теленка и 10 овец. Дополнительно Мухабат реализует молоко. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Мухабат обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом для закупки коров, часть средств она потратит на покупку корма для скота. Мухабат намерена увеличить поголовье скота, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи. Доходы от кредита Мухабат планирует вложить в покупку земельного участка для посева многолетних трав. Так как на сегодняшний день ей невыгодно покупать корм.
texts.en: Muhabat is 45 years old, married and together with her husband, is raising four children. Muhabat has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, she practices crop farming and livestock breeding. She started this business 15 years ago with 25,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Muhabat's determination and hard work, she currently has 2 milk cows, 2 calves and 10 sheep on her farm. Additionally, Muhabat sells milk. Her monthly income is about 15,000 som (KGS) per month. For the purpose of further developing her business, Muhabat turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy cows. She will also spend a portion of the loan to buy cattle feed. Muhabat is determined to increase the size of her herd in order to fundamentally increase her family's capital.  Muhabat plans to invest the earnings from the loan to buy a plot of land on which to sow perennial grasses as it is currently uneconomical for her to buy cattle feed rather than grow it.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Morgan

texts.en:
Morgan is 34 years old and is a farmer in Chibombo District, Zambia. Morgan is requesting a loan so that he may obtain a water pump from Rent to Own.

During the dry season in Zambia, Morgan grows and sells vegetables to support his family. Dry season vegetable production is big business for many small farmers in Chibombo District. Using buckets, farmers draw water from nearby wells and streams and produce vegetables to sell in Zambia’s cities.

Despite his age, Morgan is an experienced gardener, selling fresh produce in one of the capital city’s major markets for almost 15 years. He plans to use a water pump to expand his production this year and increase his income.

Rent to Own has completed a business plan with Morgan, and will deliver the water pump directly to his farm. Rent to Own will also provide training on how to properly use and maintain the water pump, and provide on-going support until his loan is complete.

This year Morgan will grow several different high-value vegetables, including green peppers, onions and a local eggplant called “Impwa”.

loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Delton

texts.en:
Delton, age 44, is an experienced vegetable farmer in Chibombo District, Zambia. He is requesting a loan for a water pump that will help him expand his vegetable crops.

Like many farmers in Chibombo District, Delton relies on farming vegetables for a large portion of his income. Previously he has used profits from his vegetable sales to purchase cattle and to support his five children who are attending school. A major challenge Delton faces in his business is a shortage of labour, which makes expanding his farm difficult. With a water pump, Delton stands to be able to free up his labour time and significantly expand his vegetable production.

Rent to Own has worked with Delton to create a business plan for this year’s gardening season and will deliver a water pump directly to his farm. Rent to Own will also provide training on how to properly use and maintain the water pump, and will provide on-going support until he has completed his loan.

This year Delton has already planted a significant area of tomatoes, butternut squash and even cucumbers. He has contacts with traders who regularly travel to his farm to purchase his produce to sell at large markets in Zambia’s Copperbelt region.

loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a fowl run, purchase chicks and stock-feed as well as the feeding accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover his wife's medical treatment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy horses.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel, age 38, is a farmer in Chibombo District, Zambia and is also a teacher at a local school. He is requesting a loan so that he can obtain a water pump to irrigate his vegetable crops. 

Like many people in Chibombo District, Emmanuel grows vegetables during Zambia’s dry season. Vegetable crops generally fetch a good price both at roadside markets and in the major urban centers. Using buckets, farmers irrigate their gardens with water drawn from nearby streams and wells. With a water pump Emmanual believes he can significantly increase his vegetable production. He has already begun growing cabbage and soon hopes to start planting fresh maize and onion.

Rent to Own has worked with Emmanuel to complete a business plan for this gardening season and will deliver the water pump directly to his farm. Rent to Own will also provide training on how to properly use and maintain the water pump, and will provide on-going support until his loan is complete.

loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is 59 years old and is a farmer in Chibombo District, Zambia. In order to expand his vegetable production he is requesting a loan so that he may obtain a water pump from Rent to Own.

Vegetable gardening is big business for many small farmers in Chibombo District. Like most, Benson finds that a major challenge in his business is getting enough labour to help on the farm. Because it is the dry season in Zambia, water needs to be applied to the crops regularly, often brought to the garden by bucket from a nearby well or stream. A water pump would significantly reduce Benson’s need for labour, and allow him to further expand his garden production. 

Rent to Own worked with Benson to create a business plan for his gardening season and will deliver the water pump directly to Benson’s farm. Rent to Own also provides training on how to use and properly maintain the pump, and will check in to provide support until he has paid off his loan.

With the water pump, Benson is planning on growing tomatoes and okra throughout the dry season, supplying the busy markets in Zambia’s Copperbelt province and in the capital city, Lusaka.

loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Kaldykyz

texts.ru: Кылдыкыз 47 лет, замужем, 3 детей. Кылдыкыз имеет среднее образование, по характеру: спокойная, уравновешенная и трудолюбивая. Супруг и дети помогают по бизнесу. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, уже много лет занимается полеводством и животноводством, начав этот бизнес в 1996 году с 40,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Кылдыкыз, у нее в хозяйстве имеется: 1 дойная корова, 20 овец, 1 теленок, 3 лошади и 2 бычка. Обрабатывает 3,36 ГА земли, где выращивает фасоль и клевер.  Ее деятельность приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, от продажи молока, молочной продукции. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кылдыкыз обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом  на покупку овец, часть средств будет потрачена на закупку минеральных удобрений. Доходы от кредита Кылдыкыз планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также, в будущем хочет достроить свой дом.
texts.en: Kaldykyz is 47 years old, married and has three children. Kalydykyz has a secondary education. She is calm, even-tempered and hardworking by nature. Her husband and her children help her with her business. As an additional source of income for her family, she has been practicing crop farming and livestock breeding for many years. She started this business in 1996 with 40,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Kaldykyz's hard work, she has 1 milk cow, 20 sheep, 1 calf, 3 horses and 2 bull calves on her farm. She also cultivates a 3.36 hectare plot of land on which she grows beans and clover. This business brings in about 10,000 som (KGS) per month from the sale of milk and dairy products. For the purpose of the further development of her farm, Kaldykyz turned to MicroFinance Bank "Bai-Tushum." She requested a loan to buy sheep. She will also spend a portion of the loan to buy mineral fertilizers. Kaldykyz plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further expansion of her farm. She also wants to finish building her house in the future.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Laulaau

texts.en:
Laulaau is 63 years old and widowed with nine children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, cabbages, cucumbers, and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years.

Laulaau needs a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, axe, spade, chemicals, and knives. She will use the profits from her sales to support her family. Laulaau joined SPBD in 2009.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, axe, spade, chemicals, and knives

loans.name: Site

texts.en: Site is a 28-year-old woman who is married and has one child. She has a small business providing taxi services. She has been operating this business for two years. Site needs a loan to buy new seat covers, to pay for maintenance, to overhaul the engine, and to register the vehicle. She will use her profits to improve her taxi service and to provide her child with an education. Site joined SPBD in 2008 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy new seat covers, to pay for maintenance, to overhaul the engine, and to register her taxi

loans.name: Kanan

texts.en:
Kanan is a 29-year-old man, who is married and the father of two children. He lives in the Baku region with his family, but for over 20 years they have been IDPs (Internally Displaced Persons) from Shusha city. Kanan’s older child is going to secondary school and his younger child goes to kindergarten. 

Kanan is a welder. He is engaged in welding iron doors and window frames. Today, he wants to repair his broken apparatus and therefore he has applied to Komak Credit Union for a loan of 1000 AZN. Kanan is thankful to Kiva and all its lenders for their help.

loans.use: to pay for repairing his broken apparatus

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison is a 38-year-old married man. He has five children with ages ranging from 1 year to 15 years. Harrison describes himself as polite and understanding. He operates a farm where he grows beans, bananas, and other crops. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in an area with water. He describes his biggest business challenge as a lack of funds. 

Harrison will use this KES 70,000 loan to buy fertilizer for use on his farm. This will enable him to increase production. His business goal is to be a well-known farmer within five years. Harrison hopes that in the future, he will improve his living standards. This is his fourth loan with SMEP DTM, and he successfully repaid his previous loans.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for use on his farm.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Due to financial hardship, Erlinda aims to improve her hog-raising business to generate sufficient income. She is 52 years old and blessed with five children. She and her husband are aspiring to improve their standard of living in order to support the education of her children. 

Having inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of PHP 34,000 to buy hog feed, vitamins, vaccines and additional pigs to raise. Being a patient and industrious mother, she believes that she will improve her business and make it more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins, vaccines and additional pigs to raise

location.town: Brgy. Inaban, Dupax del Norte,Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Cecilia Maritza

texts.es:
Cecilia Maritza tiene 40 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de comida preparada por ella misma en su restaurant, cuenta con clientela considerable, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para la compra de platos, cubiertos, y reposteros para equipar su negocio y de esta manera brindar un servicio con mayor facilidad.
texts.en:
Cecilia Maritza is 40 years old. She lives with her spouse and children in the Oyotún district, a community that makes a living from agriculture, commerce, and stockbreeding. It is situated in the Chiclayo province that pertains to the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

She makes a living selling food prepared by her in her restaurant. She counts on a considerable clientele. She has requested a 1,500 Nuevo Sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase plates, cutlery, and plastic containers to equip her business and so provide service more easily.

loans.use: to purchase plates, cutlery, and plastic containers to equip her business.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is widowed with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lorna is 43 years old and her two children are in school.

Lorna has a general store business in the Philippines. Lorna requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy soft drinks, bread, chips, eggs, canned goods, etc.

Lorna has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, bread, chips, eggs, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Janera

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Janera works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.

Janera is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase items to sell like spices, coffee, eggs, noodles, chips, bread, etc. for her general store business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. Janera hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like spices, coffee, eggs, noodles, chips, bread, etc.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 37 years old and married, and she has one child who is in school.  

She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Jenelyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jenelyn has been pig fattening for 15 years now, and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Josie works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. 

Josie is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Josie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Nyerere Group

texts.en:
Samson, who is in his early 20s, is a married man blessed with a baby boy. For seven years now, Samson has been earning his living by running two businesses: charcoal-selling and a boda boda (motorcycle transport) business. He works from 7am to 7pm daily and is able to make a very good return per month. 

This is Samson's 7th loan request from Kiva partner Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use the loan to restock sacks of charcoal. He used the previous loans to increase his charcoal inventory by purchasing more sacks. Samson is a very hard-working guy. He has paid back all his previous loans successfully. With the profit received, he will cover home expenses and reinvest back into his business. Samson has managed also to begin building his house. He plans to finish building his house and then further expand his businesses. 

Samson will share this loan with his loan group" NYERERE" which consists of two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Mikocheni Group

texts.en:
Rose is a member of Mikocheni Group who has made her living, since 1974, by selling charcoal. Rose is known for being a mother to this group; she encourages the members to work hard and repay their loans accordingly. 

If not for Rose, this group could be dead, because she know how to manage her group members and sometimes she makes the payment for others. 

Rose, who was born mid-1950's, is a widow and has four grown children. She is living with her three grand kids that are enrolled in school. 

She opens her charcoal store from 08 am to 06 pm per working day, and is able to make a very good monthly profit.  Rose also has a chips business with fried meats. She has a helpers in her all businesses. 
 
From Tujijenge Tanzania, Rose is requesting another loan which she will use to buy stock for all her businesses (a sack of Irish potatoes, meat and charcoal). 

With her previous loans, all of which were paid back successfully, Rose maintained her business stock. She received a profit which she used to pay for her grand kids school fees and family welfare.  She dreams of improving her businesses. 

She will share this loan with her loan group, ” MIKOCHENI”, which totals seven members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy stock for of all of her businesses (a sack of Irish potatoes, meat and charcoal).

loans.name: Orita

texts.en:
Orita is a 27-year-old woman with five children. 

She has a small plantation and grows taros, bananas and peanuts to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years.

Orita has requested a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, a pickaxe, a spade and empty water gallon. 

She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. With her profits, Orita hopes to provide good support to her family and kids.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, a pickaxe, a spade and an empty water gallon

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a 27-year-old single man. He describes himself to be visionary. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, bread, soda, rice and other items. His primary customers are regular people. 

Simon will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of rice, sugar, soap and other items. 

His business goal is to be the best within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business. 

This his first loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to buy a permanent house.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice, sugar, soap and other items

loans.name: Dagoberto

texts.es:
Dagoberto tiene 56 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el Caserío Tambillo, una zona rural del Distrito de Santo Tomás, una comunidad de clima variado, con abundante vegetación, ubicado en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de café tiene sembrado 2 ha de la variedad catimore, también se dedica a la crianza y comercio de ganadería , su esposa le apoya en esta labor ordeñando el ganado lechero para ofrecer la leche a sus vecinos, ha solicitado un préstamo de 4 500 nuevos soles para la compra de una vaca y abonos para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café y de esta manera tener una producción oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes y generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Dagoberto is 56 years old and lives with his wife and son in Caserío Tambillo, an area in the rural district of Santo Tomas. They have a varied climate here, with abundant vegetation. It is located in the province Cutervo that belongs to the region Cajamarca in the Northern mountains of Peru. 
He works in agriculture, specifically, in the cultivation of coffee of the catimore variety. He also raises and sells livestock. His wife helps him in his work by milking the dairy cows so they can sell the milk to neighbors. He is asking for a loan of  $1,625 so he can purchase a cow and fertilizer for his coffee fields. This will help him to have a better product to offer his customers and help him to earn more money for his family.

loans.use: purchase a cow and fertilizer for his coffee fields.

loans.name: Pastor

texts.es: El señor Pastor es una persona humilde y trabajadora, tiene 54 años de edad, vive en la provincia de Mizque, se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura y en su tiempo libre trabaja de jornalero. En la anterior cosecha por los problemas climatológicos, su producion agrícola se vio severamanete afectada, las constantes lluvias no dejaron cosechar frejol por los cual sufrió un desequilibrio en sus ingresos económicos. Es una persona responsable en su trabajo y tiene a su dependencia dos de sus hijos que estudian y es importante que sus ingresos económicos estén estables, como no tiene muchos recursos solicita un crédito para la compra de semillas e insumos necesarios para la agricultura, de esta forma mejorara sus ingresos y por consiguiente la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Pastor is a humble and hard-working 54-year-old who lives in Mizque province. He works in agriculture and in his spare time has a job as a day labourer. In the previous harvest his agricultural production was severely affected because of climate problems. Constant rain meant he could not harvest his beans, so his economic income was damaged. He is a responsible person in his work, and two of his children are of school-age and are dependent on him, so it is important for him to achieve economic stability as he does not have much of an income.

He is asking for a loan to buy seeds and the necessary agricultural supplies. In this way, he will improve his income and therefore his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds and agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Sylvanus

texts.en:
Sylvanus is a 39-year-old married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a farm where he grows crops. He has been involved in this business for five years. His primary customers are regular customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be changes in season. 

Sylvanus will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a water pump for pumping water in his farm. His business goal is to be the best within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: buy a water pump for pumping water in his farm

loans.name: Phebie

texts.en:
Phebie is 47 years old and married with four children.

Phebie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like rice, charcoal, shampoo, sugar, eggs, diapers, etc.

Phebie has borrowed and repaid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Phebie aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like rice, charcoal, shampoo, sugar, eggs, diapers, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Elenita

texts.en:
Ma. Elenita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase fish, ice, and plastic bags for her business. Ma. Elenita has been in this business for 24 years now.

In the future, Ma. Elenita would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fish, ice, and plastic bags for her business.

loans.name: Reymonda

texts.en:
Reymonda is 48 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Reymonda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

Reymonda has been pig fattening for five years and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice and from motorcycle transport.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 29 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. Nida works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like eggs, soap, charcoal,  shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Nida has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Nida would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like eggs, soap, charcoal,  shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Meet Kennedy, a father of two. He is a small-scale farmer growing crops and ferrying goods on a motorcycle in Kitale, Kenya. What he likes most about farming is that he is producing food for his community members. His personal highlight is seeing clients satisfied and coming back for more. Drought, pests and diseases pose a very big challenge to Kennedy and the farmers around him. 

With your financial assistance, Kennedy wants to buy a high-yield dairy cow that will provide a more regular and reliable source of income.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is a married woman. She has three children, with ages ranging from 10 years to 18 years. She describes herself as being organized. 

Tabitha operates a retail business where she sells firewood. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are regular customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. 

Tabitha will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more stocks of firewood. Her business goal is to operate a timber yard within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will have an improved livelihood. She will use the anticipated profits to open a timber yard.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of firewood.

loans.name: Lazaro

texts.es:
Lazaro tiene 40 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el Caserío Mangaypa, una zona rural del distrito de Pomahauca, una comunidad de clima cálido, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en La Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, desde hace cuatro años, su esposa le apoya en esta labor, tiene una familia unida, Lazaro ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de abonos para dar mantenimiento a sus cultivos y de esta manera prevenirlo de cualquier tipo de plaga y así tener una producción oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes
texts.en:
Lazaro is 40 years old. He lives with his wife and children in Caserío Mangaypa, a rural area of the Pomahuaca district. A community with a hot climate, its populace makes a living from agriculture, commerce, and stockbreeding. It is located in the Jaén province that belongs to the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

He has made a living from agriculture, specifically coffee cultivation, for four years. His wife supports him in this labor. He has a united family. Lazaro has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1,500 Nuevo Sols to purchase a variety of fertilizers to maintain his crops. In this way, he will protect them from all types of plagues and so have a timely product to offer to his customers.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fertilizers to maintain his crops.

loans.name: Mariku

texts.en:
Meet Mariku, a mixed farmer from Kitale, Kenya. The town's economic activity is agriculture, with a biased focus on maize-farming. Mariku is a father to nine children. He makes money selling milk and maize. 

With such a big family come high upkeep expenses. Mariku resorted to doing personal businesses because he kept coming up short, fully relying on agricultural produce. He has been practicing farming for the past five years. His personal highlight is making returns from yields, despite insufficiency.

What is inspiring about Mariku is his perspective towards life. While others look at big families as an avoidable expense, he looks at it as a gift in disguise, from God, to inspire the provider to work harder and smarter! Since joining Juhudi Kilimo, Mariku has learned that loans are very progressive. With your assistance, Mariku will grow his income, purchasing more poultry.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Teresa Del Socorro

texts.es:
Desde hace doce años Teresa se dedica al comercio.  Ya cuenta con una larga experiencia que  le   ha servido para  conocer los gustos de  sus  clientes,  que visitan a diario su pulpería y salen satisfechos porque encuentran lo que necesitan para su hogar. Este financiamiento servira para  abastecer su pequeño negocio con más variedad de productos. 
El propósito de Teresa es que su negocio  continúe creciendo  y que no haya escasez por ningún motivo.  Por lo tanto, solicitó un crédito para la compra de toallas sanitarias, arroz, café, sopas Maggie y azúcar,  productos  básicos  que cuentan con más demanda en su pulpería.  El préstamo será de gran utilidad, ya que aumentaran las  ganancias para beneficio propio  y de su familia.
texts.en:
Teresa has worked in business for two years. She has a lot of experience which has helped her to understand the tastes of her customers who come to her grocery store every day and who leave satisfied as they find what they need for their homes. This loan will be used to stock up Teresa's small business with a greater variety of products.

Teresa wants her business to continue growing and not to run out of anything. Teresa is applying for a loan in order to buy sanitary towels, rice, coffee, brand name soups and sugar. These are the most popular basic goods in her shop. This loan will be of great help to Teresa as it will increase profits to the benefit of Teresa and her family.

loans.use: to buy sanitary towels, rice, coffee, brand name soups and sugar.

loans.name: Linfrani

texts.es: Linfrani como muchas confesionista es una persona que aprendió del oficio empíricamente con apoyo familiar, es una mujer de 30 años de edad que tiene su negocio establecido en su hogar y principalmente le confecciona a otras empresas, su principal dificultad es la falta de cumplimento en pagos de las empresas que le confeccionan lo que genera muchos atrasos e incumplimiento de pagos a las 3 personas que trabajan para ella, su principal sueño es ampliar su negocio y crear una línea de camisetas para distribuir entre las personas que por cosas del oficio ha conocido a lo largo de su trayecto empresarial, solicita un apoyo financiero para comprar una maquina botonera con la intención de estar más cerca de este sueño, optimizar el tiempo y costos.
texts.en: Like many dressmakers, Linfrani learned her trade on the job with support from her family. Linfrani is 30 years old and set up her business in her home. She mainly makes items for other businesses. Her greatest difficulty is that businesses don't comply with payment terms for the items produced, causing delays and meaning that Linfrani cannot pay her three employees. Linfrani's biggest dream is to expand her business and create a line of shirts to sell to people that she has met through her business. Linfrani is applying for financial support in order to buy a button machine in order to save time and money and to move closer to achieving her dream.

loans.use: to buy a button machine to save time and money.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 21-year-old single young man from Deir El balah. His father works as an employee in the public sector where he earns a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Ali is a student in a local university where he studies English literature. He would like to finish his studies and take a BA degree so he can find a job as a teacher. 

Ali took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Ali will be able to read articles and write his reports easily. 

Ali appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy soft drinks and continue selling them at a wholesale price.

loans.name: Maria Esterfilia

texts.es:
María Esterfila tiene 55 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el Caserío de Cascarrillo, una zona rural del distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de cerveza y chicha de jora, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de mesas, sillas y terminar la construcción de su vivienda y de esta manera equipar su negocio.
texts.en:
María Esterfila is 55 years old and lives with her husband and children in the Cascarillo village, a rural area in the Buenos Aires district of Morropon province in the Piura region of Peru's northern coast. Here the people make a living working in farming, cattle-raising, and running businesses.

María makes a living selling beer and corn liquor. She runs her business out of her home. María is applying for a loan of 1500 Nuevo Soles in order to to buy chairs and tables and to finish building her home for her business.

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables and to finish building her home.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
Mónica tiene 36 años de edad, cliente vive en casa propia de material rustico, con sus dos menores hijos en el Caserío Las Juntas, una zona rural del distrito de Pomahuaca, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza como cremas, cosméticos, perfumes y accesorios, cuenta con clientela en la zona en su mayoría sus clientes son mujeres, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de productos de belleza y de esta manera hacer crecer su negocio que le permitirá tener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Monica is 36 years old. She lives in her own home made of crude materials with her two youngest children in the Las Juntas village in a rural zone of the Pomahuaca district. Its populace makes a living from agriculture, commerce, and stockbreeding. It is situated in the Jaén province that belongs to the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

She makes a living from the sales of beauty products such as creams, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories. She counts on a clientele in the area. The majority of her customers are women. She has requested a loan of 1,000 Nuevo Sols for the purchase of a variety of beauty products to make her business grow, which will allow her to make a higher income.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of beauty products to grow her business.

loans.name: María Mariela

texts.es:
María es una mujer pujante y trabajadora de 54 años de edad, que, durante más de 10 años se ha dedicado a trabajar en el campo de las confecciones, el oficio lo aprendió de manera empírica y poco a poco fue perfeccionando su técnica y ampliando sus conocimientos, esto le ha permitido obtener reconocimiento en el sector y de esta forma genera los recursos suficientes para solventar sus gastos personales. Trabaja de lunes a sábado y recibe el apoyo de un hermano para confeccionar a terceros.
El crédito solicitado se destinará para comprar una máquina plana, con la que podrá optimizar el tiempo de trabajo y cumplir con la producción para sus entregar de manera oportuna a sus clientes, cumpliendo con los requerimientos de calidad que éstos exigen; esto le permitirá tener un incremento en el nivel de ingresos que percibe por su labor.
María manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es darle continuidad a su negocio, hacer que éste crezca en clientela y producción, para garantizar una mejor rentabilidad y estabilidad económica, con lo que podrá disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
María is a strong and hard-working woman. At 54 years old, she has now spent ten years working as a seamstress. She learned the trade on the job and gradually perfected her technique and increased her knowledge. This has helped María to become well-known in this business sector and to earn enough money to cover personal costs. María works from Monday to Saturday and receives support from one of her brothers.

This loan will be used to buy a tabletop sewing machine, which will allow her to optimise María's working time and to produce orders to deliver to customers on time, and at the expected level of quality. This will allow María to earn a higher income for her work.

María tells us that her greatest desire is for her business to continue functioning and for her number of customers and production level to grow. This will make the business more profitable and more financially stable and María will be able to enjoy better well-being and a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a tabletop sewing machine.

loans.name: Kutogwa Group

texts.en:
Eva was born in the early 1980s and is single. She has a son who is in school. For three years, she has been managing her life by running a pharmacy. Eva had been employed in someone else's pharmacy since 2008 before switching to her own. She opens her business from 7:00 am to 10:30 pm each working day and is able to make a good monthly profit.
 
This is her first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. Eva will use this loan to buy cosmetics, medicines, and other items for her pharmacy.  In the coming years, Eva would like to open another branch to grow her income. She will share this loan with her loan group Kutogwa, which totals three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, medicines, and other items for her pharmacy.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos, es un caficultor del departamento de Jinotega. Vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos en su finca de 4.2 hectáreas de las cuales 2.1 son de café. Esta última, es la principal actividad económica de este pequeño productor que está integrado al proceso de certificación de Comercio Justo.

En los últimos tres ciclos, él ha venido incrementando su producción mediante la implementación de un plan de manejo integrado en su finca. No obstante, para mejorar la calidad de su café, está solicitando un financiamiento para la construcción de un beneficio húmedo que le permita garantizar un procesamiento adecuado a su producto. Esta inversión junto a la otra solicitud que está gestionando para el mantenimiento de su cafetal, le permitirá obtener mayor rendimiento y calidad de su café en los próximos ciclos, contribuyendo así a la sostenibilidad de su finca y el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is a coffee grower who lives in Jinotega department. He lives with his wife and their three children on his 4.2-acre farm, of which 2.1 acres are reserved for coffee. Coffee-growing is the main economic activity of this small producer, who is part of the Fair Trade certification process.

Throughout the last three loan cycles, he has been increasing his production by implementing a management plan for his farm. However, in order to improve his coffee quality, he is asking for a loan to build a wet method processing plant that will allow him to guarantee the right processing for his product. This investment, together with the other loan that he is managing to maintain his coffee plantation, will allow him to obtain a better harvest and higher quality for his coffee over the coming loan cycles. This will contribute to the sustainability of his farm and to his family's well-being.

loans.use: to build a wet method coffee processing plant.

loans.name: Mastura

texts.ru: Мастура жительница маленького района Яван. Ей 46 лет. Она, как и многие жители Таджикистана занимается животноводством. Она разводит маленьких скотин. У нее имеется барашки, козлята и одна корова. Мастура имеет доход от купли продажи скотин. Недавно ее сын уехал в Российскую Федерацию на заработки,  чтобы помочь финансово маме и сестренкам. Сыну Мастуры 19 лет, дочерям 13 и 10 лет. Мастура на заемные деньги хочет приобрести теленок и выращивать крупнорогатых скотов. Ей не хватает определенной суммы денег, чтобы совершить покупку. Поддержите Мастуру.
texts.en: Mastura is a resident of the small region of Yavan. She is 46 and, like many in Tajikistan, works in animal husbandry. She raises livestock and has sheep, goats and one cow. Mastura earns income from buying and selling animals. Not long ago her son went to the Russian Federation to work, in order to help his mother and sisters financially. He is 19 and her daughters are 13 and 10. Mastura wants to buy calves with the money she borrows and raise cattle. She doesn't have enough capital of her own to achieve this. Please support her.

loans.use: to buy calves, with the goal of increasing the number of livestock she is able to raise

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann's greatest wish in life is to have her two children finish their education and become professionals someday. She is 31 years old and married. While her husband manages their farm, Marry Ann has a direct selling of cosmetics products business. She chose this business because she considers it as a basic need of everyone. Sometimes she feels tired of the business she has now, but she is doing her best to maintain and grow as well. Mary Ann wants to borrow a loan of PHP 18,000 to purchase cosmetics products to sell. She hopes to satisfy her customers and encourage more customers in order to increase her sales. She believes that her business will make a big contribution towards having her wish come true.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics products to sell.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is a 44-year-old very hardworking gentleman. He is married to Vina and is a father of two children. He has been engaged in the motorcycle transport business for the last three years with a monthly income of about PHP 5,000. He has acquired his loan of PHP 12,000, which will help him in purchasing spare parts for his motorcycle. He is likely to earn more due to the increased flexibility and already established customer base.
 
Victor plans to use the proceeds to repay his loan as well as boost his savings account. He hopes to buy another motorcycle from his accumulated savings. He is an industrious gentleman who is determined to achieve his goal and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Al- Shamakh Group

texts.en:
Al- Shamakh is a group that consists of four women from Hodeidah, Yemen. They are requesting a loan of 180,000 YER from AMB.

Rockya is a 43-year-old widow and a mother of three children. Her oldest child is 19 years old and the youngest one is 8 years old. She is the leader of the group. Rockya lives with her family in a simple house in a poor area in Hodeidah. Her husband passed away several years ago. Rockya assumed all of the responsibilities of her children and became the sole breadwinner for them. In order to provide her children with their necessities, she decided to begin her own business. Four years ago, Rockya started her own business going door-to-door, selling makeup, accessories, and cosmetics. In time, she could open a small store in her area. Recently, she wanted to improve her business, but most of what she earns goes to expenses for her children. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 60,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more incense, perfumes, and accessories to resell them. Rockya looks forward to expanding her business through opening a large store and providing her children with a secure future.

loans.use: to purchase more incense, perfumes, and accessories to resell them.

loans.name: Rizza

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rizza works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from pig fattening. Rizza is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional items like rice, eggs, charcoal, shampoo, sugar, groceries, etc. to sell in her general store business.

Rizza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like rice, eggs, charcoal, shampoo, sugar, and groceries

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 42 years old and married with one child who is in school, Rowena works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

Rowena has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Rowena would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, over machine and generator.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a face massage machine, a chair, and a big mirror.

loans.name: Cerapio Del Carmen

texts.es:
Cerapio del Carmen es un productor del norte de Nicaragua. Es padre de 6 hijos a quienes, junto a su esposa, han criado con los ingresos obtenidos de la producción de café. Este emprendedor genera 4 empleos en la comunidad durante el año. En el ciclo anterior obtuvo un aumento de 130 quintales de café pergamino con respecto a la cosecha anterior, debido al manejo semi tecnificado que ha venido implementando en su finca.

Este pequeño productor ha estado relacionado con la caficultura toda su vida, la cual ha adoptado como su principal actividad económica desde hace más de 10 años. Ha obtenido 3 financiamientos de la Asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC), los cuales ha logrado cancelar gracias a los buenos resultados obtenidos. 

Para este ciclo, él está solicitando un financiamiento para la compra de insumos que le permita asegurar el mantenimiento de 3.5 hectáreas de café; con los que aumentará la productividad y rentabilidad en la próxima cosecha. Su meta es aumentar las áreas de siembra para mejorar la condición económica de su familia.
texts.en:
Cerapio del Carmen is a coffee producer. He is the father of six children. Together with his wife, he has raised them thanks to the income he receives from his activity. He is an entrepreneur who generates jobs for four persons from his community every year. During the last season, he increased his production of parchment coffee [dried, but un-hulled coffee beans] by 130 quintals compared to the previous one, thanks to the improvements he has been implementing in his farm.

This small producer has worked with coffee his whole life. It has been his main economic activity for more than ten years. He has received three loans from Asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC) and has paid them back on time thanks to his good results.

This time, he is requesting a loan to buy supplies for the maintenance activities needed to keep 3.5 hectares. These supplies will increase his productivity and profitability for the upcoming season. His goal is to enlarge his plantations in order to improve his family’s financial situation.

loans.use: to buy supplies to give maintenance to 3.5 hectares of coffee plantations.

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es:
Máximo es un productor de una pequeña comunidad en el norte de Nicaragua. Junto a su esposa y 5 hijos se ha dedicado a la caficultura desde hace 25 años. Produce alrededor de 55 quintales de café pergamino por ciclo. Sus metas son tecnificar su finca y aumentar los rendimientos de su producción a través del buen manejo, mantenimiento y administración que ha comenzado a implementar en su pequeña finca.

Como parte de este proceso de mejoramiento, Máximo solicita un financiamiento para la compra de fertilizantes y abonos; con los que mejorará la nutrición de las plantas de café con que cuenta y aumentará su cosecha. Su meta es mejorar económicamente por lo que se ha propuesto reinvertir parte de sus utilidades para aumentar las áreas establecidas.
texts.en:
Máximo is a small coffee producer from a small community in Northern Nicaragua. Together with his wife and five children, he has worked with coffee for twenty-five years. He produces around 55 quintals of parchment coffee [dried, but un-hulled coffee beans] each season. His goal is to modernize his small farm and make it more productive by better managing and maintaining it.

As part of this improvement process, Máximo is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and compost to nurture his coffee plants better and get a better harvest. His goal is to improve his financial situation, so he has set the goal of reinvesting some of his profits to enlarge his plantations.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and compost for his coffee plantations.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy paint drying equipment, fiberglass, tarp and other necessary materials

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is 60 years old and widowed, and she has seven children. She earns a living by farming corn in the Philippines. She has been farming corn for two years, and she earns additional income by growing vegetables.

Trinidad is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional varieties of corn and sacks of fertilizer.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional varieties of corn and sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru: Саодат из района Мастчох города Худжанд. Ей 39 лет. У нее трое детей, двое из которых учатся в школе, а один студент. Муж работает в России. Сама Саодат занимается животноводством. На протяжении 8 лет она выращивает коров и телят. Старшему сыну Саодат 20 лет. Он учится во втором курсе Худжандского Государственного Университета, в факультете "Кибернетика". Он прилежно учится и очень заинтересован в своей будущей профессии. Сейчас ему необходимо оплатить за учебный год, однако его семья не имеет финансовой возможности. Мать решила помочь сыну и обратилась за кредитом в размере 650 долларов США. Она очень хочет, чтобы ее сын успешно закончил университет и надеется, что Вы дадите ему шанс.
texts.en: Saodat is from the city of Khujand in the Mastchoh region. She is 39 and has three children, two of which are in grade school and one in university. Her husband is working in Russia. Saodat herself works in animal husbandry. She has been raising cows and calves for eight years. Saodat's oldest son is 20 and a second-year student at Khujand State University, in the cybernetics department. He is a diligent student and very interested in his future profession. Now he needs to pay his tuition, but his family doesn't have the money. His mother has decided to help her son and is requesting a loan of $650 USD. She very much wants her son to graduate from university and hopes that you will give him this chance.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university tuition

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en: Danilo is 22 years old and married; he has two children. He is raising his family in a rural community, aiming for a happy and successful life. In addition to crop farming, he engages in raising hogs to earn additional income. He plans to acquire more pigs to raise, but he has inadequate capital. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of PHP 22,000. He will use the loan to buy hog feed, vitamins, additional piglets, and materials needed to improve the pig pen. He believes that his loan will enable him to improve the business and make it more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins, additional piglets, and materials for improving the pig pen

location.town: Brgy. Mabasa, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi est majoritairement composé de femmes monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 39 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Sabalibougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’encens, de légumes, de téléphones et de vêtements. Dans le but de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Haya (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente d’encens de meilleures qualités. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 4 cartons d’eau de Cologne, 6kg de magnonkissèni, et 7 bouteilles de parfums de qualité au grand marché de Bamako. Pour faire de l’encens, on imbibe le magnonkissèni dans l’eau de Cologne pendant au moins 2 semaines puis on l’assaisonne avec des parfums. Ce produit ainsi obtenu avec des odeurs impeccables est prête à la vente en détails et à crédits à Sabalibougou et en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Haya espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Benkadi Group is largely made up of monogamous women. On average, they are 39 years old and have three children. They all live in Sabalibougou, a neighborhood in Bamako, and met through neighborhood ties.

The group members sell incense, legumes, telephones, and clothing. With the goal of increasing their available stock, the group members decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second group loan cycle.

Mrs. Haya (the woman seated at far right in the photo) has an excellent reputation in the sale of the best quality incense. She plans to use her loan to purchase four boxes of cologne, six kilograms of magnonkissèni [a type of nut or seed], and seven bottles of good quality perfume. This product is thus made with the perfect scents and is ready to be sold in Sabalibougou and door-to-door to a customer base made up mainly of women.

Mrs. Haya hopes to see an average monthly profit of 90,000 CFA francs from this loan, which will be reinvested in the business. Her goal for this relationship with Soro Yiriwaso is to purchase a plot of residential land.

loans.use: To purchase the raw materials to make incense.

loans.name: Gabriel Climaco

texts.es:
Gabriel Clímaco tiene 58 años de edad, está casado y es padre de 6 hijos, Tiene experiencia como técnico industrial, actividad de la que se jubiló, decidiendo dedicarse posteriormente a la caficultura, ya que reconoce que este rubro tiene un alto potencial económico.

Su finca es de 18 hectáreas de las cuales 16 las ha destinado al cultivo de café. Está certificado por Comercio Justo y UTZ. Su producción en los últimos tres ciclos ha venido incrementándose pasando de 260 a 400 quintales de café pergamino. 

Para este ciclo, Gabriel está solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar los insumos y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su plantación de café, lo cual está seguro le ayudará a obtener una mejor producción.
Una de sus metas es mejorar la administración de la finca y reinvertir en ella para que esta sea cada vez más eficiente y heredársela a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gabriel Clímaco is 58 years old, married, and the father of six children. He has experience as an industrial technician, but he is now retired from that profession. Gabriel later decided to devote his time to coffee farming since he recognized the high earnings potential from this line of work.

His farm measures 18 hectares, of which 16 hectares is used for growing coffee. Gabriel is a Fair Trade and UTZ certified grower. His production from the past three cycles has increased from 260 to 400 quintals (1 quintal = 100 kg) of coffee beans in parchment.

For this cycle, Gabriel is requesting a loan so that he can buy supplies and fertilizers for maintaining his coffee farm. He is confident that the loan will help him to obtain better production. One of his goals is to improve the management of his farm by reinvesting into his business so that it becomes more efficient each time. He would also like to leave the farm as an inheritance for his children.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers for maintaining his coffee farm.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en: Sally is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself as experienced. She operates a retail business, where she sells foodstuffs. She says her family is challenged by the lack of a water storage facility. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy a water storage facility, for storing clean water for domestic use. She hopes that, in the future, she will be successful and have a good life. This is her 10th loan from SMEP DTM. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a facility for storing clean water, for domestic use

loans.name: Mpunga Group

texts.en:
Benjamini is a young man in his late twenties, who is not married. He is engaged with a business of general store, selling dry food items, soft drinks, and other things. He has been in this enterprise for eighteen months and manages to make a very good monthly profit. Benjamini opens his business from 7:00am to 8:30pm, per working day.

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is Benjamini’s second loan request. He will use his loan to replenish his enterprise with some products which most customers demand, but which are missing in his shop. He used the previous loan (which he managed to repay successfully) to buy sold-out items for his shop. Benjamini used the business profit to cover his welfare, and he saved part of it in his bank account. He dreams that one day, he will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house.

Benjamini will share this loan with his loan group, ”Mpunga,” which totals two members. The members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to replenish his shop with some products which most customers demand

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
La Señora Ana es una socia fundadora del grupo de cerdito Los Talvos, en todo el tiempo que se encuentra en este grupo ha fortalecido la amistad con toda sus amigas. Vive por los alrededores de la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, es reconocida por su importante producción de maíz, teniendo como atractivos las lagunas de Chochapamba (llenas de Totoras), su gente es trabajadora, amable y gentil.
La Señora. Ana tiene 64 años de edad, es viuda y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 10 hijos mayores de edad, dos hijos solteros trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, los hijos casados viven independientes, la casa en la que vive es propia.
Doña Ana se dedica a la atención de su tienda, labora de domingo a domingo, también se dedica a la agricultura y crianza de animales pequeños. El dinero de su crédito es para comprar víveres para su tienda ya que va ampliarla con más productos. Su meta es crecer en el negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana is a founding member of the Communal Bank “Los Talvos”. Throughout the entire time that she has been part of the group, the camaraderie with all of her friends has gotten stronger. Ana lives in the neighborhood that surrounds the parish of Valle in the city of Cuenca, which is known for being a major producer of corn and having attractions, such as the Lakes of Chochapamba, which are full of totora reeds. The people are hardworking, friendly, and kind.

Sra. Ana is 64 years old, widowed, and has 10 grown children. Two of them are single and help her financially. The ones who are married live independently. She owns the house in which she lives.

Doña Ana manages a store where she works Sunday through Sunday. She also devotes time to farming and raising small animals. The money from her loan will be used to buy provisions for her store so that she can expand her inventory with more products. Her goal is to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy provisions to sell in her store.

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en: Shadrack is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself as "industrious." He operates a business, where he grinds maize to produce maize flour, which he sells. He says his family challenge is a shortage of water. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy a water tank. He hopes that in the future, he will access water easily. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Carlos Marío

texts.es:
Carlos de 38 años de edad, es una persona casada que estudio hasta sexto grado, vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos. Carlos se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. Junto a su esposa.

Carlos junto a su esposa se dedican a la agricultura, oficio que aprendió de su padre; para llegar a la parcelas camina 2  Km y trabaja durante la mañana y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a ordeñar la vacas que poseen y así vender la leche en los alrededores.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar tres vacas  que le ayudara en un futuro para incrementar la producción de leche para la venta y obtener ingresos adicionales para su familia.

Carlos planea que con los ingresos podrá comprar un terreno donde vivir, ya que actualmente solo cuidan una vivienda que no es de ellos.
texts.en:
Carlos, age 38, is married, and he went to school through the sixth grade.  He lives with his wife and their two children.  Carlos gets up at 4:30 a.m. with his wife.  Carlos and his wife are farmers, a trade he learned from his father.  He walks two kilometers to get to the farm land.  He works during the morning, and his wife devotes herself to the household chores and milking the cows they have.  This way she sells the milk in the surrounding areas.

The loan that he is requesting is to buy three cows that will help increase milk production for sale and get additional income for his family in the future.

Carlos plans on using the income to buy land where they can live.  Now they only care for a house that is not theirs.

loans.use: to buy three cows.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Sonia works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from food vending.

Sonia is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF. She will use this amount to buy supplies for her fishing business, including fishing nets, gasoline, etcetera.

Sonia has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her fishing business, including fishing nets, gasoline, etcetera.

loans.name: José Romeo

texts.es:
José de 57 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado de educación básica. Está casado desde hace 34 años su esposa se dedica  a los oficios domésticos y al comercio informal de venta de leche y queso; tuvieron en común 4 hijos de los cuales solo uno está con ellos  y él se dedica a la agricultura.

José es agricultor en pequeño,  se ha dedicado a esta actividad durante 40 años el trabajo lo aprendió de sus padres quienes le enseñaron la actividad desde que estaba muy joven, decide emprender esta actividad debido que no encontró otra forma de sacar adelante a sus hijos y darles la alimentación que requerían; además,  de este trabajo el cliente se dedica a la ganadería ya que su esposa se dedica a la venta de leche y queso.

Pero el trabajo principal es la agricultura, trabaja 5 horas al día y se desplaza 2 kilómetros para llegar a la parcela y lo hace en caballo a veces en carreta y a veces a pie.


Él utilizara el crédito para pagar el arrendamiento de un terreno donde cultivara.  El préstamo es importante ya que no tiene un lugar propio donde cultivar los granos y con el préstamo tendrá donde además dice que lo necesita porque es la fuente principal de alimento de su familia. 

Para su negocio sueña con un día tener su propio terreno donde cultivar,  para producir más y tener  mejores ganancias;  para su familia desea seguirlos apoyando así como todo el tiempo que él ha estado a cargo de ellos.  

Él pretende ampliar el negocio cultivando otros productos que le mejoren los ingresos como hortalizas y verduras y así t mejorara la dieta alimenticia de su familia.
texts.en:
José, 57 years old, studied through the sixth grade of primary school. He has been married for 34 years. His wife takes care of the household duties and has an informal business selling milk and cheese. They have 4 children, of whom only one is with them, and he works in farming.

José is a small-scale farmer. He has done this work for 40 years. He learned the work from his parents, who taught him it since he was very young. He decided to do this work since he did not find another way of moving his children forward and giving them the food they needed. In addition to this work, he also raises livestock, since his wife sells milk and cheese.

But the main work is farming. He works 5 hours a day and travels 2 kilometers in order to get to the parcel of land. He goes by horse, sometimes in a cart, and sometimes on foot.

He will use the loan to pay the rent on a piece of land he will cultivate. The loan is important, since he does not have his own place to grow the grain, and with the loan he will have a place. He also says that he needs it because it is the principal source of food for his family.

For his business, he dreams of one day having his own land to cultivate, in order to produce more and to have better profits. For his family, he wants to continue supporting them as he has for all the time they have been in his care.

He hopes to expand the business, growing other products that will improve his income, such as vegetables and greens, and in this way improve his family’s diet.

loans.use: to pay the rent on a piece of land he will cultivate

loans.name: Rodrigo Ernesto

texts.es: Rodrigo es soltero pero tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 11 años que se encuentran asistiendo a la escuela y dice Rodrigo que aunque no vive con sus hijos si les apoya en todos lo que ellos necesitan, Rodrigo tiene 35 años de edad, vive con su madre y se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 15 años, manifiesta que le va bien en la siembra de papas ya que les da un correcto cuidado a sus plantas, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono y fungicidas para tener sanos sus cultivos, Rodrigo aspira mejora su sembríos para mantener a sus hijos y que sigan estudiando
texts.en:
Rodrigo is single, but he has two children who are 9 and 11 years old and attend school. Rodrigo says that although he doesn't live with his children, he supports them with everything they need.  He is 35 years old and lives with his mother and has been a farmer for 15 years. He states that he does well planting potatoes and that he provides proper care to his plants. 

He will use the proceeds of the loan to buy fertilizer and fungicide to keep his plants healthy. Rodrigo's goal is to improve his crops so he can support his children and so they can continue with their studies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and fungicide.

loans.name: José Osmar

texts.es:
José de 28 años de edad, es una persona casada que estudio hasta noveno grado,  vive junto a su esposa e hijo de 3 años de edad.

José se levanta a las 5:30 a.m. Junto a su esposa que le apoya en la actividades agrícolas durante la mañana. Él se dedica a la agricultura, este trabajo se lo enseño sus padres.  Para llegar a la parcelas camina 2  Km.
	El  préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una vaca que  le ayudara en un futuro para incrementar la producción de leche para la venta y obtener ingresos adicionales.

José planea que con los ingresos que obtenga, comprar más animales.
texts.en:
José, age 28, is married, and he went to school through the ninth grade.  He lives with his wife and their three year old child.  José gets up at 5:30 a.m.  His wife helps him with the agricultural activities in the morning.  He is a farmer, and his parents taught him this work.  He walks two kilometers to get to the farm land.

The loan that he is requesting is to buy a cow.  This will help  to increase milk production to sell and to get additional income in the future.  With the income that he gets, José plans to buy more animals.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 54 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar. María se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos desde hace 6 años y de esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. María desea mantener su negocio por mucho más tiempo por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de pollos para criarlos y venderlos. De esta forma espera mejorar sus ventas e ingresos y al mismo tiempo  mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en:
María, age 54, lives in her own house with her family.  María has been raising and selling chickens for six years.  This is how she earns a living and supports her household.

María wishes to keep her business for a long time.  Therefore, she has made the decision to request this loan from FUSAI.  She will use the loan to buy a greater quantity of chickens to raise and sell.  This way she hopes to improve her sales and income.  At the same time, she hopes to improve her living conditions and those of her family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of chickens to raise and sell.

loans.name: Teresiah

texts.en:
Teresiah, a married mother of three children, describes herself as honest. For 20 years now she has been operating a farm where she grows carrots, potatoes and peas. Her business is located in a busy and productive area, and her primary customers are of all types. Her biggest business challenge is  a lack of enough farm inputs. 

Teresiah will use the Kes 15000 loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her life economically. This will be her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Cecilia, a mother of five who sells milk and maize from her farm for a living. She has been doing this for the past 20 years. Making profits after all the hard work that goes into farming is the part she enjoys most. Like other farmers in her area, she constantly worries about pests, diseases and drought. 

With your assistance, Cecilia will venture into poultry farming because of the huge business potential in the region. The additional income will offset some of her farming-related expenses that give her sleepless nights. Cecilia says, "My children will be very excited about the luxury of eating eggs too!"

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Francisco Javier
