texts.es: Don Francisco es un comerciante desde hace  de 20 años, actividad que ha desempeñado su familia toda la vida, inicio con una tienda de abarrotes la cual marchaba a cabalidad pero el pago del crédito que requirió para lograr esta tienda lo quebró, con las pocas ganancias que obtuvo y aprovechando su gran habilidad como comerciante estableció un restaurante y no solo eso una comercializadora de chorizos, sus clientes han manifestado un alto grado de satisfacción con este servicio pues sus comidas son frescas y ricas en sabor en especial sus tan famosos chorizos, solicita el crédito para la compra de materia prima, pues él tiene su propia receta para hacer sus chorizos le da un toque propio, este humilde, respetuoso pero ante todo hombre trabajador tiene como sueño comprar su propio local para no pagar arriendo, hacer de sus chorizos un producto indispensable para sus clientes y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su esposa y tres hijos =)
texts.en:
Francisco has been a businessman for twenty years, an activity that his family has always carried out. He began with his own grocery store that he managed thoroughly. However, loan payments that he took out to start this store made it collapse. With the small amount of earnings that he received, and by taking advantage of his great abilities as a businessman, he established his own restaurant, and also a sausage production business. His customers have shown a high level of satisfaction because his food is fresh and delicious, especially his famous sausage. 

He is requesting a loan to buy supplies, as his own sausage recipe gives it his own touch. He is humble and respectful, and more than anythig else a hard-working man. He dreams to own his own locale so that he doesn't have to pay rent, to make his sausage an essential product for his customers, and offer his wife and three children a better quality of life. =)

loans.use: to buy supplies for his own sausage recipe.

loans.name: María Gloria

texts.es:
María es una mujer de trabajo duro y esfuerzos pues desde hace un tiempo trabaja como vendedora ambulante de elementos de aseo para el hogar como traperos, escobas, baldes, desinfectantes, entre otros.
Esta actividad la alterna en ocasiones con la compra y venta de mercancía como ropa, calzado y accesorios.
En estos momentos solicita el crédito para ampliar su portafolio de productos, comprándolos de contado y aumentando su utilidad, entre estos productos se encuentran incluidos algunos desinfectantes y limpiadores.
Su motivación para trabajar diariamente son sus tres hijas que siempre la reciben con una sonrisa al llegar a su casa después de un pesado día de trabajo. Su esposo no puede trabajar ya que presenta algunas limitaciones de salud graves.
Su objetivo es aumentar sus ganancias y ampliar su negocio, generando posiblemente un empleo.
Su mayor sueño es ver a sus hijas convertidas en unas profesionales y tener casa propia.
Su mayor desafío es la falta de capital para trabajar
texts.en:
María is a hard-working woman who puts forth great effort. She has been working for some time selling household cleaning supplies door-to-door. She sells such items as mops, brooms, buckets, disinfectants, etc. Sometimes she alternates and buys/sells merchandise such as clothing, shoes, and accessories. 

She is asking for a loan at this time so she can expand her portfolio of products, buying for cash and increasing her profits. Included in these products are disinfectants and cleaning supplies. Her three daughters are her motivation to work every day. They always greet her with a smile when she returns home after a hard day's work. Her husband is unable to work due to some serious health issues. 

Her goal is to increase her income and expand her business, and possibly to hire an employee. Her biggest dream is to see her daughters become professionals and to have their own home. Her biggest challenge is the lack of working capital.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of products such as disinfectants, brooms, mops, etc.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a single woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be determined and honest. 

She operates a farm where she grows carrots, potatoes and peas. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy and productive place, and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of enough farm inputs. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more seeds to plant to enable her to increase production. 

Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will economically sustain her family. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more seeds to plant to enable her to increase production.

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle, 45 years of age, is married and blessed with six children. She has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost eight years and earns a net income of PHP 200 daily. Her net income from her business is usually spent on the school allowances of their children. 

Due to insufficient funds, she would like to avail a loan of PHP 14,000 to purchase noodles, sugar, coffee, cooking oil, food seasonings, and beverages to sell. She is hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, sugar, coffee, cooking oil, food seasonings, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
As a parent of two children, Analyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish. Analyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her fishing business.

Analyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, a mother of five, has been keeping dairy cows and growing maize for the last 15 years. She makes income from selling milk, maize grains and other personal businesses. The most fulfilling part of her job is satisfied customers coming for more. However, it is hard for farmers in Kitale because the drought wilts crops and diseases attack animals. 

Grace is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. That has proven successful in the region. With the additional venture, her family will enjoy eggs and additional income for school fees.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Amylie

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Amylie works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling vegetables in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from a general store and from raising pigs. Amylie is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Amylie has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Shella

texts.en:
Shella wants to become a police officer in the future. She studies at the university in Misamis Occidental, taking a Bachelor of Science in Criminology. 

Her parents are earning a living on their own farm. She has just joined GDMPC and borrowed a new loan to cover the cost for the second semester tuition fees. 

Shella wants to become successful in order for her parents to be proud of her.

loans.use: to cover the cost of her second semester tuition fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy compost.

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma is 43 years old and married, with four children who are in school. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. 

Lerma is borrowing PHP 20,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to pay for laborers' salaries during the rice harvest.

Lerma has been farming rice for nine years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to pay for laborers' salaries during the rice harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock and increase sales

loans.name: María Salvadora

texts.es:
María de 30 años de edad, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura. María se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. Junto a su esposo  para realizar sus actividades diarias.

 María se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura, oficio que le ha enseñado su esposo durante la mañana trabajan en las parcelas camina 2 K.m. Para llegar y en el transcurso de la tarde se dedican a ordeñar las vacas para vender la leche.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar dos vacas lecheras,  para  producir mas leche para la venta y así incrementar sus ingresos.

 María planea  en un futuro comprar un terreno, para pastar sus animales ya que actualmente alquila.
texts.en:
María is 30 years old and her husband is a farmer. She gets up at 4:30am along with her husband so they can start their daily activities. Having been taught what to do by her husband, she too works in the fields which are located 2km away. In the afternoons they care for the cows so they can sell the milk.

The loan that María is seeking will be used to buy cows so they have more milk to sell and in this way increase income. In the future she would like to buy more land where the cows can graze. At the moment the land she uses is rented.

loans.use: buy more cows

loans.name: Terlan

texts.en:
Terlan is 63 years old, married, and has four children. He has been married for 39 years and is living with his wife in Abseron region. All of his children are married. Terlan has been in the gardening business for long years. He plants different fruits (apples, cherries, pears, etc.), then picks and sells this produce at the markets.

 Terlan loves his work: loves taking care of trees, watering and picking the fruit. Previously he took a loan from Kiva and all of his repayments were on time. Today is spring and trees blossom. At this time trees need fertilizer and care, especially. Therefore, Terlan needs 1300 AZN-Azerbaijan New Manat in order to buy fertilizers to support his business. He says great thanks to all lenders.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to support his business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new dryer, hair products and start selling cosmetics in the same room.

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a 27-year-old married man from Gaza city. He is a father with one small son. For the past year, Abdallah has been working in his grocery store where he sells regular consumer products like rice, sugar, and milk. He would like to improve the grocery store conditions but he does not have enough money. 

Abdallah took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more products to resell in his grocery store. By taking this loan, Abdallah will be able to increase his sales and also his income. 

Abdallah appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy more products to resell in his grocery store

loans.name: Kholdona

texts.ru: Холдона умелая и опытная швея, проживающая в районе Хамадони. Ей 47 лет. Она мать двоих сыновей и двоих дочерей. Ее муж занимается продажей овощей на рынке. Сама Холдона у себя дома занимается шитьем. Она очень ответсвенный человек. Каждый свой заказ она старается сдать во время. Холдона занимается швейным делом уже три года. Ей помогает дочь. Они вместе шьют платья национального покроя и у них всегда достаточно заказов. Холдона решила расширить свое дело. Она просит кредит, чтобы приобрести модернизированную компьютерную швейную машинку. С помощью такой машинки ее дела пойдут еще лучше, а также она сможет по желанию клиенток делать на платьях красивые вышивки, что способствует развитию ее дела. Она с надеждой ждет поддержки для осуществления своих целей.
texts.en:
Kholdona is a capable and experienced seamstress who lives in Hamadoni. She is 47 years old and the mother of two sons and two daughters. Her husband sells vegetables at the market. Kholdona has a sewing business at home. She is a very responsible person who tries to fulfill each order on time. She has had her sewing business for three years. Her daughter helps her, and together they make traditional dresses. They have ample demand. 

Kholdona has decided to build her business and has requested a loan to buy a modern computerized sewing machine. With this sewing machine she could improve her work and do beautiful embroidery for her clients. She waits with hope for support to meet her goals.

loans.use: to buy a computerized sewing machine to expand her sewing business.

loans.name: Nissan Group

texts.en:
Zaina, who is 30 years old, is single, with two children who are in school. For ten years now, Zaina makes her family's living by running a business, selling charcoal and firewood. She does business from 7am to 6pm daily and she is able to make a very good monthly profit. 

From Kiva partner, Tujijenge Tanzania, this is Zaina's eighth loan request, which she will use to restock on charcoal and firewood to resell. 

With her previous loans, all of which were successfully paid back, Zaina bought the same stocks to service more people. She used the increased income to cover school fees and home food expenses and she bought a TV, mattress, sofa set, and radio. She is so happy and thankful to everyone who has supported her group. She dreams of building a house for her family. 

Zaina will share this loan with her loan group, Nissan Group, which totals five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock on charcoal and firewood to resell.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of six children, Loida works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Loida is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net for her fishing business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Loida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

Sarah is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her food vending business such as peanuts, sugar, butter, etc.

Sarah has been in this business for 20 years. Sarah earns more income from a general store.

Sarah has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. Her dream is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients such as peanuts, sugar, butter, etc.

loans.name: Oygul

texts.ru: Ойгул молодая девушка в возрасте 25 лет. Ойгул давно замужем и воспитывает двоих детей. Она с мужем, детьми и тестем живут в одном доме на районе Носири Хусрав. Ее детям 5 и 2 года.  Ойгул в течение 3-4 лет занимается земледелием. В огороде выращивает овощи и другие растения. Ойгул следит, чтобы ее дети питались здоровой и полноценной едой без химикатов и добавлений. Ойгул посадила урожай и на ее обработку необходимо купить удобрения. Чтобы приобрести необходимое количество удобрений ней не хватает не много денег. По этой причине она обратилась за кредитом. Поддержите Ойгул.
texts.en:
Oygul is a 25-year-old young woman. She married long ago and is raising two children (ages five and two). She and her husband, children and father-in-law live in a house in Nosiri Khusrav. For 3-4 years she has been a farmer. 

She grows vegetables and other plants. Oygul feeds her children healthy and wholesome food with no chemicals nor additives. She planted crops and now needs to buy fertilizer. But she doesn't have enough money to buy it in sufficient amounts, so she has requested a loan. Please support Oygul.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 50 years old, married, and works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell dressed chicken business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from making fermented fish. 

Analyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy dressed chicken and a new refrigerator unit for her buy-and-sell dressed chicken business.

Analyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy dressed chicken and a new refrigerator unit for her business.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en:
Matilde is 42 years old and lives in Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married, with two children who are now at their school age. 

Matilde is earning income from a commission as a professional real estate broker and she earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month from doing this type of work. She is also receiving a monthly allotment from her husband.  She has requested a loan to be used to pay the entrance fees of her daughter’s enrollment. 

Matilde has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for just this year. In the future, she hopes to engage in other types of business.

loans.use: to pay the entrance fees of her daughter’s enrollment.

loans.name: Serafina

texts.en: Serafina is 51 years old and widowed. She was blessed with five children and they live happily in a rural community. Aside from farming, she also engages in a hog-raising business to earn additional income. Due to financial insufficiency, she would like to obtain a loan of 36,000 PHP to buy additional piglets, hog feeds, and vitamins needed in raising hogs. Having patience and strong determination, Serafina believes that she will be able to improve the business and make it more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, hog feeds, and vitamins needed in raising hogs

location.town: Brgy. Munguia, Dupax del Norte,Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Jipe Moyo Yombo Group

texts.en:
Araita is in her mid-twenties and is single. She is still living with her parents and depends on herself for some of her needs. Despite living with her parents, Araita started a small business, selling cosmetics and fabrics door to door. Araita has been in this micro-business for a period of six months. She works from 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. per working day and is able to make a very small profit each month. 

This is Araita's tenth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to buy stock of cosmetics to resell. With her previous loans (all of which were paid back successfully), she purchased cosmetics products.  She earned  extra income which she used to cover food expenses. She dreams that one day she will be able to open a big shop.

She will share this loan with her loan group" Jipe Moyo Yombo" which totals two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy stock of cosmetics to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy mobile phone accessories.

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
At her age of 63, Mely still has an eagerness to succeed. She is married and has nine adult aged children. All of her children are married and have their own families. 

Mely runs a small sari-sari (variety) store business in their village. She has been managing it for 15 years and it serves as her family's source of income aside from farming. 

Mely wants to extend the products she sells to her customers. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, noodles, condiments and drinks. Mely will be very happy to receive the loan because it is a chance for her to expand and extend the products she sells. Her income from the business will cover her daily food expenditures with her husband.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, condiments and drinks.

loans.name: Davlatkhonim

texts.ru:
Давлатхоним живет в столице Таджикистана, в городе Душанбе. Через месяц ей исполнится 48 лет. Давлатхоним деятельная, коммуникабельная и честная женщина. Она замужем и имеет взрослых детей. 
На протяжении 5 лет Давлатхоним и ее муж занимаются торговым бизнесом. У них имеется продуктовый магазин, где они продают различный ассортимент продуктов питания. На их продукты всегда имеется спрос, так как у них всегда свежие и качественные продукты. Давлатхоним собирается расширить свой бизнес. Она хочет приобрести аппарат пополнения баланса и поставить его в наружной части магазина. К тому же ей необходимо приобрести большой холодильник для хранения скоропортящихся продуктов. Чтобы реализовать задуманное, Давлатхоим просит кредит в размере 3600 долларов США. Этот кредит ей очень важен. Она надеется на финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Davlatkhonim lives in the capital of Tajikistan, Dushanbe. She will be 48 years old next month. Davlatkhonim is an active, sociable and honest woman. She is married with grown children. For the past five years Davlatkhonim and her husband have run a grocery store where they sell an assortment of food. There is always demand for their goods because they always have fresh, high-quality products.  

Davlatkhonim has decided to grow their business. She wants to buy a recharging unit to put in the outer part of the store. In addition, they need to buy a large refrigerator to store perishables. To implement their plans, Davlatkhonim is asking for an important loan of US$3,600. She hopes for financial support.

loans.use: to buy a large refrigerator and recharging unit.

loans.name: Monica Gladys

texts.es: La Señora Monica sigue con la misma actividad de la venta de productos de limpieza, cuenta que le fue muy bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de variedad de productos de limpieza,  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de variedad de productos para surtir su negocio, cada crédito que saca siempre es para mejorar su negocio, y por ende sus ingresos económicos se siente agradecida con los prestamistas de kiva ya que con el apoyo que le brindan mejoro su negocio.
texts.en: Monica keeps on doing the same activity of selling cleaning products. She says that she did very well with the previous loan since she used it to buy a variety of cleaning products. This time she is requesting the loan to buy a variety of products to stock her business. Each loan she gets is to always improve her business and thus her financial income. She is very thankful to the Kiva lenders because she improved her business with the support they give her.

loans.use: to buy products at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy hair color, shampoo, hair treatment products, peroxide, etc.

loans.name: Sami

texts.en:
Sami is 21 years old and lives in Gaza, referred to as Gaza City, a Palestinian city in the Gaza Strip with a population of 515,556. Gaza is the largest city in the Palestinian territories.

Sami has an accessories shop and sells perfumes for girls. He opened his shop in the beginning of this year. Sami has a lot of customers who prefer to buy from him rather than any shop in the area because he treats them nicely. 

He asked Ryada for this youth loan to buy a display box and shelves that will enable him to increase his stock. 

Sami hopes to increase his sales more which ultimately will help generate more cash. He dreams of expanding his business.

loans.use: to buy a display box and shelves to enable him to increase his stock.

loans.name: Cleofe Santa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SR DE TORRECHAYOC DE YANAHUARA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco. 

La socia es la Sra. Cleofe; ella tiene 44 años de edad y es casada y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de chicha (bebida a base de maíz) y cerveza, ella prepara chicha y luego lo vende de forma independiente en su casa, ella trabaja desde las 10:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de chicha. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz al por mayor para preparar la chicha.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “SR DE TORRECHAYOC DE YANAHUARA”. The bank is located in the district of Urubamba, which belongs to Urubamba province in the department of Cusco.

The member is Cleofe. She is 44 years old and married with six children. She sells chicha (maize-based drink) and beer. She prepares the chicha and then sells it from her house. She works from 10am until 8pm. Through this business, she manages to provide for her children. Cleofe wants to expand her chicha-selling business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase maize wholesale so she can prepare the chicha.

She is happy to get the loan and is committed to making her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy maize wholesale for preparing chicha

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years and earns more income from fishing.

She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional fish to make dried fish for her dried fish making business.

Virginia successfully paid back her previous loan and now she is requesting an additional loan to further build her business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Hello world, meet Susan. She is a mother of four who has been farming for a living for the past nine years. She comes from Kitale, Kenya. She earns income by selling milk and crops. She is also involved in other personal business for extra money.

There is nothing she enjoys more than selling her farm produce at a profit. This is because losses are frequent from seasonal droughts and expensive farm inputs. She has attended training, organized by Juhudi Kilimo (a microfinance), and learnt how to manage loans and make wise investments.

With your financial aid, Susan will be to diversify and venture into poultry farming. This will make her spread her risks and be able to generate more income to meet the high farming costs. Increased income will enable her to take better care of family expenses in the long run.

loans.use: To purchase poultry for her business

loans.name: Gloria Patricia

texts.es:
Gloria tomo la decisión de ser independiente desde hace varios años, y hasta ahora ha cosechado muy buenos frutos de su esfuerzo y dedicación laborando en su negocio de preparación de tortas, trufas y brownies
Pero esto no es suficiente para esta emprendedora mujer de 45 años, pues su mayor anhelo es poder ver a sus dos hijas como unas profesionales exitosas.
En estos momentos solicita un crédito para comprar un horno industrial y aumentar sus insumos de trabajo, ya que estos le permitirán aumentar su producción de alimentos.
Ella prepara sus recetas en la mañana y en la tarde sale a ofrecerlos en la calle y en establecimientos.
Ella trabaja sola en estos momentos pero desea ampliar su negocio y generar  empleo.
Su mayor desafío ha sido los gastos tan elevados que tiene con sus dos hijas universitarias.
texts.en:
Gloria made the decision to be self-sufficient several years ago, and up until now she has achieved very good results for her efforts and dedication working in her shop to prepare cakes, truffles and brownies. This is not enough for this 45 year old female entrepreneur, as her biggest wish is to be able to view her two daughters as successful professionals.

She is currently seeking a loan to buy an industrial oven and to increase her labor input, since this will allow her to increase her food production. She prepares her recipes in the morning and in the afternoon she goes out to offer them in the street and in establishments. She works alone right now but she hopes to expand her business and generate employment. Her biggest challenge has been the high expenses that she has with her two daughters in university.

loans.use: to buy an industrial oven and supplies for her business.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma lives in Datu Atangkilan, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte in the Philippines. She is 46 years old, married and the mother of four children. She earns a living by running a sari-sari or general store, which helps her husband meet the basic needs of their family. In 2007, Wilma joined the Paglaum Cooperative and has attended various training and continuous-education programs at our organization. Starting with capitalization of PHP 3,000, she was able to expand her business with help from the Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys other benefits provided by the co-op. Wilma has taken out previous loans and paid all her obligations in a timely manner. She is now requesting a loan for PHP 50,000 to restock her store with basic commodities. In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart, and will be fully satisfied if she sees her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, supplies, insecticides, fertilizers, tools, etc.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en: Damaris is a Kiva borrower who describes herself as determined. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal, and would like to help her family overcome a challenge it faces because of a lack of water-storage facilities. She is requesting a Kes 20,000 loan to buy water-storage equipment so that her family can store clean water for domestic use. Her goal for the future is to improve her living standards. This is her second loan from SMEP DTM. She successfully repaid her first one.

loans.use: buy water-storage equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente de 26 años de edad se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol desde hace 10 años y es de esta forma como se gana la vida y puede llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. La actividad del cultivo la realiza año con año. Es un hombre muy trabajador, honrado y responsable. A pesar de las condiciones en las que vive, las cuales son muy humildes no se cansa de trabajar y de dar lo mejor a su familia. Vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar. El cliente Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito para comprar los principales insumos agrícolas: abonos, venenos para plagas, semillas, etc. y mejorar el terreno donde siembra que es el que muestra la fotografia. Espera tener resultados favorables ya que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos. Confía en Dios que logrará obtener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar.
texts.en: This borrower is 26 years old. He has been raising corn and beans for 10 years, and it is in this way that he earns a living and is able to bring the daily sustenance to his household. He does farming work year after year. He is a very hard-working man, honest and responsible. In spite of the conditions in which he lives, which are very humble, he doesn't tire of working and giving the best to his family. He lives in his own house with his family group. This borrower has made the decision to apply for a loan to buy the principal agricultural supplies: compost, poisons for pests, seeds, etc., and to improve the land where he plants, which is shown in the photograph. He hopes to have favorable results, since he doesn't have any other source of income. He is confident in God that he will manage to obtain an abundant harvest, which will allow him to continue bringing the daily sustenance to his household.

loans.use: to buy the principal agricultural supplies: compost, poisons for pests, seeds, etc., and to improve the land.

loans.name: Remita

texts.en: Remita is a hardworking entrepreneur who earns a living by farming coconuts in the Philippines. She has requested a loan for PHP 18,000 from NWTF to buy additional sacks of fertilizer so she can grow a better crop. She has been in this business for 28 years, and earns additional income by buying and selling fish. She successfully repaid a previous loan and has been sustaining her business with the help from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizer.

loans.name: Cooproriz Isabane Gp9 Group

texts.en:
Seraphine is 57 years old. She is a mother of two children. She will use her Kiva loan to pay for labor costs and fertilizer, which is needed to increase production. With the profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors to enhance her farming capacity.  

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for labor and fertilizers.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: Don felix de 50 años de edad vive junto a su esposa,  él se dedica a la venta de tortas en un zona muy transitada, se ha hecho de mucha clientela fija pues las personas saben que todo  es elaborado con material de primera calidad, a precios accesibles pero sobre a todo con un buen servicio; Don Felix quiere aumentar las ventas para obtener mejores ganancias, pero no tiene suficiente capital para realizarlo por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar embutido, carne de soya, pan, aderezos, verdura etc. el tiene buenas referencias de pago asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y al mismo tiempo tiene fe que lograra tener junto a su esposa  una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Don Felix is 50 years old. He lives with his wife. He sells sandwiches in a zone with a lot of traffic. He has won many regular customers because people know that everything is made with ingredients of first quality, at affordable prices, but above all, with good service. Don Felix wants to increase his sales to obtain better earnings, but he doesn't have sufficient capital to do this. For this reason, he is applying to Integral for a loan that will allow him to buy cold meats, soy bean meat, bread, dressings, vegetables, etc. He has good payment references, and he affirms that he will be able to pay off the debt, and at the same time, he has faith that together with his wife, he will manage to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cold meats, soy bean meat, bread, dressings, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Chito

texts.en:
Chito owns and operates an agriculture business which is selling crabs in the local community to earn a living. He has been in his business for seven years and earns well to sustain their living. He uses his motorcycle in selling and vending crabs. With his generated income, his previous loan used for the business was successfully repaid. 

Recently, he took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy new tires and a portion will be used to buy more crabs for sale.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy new tires and a portion will be used to buy more crabs for sale

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en: Jerry is a responsible father who aims to uplift the status of his family and give everyone in it a better life. He is 38 years old and has two children of school age. Despite hardships, he wants to continue sending his children to school so that they will earn a degree and become professionals. In this regard, he aims to improve his hog-raising business in order to increase his earnings. Because he has inadequate capital, he is requesting a loan for PHP 23,000 to buy animal feed, vitamins, additional pigs and materials to improve his farm. Through this loan, he believes that he will be able to improve his life and his business.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins, additional pigs and materials needed to improve his pig barn.

location.town: Brgy. Balzain, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Nelma

texts.en:
Nelma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years. Nelma earns more income from food vending.

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell for her fish vending business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Saida Dionely

texts.es:
Saida de 28 años de edad, es una persona que  estudio hasta bachillerato y es una persona soltera.  Se levanta a las 4:30 a.m para realizar sus actividades diarias.


Saida trabaja en la parcela camina 3 K.m. Para llegar y en el transcurso de la tarde ella se dedica a ordeñar las vacas para elaborar queso y venderlo 


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar tres vacas y podrá producir mas leche para la elaboración de queso y así incrementar sus ingresos para su sustento.

 Saida planea  comprar en un futuro un terreno donde pastar sus animales.
texts.en:
Saida is 28 years old. She is a single person who completed her high school education. She gets up at 4:30 a.m. to carry out her daily activities. 

Saida works in her parcel. She walks three kilometers to get there, and spends the afternoon milking the cows so she can make and sell cheese.

The loan that she is requesting is to buy three cows to produce more milk for making cheese. That way she will be able to increase her income to support herself.

Saida plans to buy land in the future where she can graze her animals.

loans.use: to buy three cows

loans.name: Sulaiman

texts.en: Sulaiman is 35 years old and lives in Ganda with his wife and four children. He also cares for two widows and their children by providing them with basic needs since they have lost their husbands and fathers. Since 2004, he had earned a living by driving a taxi. He went into this line of work after failing to find formal employment. He does most of his driving in town and his dream is have another taxi so that he can earn higher wages, better provide for his family and start a business for his late brothers' wives. He is requesting this loan to buy a taxi. This will help him raise his income and save for the future. According to his colleagues, Sulaiman is very hardworking and honest. If he had enough money, he would quit being a taxi driver and become a businessman. Here we see Sulaiman with the UGafode credit officer and the taxi he would like to buy.

loans.use: to buy a taxi.

loans.name: Ushirika Group

texts.en:
Herieth, who is in her early 30's, is married with two children who are still at school.   She has been  a tailor and has a tailoring equipment shop.  She has been in her business for six years now.  She works from 8 AM to 6 PM daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.
  
This will be Herieth's eighth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy nice materials to make nice dresses and suits.  She also bought sewing equipment for the shop and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully.  She is doing great with her loan and appreciates Kiva for the support.  She used the profit to pay for school fees, to cover household expenses, and to build a small house.  She will use this loan to  make suits and dresses and to buy sewing equipment for the sewing shop

Herieth  will share this loan with her loan group, Ushirika, which has six members who will hold each other accountable for paying  back the loan.

loans.use: to buy materials to make suits and dresses and to buy sewing equipment for the sewing shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fresh vegetables and frozen fish

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: Reina 45 años es viuda vive en casa propia con sus dos hijas y una  nieta, ella se dedica a la  venta de ropa desde hace varios años, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado que se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela por la calidad de la mercadería, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y la ayuda de su hija mayor logran solventar algunos gastos que se les presentan en el hogar, Reina esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de ropa por mayor para obtener mejores ganancias y así darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Reina is 45 years old, a widow, and lives in a home of her own with her two daughters and one niece.  She has been selling clothing at the market near her home for several years, has many customers because of the quality of her merchandise, and uses her earnings to help her older daughter pay some of her household expenses. Reina is asking for a loan to buy clothing in quantity so she can increase her earnings and provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: Doña Reyna, siempre dedicada a su negocio de venta de gas y verduras en su pequeña pulpería, medio por el que se ayuda para salir adelante junto a su familia, ella requiere el crédito para invertir en su negocio  comprando productos que demandan su clientela como: granos básicos, gaseosas, carnes, golosinas, cereales, gas, verduras entre otros para continuar siempre activa en su labor diaria generando ingresos para mantener sus gastos.
texts.en: Doña Reyna is always dedicated to her business of selling gas and vegetables in her little grocery store, the means through which she helps herself to get ahead, along with her family. She needs the loan to invest in her business, buying products that her customers demand, such as basic foodstuffs, soft drinks, meats, candies, cereals, gas, and vegetables, among other items, in order to continue always being active in her daily work, generating income to support her expenses.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, soft drinks, meats, candies, cereals, gas, and vegetables, among other items.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is 60 years old, married and the mother of one adult-aged child.  She lives in Southern Poblacion, Baliangao, where she tills a little farm together with her husband. She focuses on mangos because this is how she has supported their family for the last 10 years. Lolita is attracted to the many benefits that PMPC has extended to its members, especially various forms of insurance. She has taken out and repaid previous loans in a timely fashion. Lolita is requesting a new loan to purchase pesticides and insecticides to use for her new crop. The profit she earns in her business will allow her to save money with Paglaum for her eventual retirement.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and insecticides

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda, age 55, is happy tending her little vending stand.  She is married with two kids, and her husband is a minimum wage earner. They live in Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental: Philippines. The store is her means of earning a living in support to her family. Imelda applied for her membership with PMPC in the year 2009. After hearing all the benefits being a member of the Coop, she didn't hesitate to become one.

Imelda has reached her fifth year of being a member of Paglaum MPC.  She has applied for a loan of PHP 20,000 for her vending business to buy additional gallons of bleaching liquid for retail. Expanding her inventory will mean additional income. She has confidence that she can maintain the label of member in good standing. She is a hardworking mother and wishes to sustain the vending stand and from there a good living condition she could offer for her children.

loans.use: to buy additional gallons of bleaching liquid for retail

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Necitas

texts.en:
Necitas is 36 years old and a resident of Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. She earns a living through raising pigs and selling vegetables in the market.

She has been a member of PMPC for two years and enjoys the privileges being a member of the Cooperative. Now she is applying a loan of PHP 12,000.00 to purchase bags of feed. Necitas deeply wishes to maintain a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feed

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou  joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2004 and she appreciates the programs, services, and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers. 

She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 14,000.00. This loan is intended to purchase additional materials for her beauty parlor.Marilou  dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income out of her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her beauty parlor

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 36 years old, married, and has been blessed with three children. He does farming and also motorcycle transport services. He has been in this business for six years now. His current income is KES 45,000.

He would like to get a loan of KES 100,000. This is his sixth loan. He has managed to successfully repay all the previous loans.

He will use the loan to buy farm inputs like fertilizer and feed for his cattle. He anticipates that through the profits, he will pay for his loan and pay school fees for his children. In future he hopes and dreams to become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like fertilizer and feed for the cattle

loans.name: Domero

texts.en:
Domero is 58-years-old and lives in Salimpono, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. He is married with four children who are now adults.
 
Domero has been engaged in farming, particularly coconut and rice production activity, for 20 years already and earns approximately PHP 4,000 each harvest from doing this type of work. At the present time, he also receives a monthly honorarium as an elected barangay official in his community. He has requested a loan to be used for purchasing commercial fertilizers for his coconut trees and rice production activity. The remaining amount will be used for the educational support of his son. Domero has been a member of PMPC for almost three years. In the future, Domero hopes to save more in the cooperative for future needs.

loans.use: to purchase commercial fertilizers

loans.name: Ilyn

texts.en:
Ilyn is 38 years old and married with three children who are in school. She is a hard worker who for the past three years has run a sari sari, or general store in the Philippines. She also earns an income from raising pigs.

Ilyn previously obtained and successfully paid off four loans from NWTF. She is now applying for a 15,000 PHP loan to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, eggs, milk, noodles, etc. She aspires to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her store.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 31 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Janeth has been farming rice for five years and also earns additional income from farming coconut. 

Janeth is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional fertilizers. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizer

loans.name: Olinda

texts.en:
A $1,500.00 loan is offered to Olinda to improve her business. Olinda opened her second hand  in 2009 with her own working. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store, like shirts, long pants, shorts, and short sleeve shirts.

Olinda is generating a good income from selling. She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. Olinda is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy shirts, long pants, shorts, and short sleeve shirts

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente de 24 años de edad vive con su familia en casa propia, el se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de maíz y frijol, se ha dedicado a esta actividad durante 10 años de su vida y es así como se gana el pan de cada día. Él es un hombre trabajador, responsable y muy conocido en la zona por su enorme corazón y amabilidad para con los demás. Debido a que ya es temporada de siembra tomo la decisión de comenzar a prepararse. Es por esa razón que ha decidido solicitar este nuevo crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de semillas, abonos, insecticidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno donde desea realizar la siembra que es el que muestra en la fotografía. Confía en Dios que con su ayuda, su dedicación y empeño en el  trabajo lograra el sueño de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: The 24-year-old client lives with his family in his own house. He works in agriculture. He plants maize and beans. He has been doing this work for ten years and it is how he earns a living. He is a hard-working and responsible man who is very well-known in the area for his huge heart and kindness towards others. As it is planting season, he decided to start preparing for it. It is for this reason that he has decided to request this new loan from Apoyo Integral. He will invest it in the purchase of seeds, compost, insecticides, etc. He will also improve the cropland shown in the photograph. He trusts in God that with your help, his dedication, and his effort, he will be able to achieve his dream of improving his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to improve his land and buy seeds, compost, insecticides, and other supplies

loans.name: Girlyn

texts.en:
Girlyn, 36, is married with two children. She operates a sari-sari, or general store in Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte in the Philippines.

In 2008 Girlyn applied for membership in PMPC. Hearing of all the benefits offered, she did not hesitate to do so. She is a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Girlyn has applied for a 30,000 PHP loan to buy more basic commodities for her sari-sari such as rice and canned goods. She wishes to increase her income and expand her business.

She has found assistance for her financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative, and for it she gives thanks with all her heart.

loans.use: to buy more basic commodities for her sari-sari

loans.name: Pepito

texts.en:
Pepito is 65 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. He is widowed with no dependents.
 
Pepito has been engaged in carpentry works for more than 30 years already and earns approximately PHP 3,000.00 each month from doing this type of work. At present, he is also receiving a monthly pension. He has requested a loan to be used in purchasing three piglets and four sacks of feed for his new livelihood activity which is hog fattening. 

Pepito has been a member of PMPC for almost four years. In the future, Pepito hopes to expand his new hog fattening business.

loans.use: to purchase three piglets and four sacks of feeds

loans.name: Dorris

texts.en:
Dorris still runs her retail shop in Mwingi. Her business is doing incredibly well after getting funds from VisionFund Kenya. She is also grateful to the KIVA organization who made her success possible. 

This marks her second loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She intends to use the loan facility to purchase more sugar, cooking oil, packed milk, washing detergents and cereals. She hopes to use the anticipated profit to pay for her four children's school fees and also reinvest in her business.

In future she hopes to continue expanding her shop to become a wholesale store.

loans.use: to stock her shop with rice, sugar, washing detergents, maize meal, cooking oil and flour

loans.name: Lily Beth

texts.en:
Lily Beth is 32, married, and blessed with three children. She owns and manages a small variety store within her community to generate income. 

Due to financial hardships, she aims to improve her store in order to earn a higher income to sustain the necessities of her family and support the education of her children. Having inadequate capital, Lily Beth is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000.00 to buy more stocks of canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, eggs, laundry soaps, snack foods, beverages, and seasonings to sell. With this financial assistance, she believes that she will make more improvements in the business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, eggs, laundry soaps, snack foods, beverages, and seasonings to sell

location.town: Brgy. Ineangan, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Sonia Beatriz

texts.es:
La Señora. Sonia es una socia amable, gentil que forma parte del grupo de crédito San Vicente, este grupo de crédito le gusta por la amabilidad, compañerismo y unión de todas las socias. Vive por los alrededores de la parroquia Victoria del Portete en Cuenca, en donde la mayor parte de su población se dedica a la ganadería y agricultura y mucha de su población ha salido a la ciudad a trabajar en varias actividades como también han migrado en busca de un mejor trabajo.
La Señora. Sonia tiene 19 años de edad, es madre soltera un hijo de 5 años que está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad, vive en casa de sus padres con quienes comparte los gastos del hogar.
Doña Sonia pasa en casa realizando tareas del campo las que le permiten pasar con su hijo,  se dedica a la crianza de pollos y cuyes, también a la agricultura es para el consumo de su hogar y para la venta. Este crédito es para comprar pollos, cuyes y semillas. Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en: Sonia is a very kind and friendly partner who is a part of the credit group San Vicente.  She likes this credit group for the friendliness, companionship, and bonds among all of the members.  She lives in the outskirts of the parish Victoria del Portete en Cuenca, where the majority of the population works in livestock and agriculture.  Many have left the city to work in various activities in addition to those who have migrated in search of better work.  Sonia is 19 years old, she is a single mother with a 5 year old son who is studying in a school in the city.  She lives in her parents' house, with whom she shares the house expenses. Doña Sonia spends her time doing farming work at home, so that it allows her to spend time with her son.  She works raising chickens and guinea pigs, and the agriculture is for home consumption and also for sale.  This loan is to help her purchase chickens, guinea pigs, and seed. Her goal is to have her own house.

loans.use: to purchase chickens, guinea pigs, and seed.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 43 years old and married. They have been blessed with eight children. She has been in the livestock business for seven years and would like a loan of KES 15,000. Through this loan she will buy cabbage, onions, tomatoes, kale, watermelons, and other vegetables.

She currently makes a monthly income of KES 8,800. She has successfully repaid all the previous loans, this being her second loan term.

In the future she hopes to own her piece of land and build her family a stable home.

loans.use: purchase farming stock like cabbage, onions, tomatoes, kale, watermelons, and other vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy materials to build a septic tank

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years. She earns more income from farming rice.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, soap, milk, etc., for her general store business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Erma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, soap, milk, etc.

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Criselda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase a fishing net and other fishing materials for her fishing business.

Criselda has been in this business for 20 years. She earns more income from buying and selling fish.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net and other fishing materials

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 43-years-old and married with three children, two of whom are in school.  Anita works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Anita has been in this business for 11 years.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, soap, etc.

Christine has been in this business for five years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, soap, etc.

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
Naira runs a small bakery in the center of Goris town. She has been making different types of cookies and cakes for five years already. Naira loves her bakery and makes cookies with great love and pleasure. 

She lives with her husband who is employed in the private sector. Naira has now applied for this loan to be able to purchase needed tools and materials for her bakery. 

The loan is important for her to purchase a refrigerator and materials needed for cake production. Naira has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans, with soft conditions, to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. She will be very thankful to lenders for their support and goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for a refrigerator and materials needed for her bakery

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 53-years-old and married with thirteen children, two of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like spices, shampoo, soft drinks, chips, etc.

Leonida has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from vegetable vending.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like spices, shampoo, soft drinks, chips, etc.

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.en:
Nicolasa is 56 years old, married, and has four children.  

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Nicolasa has been raising pigs for 27 years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. 

Nicolasa requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Toni De Jesús

texts.es:
Toni  de 37 años de edad, es casado, estudio hasta educación media,  vive junto a su esposa y sus dos  hijos. Toni se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. Junto a su esposa e hijos que le apoyan en la actividades agrícolas durante la mañana y en la tarde él se dirige a trabajar como vigilante en una bodega.

Toni junto a su esposa se dedican a la agricultura oficio que aprendió de sus padres; para llegar a la parcelas camina 5  Km y trabaja durante la mañana y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a ordeñar la vacas que poseen y así vender la leche.

 El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una vaca que le ayudara para incrementar la producción de leche para la venta y obtener ingresos adicionales para su familia.
texts.en:
37-year-old Toni is married. He studied as far as high school. He lives with his wife and his two children. He gets up at 4:30am along with his wife and children, who help him with the farm work in the morning. In the afternoon, he works as a security guard at a warehouse.

Toni and his wife make a living from agriculture, which they learnt from their parents. They walk five kilometres to get to their parcels of land and they work during the morning. His wife does the housework and milks the cows that they own so they can sell the milk.

The loan Toni is requesting is for buying a cow, which will help him to increase his milk production and sell the additional milk to obtain more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice, a wife and mother of five, lives with her husband and children in Kitale, Kenya. She has been farming for the past eight years and also makes money by offering transportation services and selling milk and maize in the local market. She even has other small businesses on the side, but there is nothing she enjoys more than selling her farm produce!

Despite such challenges as expensive farm supplies, drought, pests and disease, she is very passionate about farming. She has named her cow Maua, the Kiswahili word for “flower.”

Eunice has learned a great deal about the poultry business since joining Juhudi Kilimo. She now wants to put the lessons into practice, so she is applying for a 30,000 KES loan to venture into it.

Eunice has projected a significant increase in income through this enterprise. She feels it will enable her to meet her family and business expenses comfortably. "The living standards of my family will greatly improve in the long run," she said.

loans.use: to get into the poultry business.

loans.name: Al- Abrar Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al- Abrar and consists of four women who are all hard working. They live in Sana'a, Yemen. They requested a loan of 160.000 YER from AMB.

Nima is 44 years old and married with six children. Her oldest child is 30 years old and the youngest one is 17 years old. She is an uneducated woman, but she is very active. Nima is the leader of the group. She has a strong determination to improve her standard of living. She works as a housewife. Her husband is an employee and his salary is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. On other hand, their home lacks many appliances. Nima can't afford them. For this reason, she has requested a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a TV for the house. A TV inside the house will make her very happy.

Nima looks forward to opening a saving account with AMB and improving the living standard of the family. She hopes to purchase all the home appliances and furnish her entire house.

loans.use: To purchase a TV for the house

loans.name: Evaristo Joaquin

texts.es: Don Evaristo vive en casa propia con su esposa, el posee un taller de costura ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra salir adelante junto con su esposa, el quiere mejorar su vivienda colocando puertas y repellando y afinando las paredes, pero con lo que ganan de su trabajo no logra realizarlo por esa razón esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de los materiales necesarios como:  cemento, arena, madera, clavos, pintura, etc. y pago de mano de obra y asi poder terminar de arreglar su casa para que el y su esposa puedan vivir seguros y cómodos.
texts.en: Evaristo lives in a home of his own with his wife.  He has had a tailoring workshop in his home for several years, where he earns enough to get ahead with his wife.  He wants to make improvements to his home by plastering and repairing the walls, but he doesn’t earn enough, so he is asking for this loan to buy necessary materials, like cement, sand, lumber, nails, paint, etc. and pay for labor.  This way he can finish fixing up his house so he and his wife can live comfortably.

loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Cristhian José

texts.es:
En el barrio Cuba de la ciudad de  Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América situado a orillas del Pacifico, cada 15 días se reúne el Grupo de Crédito Mujeres Virtuosas.
En este lugar vive don Cristhian, tiene 34 años de edad, está divorciado  y de esta relación tienen 4 hijos de 11, 9, 6  y 5 años que estudian en escuela y que viven con el.
Don Cristhian es taxista, trabaja en un taxi que el alquila a diario, pero también para obtener más ganancias él  se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta en su tiempo libre, deja a crédito sus clientes y les cobra cada 8 días. Lleva más de 2 años dedicado al comercio con el cual se gana algo extra que se le sirve para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar pantalones, camisas y ropa de niños que es lo que más vende. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 3 ciclos y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos para salir adelante. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The loan group Mujeres Virtuosas (Virtuous Women) meets every two weeks in the Cuba neighborhood of the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches, which are much visited by national and international tourists in every season of the year, and for being one of the most important ports of the country and of America, situated on the shores of the Pacific.

Don Christhian, who is 34 years old, lives in this place. He is divorced, and from this relationship he has four children, ages 11, 9, 6, and 5, who are in school and who live with him.

Don Christhian is a taxi driver. He works in a taxi that he rents every day, but he also obtains more earnings: he sells clothing of all types. His form of sales is door to door in his free time. He leaves items with his customers on credit, and he collects every week. He has had this business for more than two years, and with it he earns something extra, which helps him to raise his children.

He is going to use this loan to buy pants, shirts, and children's clothing, which is what sells the most. He has been in the loan group for three loan cycles, and he likes it because of the help that the loans give him to advance. His dream is to give the best to his children.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, and children's clothing to sell

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is from Sindangan, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is 64 years old and a widow with eight kids. 

In 2011, Rosie applied for her membership with PMPC.  Hearing about all the benefits, she never hesitated to become a member. She continues to be a member in good standing and repays her obligation in a timely manner.

Recently, Rosie asked for financial assistance of PHP 5,000 to enhance her farm production. She obtained a loan to purchase palay and corn for cropping. Through this, she hopes to increase her income and expand her business.  She has found assistance for her financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to purchase palay and corn for cropping

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou is a 43-year-old married woman from Matco Panalsalan Plaridel Mis.Occ, who has one child. She has been a member of the Paglaum-MPC for almost seven years. Marilou owns and manages a small barbeque stand in front of her house, which is on a national road that many people pass through looking for places to eat. Due to the improvements to their barrios, many people travel in and out of the vicinity, so she has decided to expand her business to cook more dishes in order to draw more people to visit her eatery. To fund this project, she needs additional capital of PHP 50,000 to buy additional kilos of meat for her barbeque business. For this reason, she has requested a loan from Paglaum-MPC.

loans.use: to buy additional kilos of meat for her barbeque business

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Meet Annah. She is a wife and mother of four. She is a mixed farmer based in Kitale, Kenya. She has been growing maize for the last five years. Recently, she joined Juhudi Kilimo and secured a loan for poultry. Until recently, she was making money selling crops and enganging in other personal businesses. Since starting her poultry business, she has realized its various advantages such as great demand and a source of regular income. The challenge she has to deal with is diseases that infect her birds. She also has challenges cleaning the poultry house. 
 
If you assist Annah with a loan, she will purchase more poultry and assist other small-lscale farmers to embrace poultry farming by selling them birds for keeping. She will also provide technical assistance to her clients. Through increased income, the loan will help Annah's family to cover their expenses and meet their basic needs

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Ramiro León

texts.es:
Ramiro es un pequeño productor de la zona norte de Nicaragua, dedicado a la caficultura. Su finca es de 5.6 hectáreas de las cuales 2.8 son de café. Antes de dedicarse al cultivo de café, él trabajaba con ganadería, pero decidió cambiar el giro de su actividad debido a que la zona donde habita tiene mayor potencial para café, además de que considera es un rubro rentable si se atiende adecuadamente.

En los últimos tres ciclos, este productor ha obtenido una producción promedio de 85 quintales de café pergamino. Su meta es incrementar estos rendimientos y lograr en este ciclo una producción de 120 quintales de café pergamino. Para ello, está solicitando un crédito que le permita adquirir los insumos y fertilizantes necesarios para el adecuado manejo de su plantación de café.

A pesar de que Ramiro ya es una persona mayor, cuenta con las condiciones físicas y el deseo para seguir atendiendo su pequeña finca. Su sueño es aumentar su área productiva de café y trabajar en asocio con sus hijos para llegar a producir de manera conjunta un volumen más significativo de café.
texts.en:
Ramiro is a small producer from northern Nicaragua who is dedicated to coffee. His farm is 5.6 hectares of which 2.8 are coffee. Before turning to the cultivation of coffee, he worked with livestock but decided to change his activity because the area where he lives has more potential for coffee, plus it is considered a profitable item if properly served.

In the last three cycles, this producer has earned an average production of 85 quintals of parchment coffee. His goal is to increase these yields in this cycle and achieve a production of 120 quintals of parchment coffee. He is requesting a loan that allows him to purchase inputs and fertilizers necessary for the proper management of his coffee plantation.

Although Ramiro is now a senior, he has the physical conditions and the desire to continue serving his small farm. His dream is to increase his coffee production area and work in partnership with his children to produce a significant volume of coffee.

loans.use: to buy inputs and fertilizer for his coffee plantation

loans.name: Jovy

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Jovy works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her general store. Jovy is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fishing net and gasoline for her fishing business.

Jovy has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and gasoline for her business

loans.name: Jiyongul

texts.en: Jiyongul is a careful mother of two children. She is the only feeder and keeper of her children. Jiyongul is divorced. Her former husband doesn’t help her with providing her children with all the necessary things. She is a sewer. Jiyongul sews national women’s dresses. She services her clients in her house. Jiyongul sews one dress for 20 Somoni. She has regular customers. Now she needs financial support because her son is ill. She must buy medicine for her son's treatment, but she does not have the money. She is asking for a loan of 1,500 Somoni to buy medicine for her son's treatment. She awaits your generosity.

loans.use: To buy medicine for her son's treatment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional material

loans.name: Mini Bankito  (Jipijapa) Group

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Mini Bankito esta formado por 7 mujeres y 2 hombres que tiempo atrás decidieron juntarse y formar este grupo de crédito el cual les sirve para salir adelante en sus negocios. Ellos se reúnen cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
Una de las socias de este grupo la señora Teresa, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos  de  14 y 11 años que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es Ing. civil.
Doña Teresa es maestra y tiene un jardín de infantes particular en el cual con la ayuda de 4 personas a quienes les paga un sueldo mensual dan la mejor educación a los niños, ella  también  se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), actividad que realiza puerta a puerta y en el jardín de infantes, también ella les vende los uniformes a sus alumnos y ciertos útiles y materiales que ellos utilizan en su día a día.  Tiene más de 9 años con el jardín con el cual ella sale adelante y ayuda a otras compañeras en una actividad que le encanta como es la de educar a sus pequeños niños. 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar juegos didácticos así como también ropa y productos de Avon. Es fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños seguir adelante brindando la mejor educación a sus pequeños.
La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The loan group Mini Bankito consists of seven women and two men who decided some time ago to join together and form this loan group, which serves them to advance in their businesses. They meet every two weeks in the Jipijapa canton, a canton known by the name "the sultan of coffee" because of the extensive plantings of coffee, which has an incomparable flavor, as well as for its gastronomy and for the warmth of its people.

One of the members of this group is Señora Teresa. She is 43 years old. She is married, and from this relationship she has two children, ages 14 and 11, who are in secondary and primary school. Her husband is a civil engineer.

Doña Teresa is a teacher, and she has a private kindergarten in which, with the help of four people to whom she pays a monthly salary, she gives the best education to the children. She also sells clothing of all types and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women's accessories), an activity that she does door to door and in the kindergarten. She also sells uniforms to her students and certain supplies and materials that they use every day. She has had the kindergarten for more than nine years, and with it she is getting ahead and helping other colleagues in an activity that she loves, which is educating her little children.

She is going to use this loan to buy educational games as well as clothing and Avon products. She is a founder of the loan group, and she likes it because the loans help her a lot. Her dream is to continue offering the best education to her little ones.

The little photo is of a member who was not able to be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy educational games, clothing and Avon products

loans.name: Sonnia María

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Narcisa Del Jesús  se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Sonnia, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 11 y 4 años que estudian  escuela y jardín de infantes. Su esposo es maestro soldador.
Doña Sonnia para poder ayudarle a sus esposo con los gastos del hogar y para sentirse independiente desde hace 16 años empezó un negocio, ella tiene un pequeño comedor  su casa donde  con la ayuda de su hermana y su mamá preparan deliciosos almuerzos que son el deleite de sus clientes, solo prepara almuerzos y los fines de semana ellas preparan  comida y bocaditos para fiestas y eventos sociales, por lo general tiene de uno a dos contratos por semana para estos compromisos, es estos días el trabajo es muy duro pero  también les deja muy buenas ganancias.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace  11 años y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos.  Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
The Narcisa Del Jesús credit group meets every two weeks in the Jipijapa canton. It is known as the Sultana of Coffee because of the extensive coffee crops with incomparable flavor. It is also known for its gastronomy and for the warmth of its people.
