This is where Sonnia lives. She is 42 years old. She is married and has two children, aged 11 and 4. They are in school and pre-school. Her husband is a master welder.  

In order to help her husband with the household expenses and to feel independent, Sonnia started a business 16 years ago. She has a little restaurant in her house where with her sister's and her mother's help she prepares delicious lunches that delight her customers. She only makes lunches and on the weekends they prepare food and appetizers for parties and social events. In general, she has one or two contracts a weekend for these events. Nowadays, the work is very hard, but it also brings in good profit.  

She is going to use this loan to buy rice, meat, fish, and other groceries to prepare the food. She has been in the credit group for 11 years and she likes it because of the help of the loans. Her goals are to continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, fish and other groceries.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.pt:
O Sr Francisco de 57anos de idade, casado e pai de 4 filhos dos quais todos sao indepedente. Ele è negociante informal de criasao de pintos, actividade que vem ezercendo em grupo desde 1988, actualmente esta explorar junto com sua esposa uma capoeira com aproximadamente 1500 pintos. Ele sustenta 2 sobrinhos.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar (pintos, vitamina, racao e bebidores) para aumentar a sua produtividade, espandir o seu volume da venda em grandes mercado para
texts.en:
Francisco is 57 years old and married. He has four children, all of whom are independent. He runs an informal business raising chicks and he's been in this line of work as part of a group since 1988. He currently co-owns with his wife a bird coop that contains approximately 1,500 chicks. He supports two nephews.
The current loan will be used to purchase to purchase chicks, vitamins, feed and drinkers so that he can increase productivity and improve his sales volume in larger markets.

loans.use: to purchase chicks, vitamins, feed and drinkers so that he can increase productivity and improve his sales volume in larger markets.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: Leticia is 54-years-old, married and has two children. Her husband engages in a farming business of growing rice. Despite financial constraints, Leticia pushes to have her own business gain profits. Leticia has managed a hog raising business in their village for almost 30 years. Her earnings from raising hogs sustained her children's school allowances when they were still studying.  Now, her children are already married and have their own family. At this time, Leticia wants to continue to operate her business and gain profits to save for their future. In this regard, Leticia is asking for a loan of PHP 18,000 to buy piglets to raise and feed for maintenance. She hopes to succeed with the business she has, to have savings and be able to help her grandchildren, too.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and feed for maintenance.

loans.name: Lamula

texts.en: Lamula is married with three children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of selling charcoal and has been in this business for two years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She works at the market six days out of every week and sells on a retail basis.  She generates additional income from selling green finger bananas.  Her major business challenges include thieves and transportation. She aspires to own a delivery van for ease of transportation. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of the low interest charged.  She resides in a rented house and her monthly expenses include school and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Rider

texts.es:
Rider es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, él está estudiando la carrera de Administración de Empresas, y comenta que su principal sueño es poder ayudar a las demás personas por medio de su trabajo.
Rider está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder ser alguien en la vida y poder sobresalir en la carrera que le gusta.
El préstamo que pide es para pagar las cuotas y matricula de la facultad, y así poder seguir estudiando y recibirse como profesional para poder realizarse en la vida y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Rider is from the city of Carapeguá. He is studying for a degree in business administration and says that his main dream is to be able to help other people through his work. 

Rider is putting his best effort into being someone in life, and being able to excel in the career he likes. The loan he is asking for is to pay university fees and tuition, so that he can continue studying and graduate as a professional, fulfill his potential in life, and help his family.

loans.use: To pay university fees and tuition.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela es estudiante de la carrera de odontología, comenta que tiene una hermana de 14 años, y también a su mamá es empleada y su padre tiene un taller mecánico.
Ella lucha por poder ser una profesional que pueda ayudar a las demás personas en algo tan importante como lo es la salud bucal.
Pide este préstamo ya que quiere poder cubrir las cuotas de su universidad, y así seguir estudiando como lo viene haciendo. Ella esta agradecida por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Gabriela is a dentistry student.  She says that she has a 14-year old sister, her mother is housekeeper and her father has a mechanics workshop. 
Gabriela is working hard to become a professional, to be able to help others with something so important as oral health. 
She is requesting this loan because she wants to pay her university fees and continue studying, as she is doing now.  Gabriela is grateful for the opportunity she is getting to keep growing.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela es de Villa Elisa, está estudiando para ser Azafata, comenta que su madre es quien la inspira a seguir luchando por salir adelante.
Ella comenta que su mayor dificultad ha sido en lo económico, ya que es muy cara una carrera universitaria. Es una mujer muy luchadora que quiere salir adelante.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de seguir creciendo y estudiando.
texts.en:
Gabriela is from Villa Elisa and is studying to be a flight attendant. She says that her mother is the one who inspires her to continue striving to succeed. She says that her greatest difficulty has been financial, as a university degree program is very expensive. She is a very determined woman who wants to get ahead in life.

She is requesting this loan so that she can use it to pay her fees and be able to continue with her education. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to continue growing and studying.

loans.use: To pay university fees.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
Natalia es  estudiante del 5to año de Ingeniería en informática, cuenta que le gustaría culminar sus estudios y trabajar en proyectos informáticos mas adelante. Actualmente vive con sus padres, su mama es docente y su papá tiene un taller de autos. 
Natalia es madre soltera, tiene una hija de dos años a quien le quiere dar todo lo que no tuvo, es su mayor inspiración y por quien está luchando.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas, y de esa forma seguir luchando por mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y su hija.
texts.en:
Natalia is a fifth-year student in computer engineering. She says that she would like to complete her studies and work on computing projects in the future. Currently she lives with her parents. Her mother is a teacher and her father has an auto repair shop.

Natalia is a single mother and has a two-year-old daughter to whom she wants to give everything that she did not have. Her daughter is her greatest inspiration and the one for whom he is striving. 

She is requesting this loan so that she can use it to pay her university fees and this way continue striving to improve the quality of life for her family and her daughter.

loans.use: To pay university fees.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 36-years-old, married and a resident of Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. She earns a living through a motorcycle transport business. 

She has been a member of PMPC for one year and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying for a loan of PHP 5,000 to sustain the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Irene deeply wishes to maintain her membership in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to sustain the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Zyhra

texts.en:
Zyhra, who comes from the southern part of Kosovo, lives in a village with her husband and their three children who are between the ages of 9 and 16. Her husband works as a cook in a restaurant and she is involved in agricultural work to add extra income to the family’s budget as the salary he earns as a cook is very low and not sufficient enough to provide everything for his family. 

Zyhra owns cows so that she can use the milk and milk products for her family’s nutritional needs and to sell in the neighborhood. In the beginning she started with one cow and was satisfied from the profits that she was able to make selling the milk locally. Since then, she has been able to add three more cows and a calf to her business. Now, she needs to renovate the stable and is requesting a loan so that she can complete this and continue to run her business successfully. She hopes in the future to further expand her business and be able to offer a better education and life to her children from the income they earn.

loans.use: to renovate a stable and continue to run her business successfully

loans.name: Donnina Victoria

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Narcisa Del Jesús  se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Donnina, tiene 73 años de edad, hace varios años su querido esposo falleció y de esta relación tiene 10 hijos mayores de edad e independientes, con ella vive un nieto de 11 años el mismo que estudia en colegio. 
Doña Donnina es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta salir adelante a base de trabajo y esfuerzo, ella realiza el crédito para utilizarlo en un restaurante que tiene en el centro de la ciudad, allí prepara todos los días deliciosos desayunos con lo cual ella se gana la vida, también en sociedad con uno de sus hijos venden pescado ya sea por pieza o por libras, vende en el mismo local en el cual tiene su restaurante, ya son  9 años dedicados a esta actividad con la cual salen adelante.
 Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado, víveres para la preparación de los alimentos y pescado para la venta. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace  10 años y le gusta porque los créditos le son de mucha ayuda.  Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su nieto.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank "Narcisa Del Jesús" meet every two weeks in Jipijapa Canton.  The canton is known by the name of the coffee sultana because of its extensive coffee crops, which are unrivaled in flavor.  The canton is also known for its cuisine and the warmth of its people. 
This is where señora Donnina lives.  She is 73-years old.  Her dear husband passed away a few years ago.  With him, señora Donnina had ten children, all of whom are now grown and live independently from her.  One 11-year old grandson lives with her, and he goes to school. 
Doña Donnina is a very hard-working woman who likes to get ahead through her work and efforts.  She is taking out this loan for the restaurant she has in the city center.  She earns her living making delicious breakfasts in her restaurant every day.  Also, in partnership with one of her sons, she sells fish by the piece and by the pound.  She sells the fish from the same storefront where she has her restaurant.  Doña Donnina has been in this business for nine years, and it has enabled her to get ahead. 
This loan will be used to purchase rice, meat, fish and supplies for making food and selling fish.  Doña Donnina has been in her communal bank for ten years.  She likes it because the loans have helped her a lot.  Her dream is to give her grandson the best.

loans.use: to purchase rice, meat, supplies and fish.

loans.name: Célia

texts.pt:
É jovem de 29 anos de idade, mãe solteira que voltou do lar com 2 filhos menores e 1 já com idade escolar, vive com sua irmã e seus filhos na casa deixada pela falecida mãe e com 2 sobrinhos, é estudante da 11ª classe e chefe da família, vive à base da prestação de serviços como cabeleireiro para sustentar sua vida e esta a repetir o credito pela segunda vez, conta com ajuda da irmã mais nova que recentemente conseguiu trabalho no estado.
Com o credito pretende comprar produtos de beleza e fardos de roupa usada para ampliar o seu negocio.
Seu sonho é poder construir um salão com melhores condições, porque actualmente atende as pessoas debaixo de uma arvore em sua casa e também continuar a estudar ate o nível superior de maneiras a melhorar suas condições de vida e dos seus filhos.
Seu desafio é o facto de ser chefe de família ainda jovem e dependendo apenas dos serviços que presta para sustentar a mesma.
texts.en:
Célia is a young woman who's 29 years old. She's a single mother of two underage children, one of whom is already school-aged. She lives with her sister, her children and two nephews in a house that her late mother left for them. She's an 11th grade student and the head of the family. She makes a living by providing hairdressing services so that she can earn a livelihood. This is her second loan. She gets help from her younger sister who recently got a job working for the government.
With the loan she intends to purchase beauty products and bundles of used clothing in order to expand her business.
Her dream is to be able to build a beauty salon that's in better shape, since she currently serves people underneath a tree at her home. She also dreams of moving foward with her education all the way to college so that she can improve her and her children's living conditions.
Her challenge is the fact that she's the head of the family at a young age and that she only relies on the services she provides in order to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products and bundles of used clothing in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.pt:
Tem 41 anos de idade, vive maritalmente, pai de 1 filho, cuida de 2 enteados e 3 sobrinhos órfãos de mãe que vivem junto com ele, vive à base de negócio que é gerido pela esposa e é trabalhador numa empresa como guarda, esta a repetir o credito pela 4ª vez e tem sido um bom pagador.
Com o crédito pretende comprar produtos alimentares como: farinha, feijão, arroz, açúcar, óleo, ovos, vinhos, cervejas, refrescos, sumos, etc, para ampliar o seu negocio na mercearia que tem um sua casa.
Seu sonho é desenvolver mais o seu negocio e abrir mais um estabelecimento comercial numa outra zona e poder construir uma casa melhor para morar.
Seu desafio é a concorrência no negocio.
texts.en:
Manuel is 41 years old and married. He has a son and takes care of two stepchildren and three nephews who have lost their mother and live with him. He earns a living through the business which is run by his wife and he also works for a company as a security guard. This is his 4th loan and they have been duly repaid.
With the loan he intends to purchase foodstuffs such as flour, beans, rice, sugar, cooking oil, eggs, wine, beer, refreshments, juice, etc., so that he can expand the grocery store business he runs in his home.
His dream is to further develop his business, open another store in another area and be able to build a better house to live in.
His dream is the competition in the business.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs such as flour, beans, rice, sugar, cooking oil, eggs, wine, beer, refreshments, juice, etc., so that he can expand his business.

loans.name: Lendy

texts.en: Lendy is married and helps her husband by operating their farm while her husband works as an agent to earn a living. She also had a retail store and also sells electronic load. With eight years in farming, she helps a lot to support her husband’s income for the family. She had sustained her business and was able to save a little bit for their future needs. Recently, she joined GDMPC and received a loan to buy organic fertilizer for their farm. In the future, Lendy  wants to expand her farm to improve their income for the family’s better future.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 28 years old and lives in Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with no dependents. 

She is earning a salary as a Private Insurance Company secretary and earns approximately 6,000.00 PHP each month from doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing construction materials for building a new house. 

Lydia has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, she hopes to engage in business to add her income.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for building a new house.

loans.name: Gessica

texts.es:
Gessica es de la ciudad de Villarrica, ella está estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería Química,  comenta que en un futuro quiere trabajar y tener su propia empresa y ser una gran profesional.
Ella también quiere poder ayudar a su familia y darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de seguir estudiando, y pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la universidad, y luchar por un futuro mejor.
texts.en: Gessica is from the city of Villarrica, and is majoring in chemical engineering. She states that in the future she wants to work and have her own business, and be professionally successful. She also wants to be able to help her family and give them everything she wasn't able to have. She's grateful to receive the opportunity to continue studying, and is requesting this loan to be able to pay her university fees and work for a better future.

loans.use: To pay university fees.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is married with two children. She is 35 years old and lives in Gumahan Josefina Zamboanga Del Sur.

Nenita sells ‘’ukay-ukay’’ to earn a living and has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns 20,000 PHP net income doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 50,000 PHP to buy new items of "ukay-ukay" (used clothing) such as assorted bags, assorted jogging pants, and other assorted items. 

Nenita has been a member of Paglaum MPC for almost 2 years. In the future, She hope to expand her business for the future of her children and to improve her living.

loans.use: to buy new assorted items of ''ukay-ukay'' (used clothing).

loans.name: Aldo

texts.es:
Aldo está cursando la carrera de derecho y ciencias sociales, una carrera que implica mucho sacrificio de tiempo, de economía y de dedicación.
Él tuvo que dejar  atrás muchas cosas para estudiar y alejarse de su familia, quiere ser un profesional que sea útil a las demás personas y pueda ayudarlos.
Aldo pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de estudios, como copias, libros y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir luchando por ser alguien en la vida.
texts.en: Aldo is majoring in law and social science, a degree that requires a large investment of time, money and commitment. He had to leave many things behind and move away from his family to go to school, and he aspires to be a professional who's useful and helpful to other people. Aldo is requesting this loan to invest it in school expenses such as copies, books, and more. This will allow him to continue working to be somebody in life.

loans.use: To pay school expenses, such as copies, books, etc.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.es:
Danilo tiene 18 años y está en el segundo curso de la Facultad de Ciencias Veterinarias, vive actualmente   en una casa alquilada, con un amigo que es de la misma Facultad.
Sus padres le ayudan a seguir estudiando, y comenta que con su carrera quiere ayudar a los animales que tanto le gusta.
Es muy joven y está luchando por  ser alguien en la vida. Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus cuotas, y de esa forma seguir estudiando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Danilo is 18 years old and is in the second year of the veterinary science program, and is currently living in a rented house with a friend who's in the same program. His parents are helping him to continue going to school, and he states that with his degree he wants to help the animals he likes so much. He's very young and is working to be somebody in life. This loan he's requesting is to cover his expenses and allow him to keep going to school like he's been doing.

loans.use: To pay for university fees.

loans.name: G.s. Triunfadores Group

texts.es:
El g.s. triunfadores está conformado por tres integrantes dos hombres y una mujer, padres y madres responsables con diez hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios de Carazo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona central de la región. se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron cursar una carrera y se vieron en la necesidad de trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. En la actualidad luchan día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos. 
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante, la coordinadora es Dilena y tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería en general como ropa pantalones, shores, faldas, camisolas, ropa de cama, ropa interior, perfumes, body, toallas, crema de cuerpos, labiales. Ella dedica a su negocio unas diez horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo  y surtir su negocio en la compra de mercadería para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. G.S. Triunfadores agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: The G.S. Triunfadores group consists of three members, two men and one woman. They're responsible parents taking care of ten children, and are natives of Carazo, a place located in the center of the region. Their reputation is one of hard work, responsibility, and a desire for self-improvement. Unfortunately a lack of resources prevented them from completing school and they needed to work at a young age to help with household expenses. Currently they work everyday to provide their children a better future. Thanks to her work and desire to persevere Dilena the group coordinator works in the sale of general merchandise such as pants, shorts, skirts, shirts, pajamas, undergarments, perfumes, corsets, towels, body lotion, and lipstick. She works ten hour days in her business selling her products. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business with merchandise so she can obtain more income in the not-too-distant future. G.S Triunfadores is grateful for the help provided by Kiva lenders in assisting low income people in poor countries like Nicaragua to have a decent job.

loans.use: To invest in working capital and stock their clothing purchase and sale business with items such as: pants, shorts, skirts, shirts, pajamas, undergarments, perfumes, corsets, towels, body lotion, lipstick

loans.name: Ergin

texts.en:
Erginis is a 46-year-old married male living in the southern part of Kosovo with his wife and their 17-year-old son. His wife is working in a kitchen as a cook and he has been a taxi driver for more than 13 years now. He really enjoys this work and takes his job very seriously, being responsible and dedicated in order to provide the best services and generate as much income as he can. Over the years, he has been able to build himself a good reputation and strong customer base. 

After all of these years, his vehicle is in need of repair now. He is requesting a loan to change the tires and engine, which is overdue for service and replacement. This will help him to improve his business and continue to offer his clients a safe, reliable and well-maintained vehicle for traveling.  He hopes to continue to work as a taxi driver and hopes to have a better life and provide an education to his son. He wants to thank all of the Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To change tires and the engine of his taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a chaff cutter

loans.name: Manzurat

texts.en: Manzurat is 54 years old. She is married and has a daughter. Her husband works in a train station. Manzurat is a higher-educated woman. She is a teacher. For some years, she worked in a school but she had a small salary. So, she began her own business selling flatbreads in a local market six months ago. Little by little with the profit from her business, Manzurat is improving her living condition. She manages her business well because there is a great demand for flatbreads in the local market. People every day use flatbreads. Manzurat wants to increase her working capital. She is asking for a loan of 600 USD to buy flatbreads. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy flatbreads to sell

loans.name: Telman

texts.en:
Telman is 41 years old and married with two children. One of them is 20 years old and is studying in the second course of college and the other is attending the eleventh class of school. His wife is a tailor. The family is living in Baki region, but 21 years ago, they became Internally Displaced Persons (IDP) from their home in Fuzuli city
.
Telman is a taxi driver. A while ago, two tires on his car were damaged. Today, he needs a loan of 700 Azerbaijan New Manat (AZN), to change the tires on his car. Telman is greatly thankful to the Kiva organization for its help.

loans.use: to pay for new tires for his taxi

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les cinq  membres du groupe Benkadi ont en moyenne 33 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Sabalibougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, d’amitié, de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Sabalibougou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits de la friperie de tous genres, des condiments et des bayas. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Aïchata (femme debout à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse d’habits de la friperie de meilleures qualités et de tous les genres. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter deux balles d’habits à Bamako. La revente se fait en détail à Sabalibougou et en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Aïchata compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 75 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Mostly married in monogamous households, the five members of the Benkadi group are on average 33 years old with four children. They all live at Sabalibougou, one of the neighborhoods of Bamako, and became acquainted through kinship, friendship, neighborhood ties and their income-generating activities at the Sabalibougou market.

Group members are retail traders of all kinds of used clothing, condiments and bayas (collar of beads worn around the hips). In order to increase their working capital, the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third group loan cycle.

Mrs. Aichata (the woman standing at the far left in the photo) is a great saleswoman of all kinds of quality used clothing. She intends to use her loan to buy two bales of clothes in Bamako. Retail sales are conducted in Sabalibougou and as an itinerant vendor, to a clientele composed mostly of women .

With this loan Mrs. Aichata expects to attain average monthly profits of 75,000 CFA francs, to be reinvested in the business and used to meet small household  needs.

loans.use: buy used clothing

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les quatre  membres du groupe Djiguiya ont en moyenne 36 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Sabalibougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Sabalibougou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de,  produits d’artisanaux (calebasses), graines d’arachides, fonio, ignames et concombres. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Sali (femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de calebasses. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 100 calebasses en gros avec les forgerons du quartier Mali. La revente se fait en détails à Sabalibougou  à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Sali compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Mostly married in monogamous households, the four members of the Djiguiya group are on average 36 years old with five children. They all live at Sabalibougou, one of the neighborhoods of Bamako, and became acquainted through neighborhood ties and their income-generating activities at the Sabalibougou market.

Group members are retail traders of handicraft products (gourds), peanuts, fonio, yams and cucumbers. In order to increase their working capital, the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second group loan cycle.

Mrs. Sali (the woman sitting at the far left in the photo) is a great saleswoman of gourds. She intends to use her loan to buy 100 gourds wholesale from blacksmiths in the Mali neighborhood. Retail sales are conducted in Sabalibougou to a clientele composed mostly of women.

With this loan Mrs. Sali expects to attain average monthly profits of 90,000 CFA francs, to be reinvested in the business and used to meet small household needs.

loans.use: buy gourds

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en: Gulnora is 32 years old. She is a teacher at a local school. Gulnora teaches Russian. She has worked in a local school for more than two years. Gulnora is widowed and bringing up two children. She always works for the well being of her children. Gulnora uses her salary to buy food items and clothes for her children and herself. Since last year, Gulnora has been repairing her house because her house is old and in bad condition but there is some work to finish. Gulnora does not have enough savings to realize her plan. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy building materials such as cement, wood, and soil for repairing her house. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials to make home repairs

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en:
Nieves is 52 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Nieves has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Nieves would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk and sugar

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 31-year-old woman married to Marvel, a 32-year-old man. They are blessed with four children: Arnold, 10, is in 4th grade. Grasela, 7, is in first grade. Yani is 3 years old and Kevin is 1 years old. 
 
Maria owns a business selling fried bananas, pastry, and fried tofu. She has been running the business for nine years. Maria is grateful for the generated income, which enables her to support her husband in covering their daily basic needs. Since Maria is not the only person who sells cakes around the neighborhood, she was thinking of producing more variety of cakes, pastry and snacks as well. In order to implement her plan, Maria has applied for a loan of IDR 4,500,000 at TLM.  The loan will be spent on the supporting equipment such as oven, mixer and blender, as well as cake ingredients such as wheat flour, margarine, eggs, etc.

loans.use: to purchase an oven, a mixer, a blender, wheat flour, margarine, eggs, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his children's school expenses.

loans.name: Nienta Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  femmes du groupe Nienta sont mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques et polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 46 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Sabalibougou dans le district de Bamako; Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Sabalibougou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce du poisson,  des céréales, des habits et du bois de charbon. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3èmecycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Mariam (femme debout à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente du  poisson de toutes les variétés. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 115kg de poisson frais à Kabala au bord du fleuve Niger. La revente se fait  au comptant et à crédits au marché et en ambulant à une clientèle composée mixte. Madame Mariam espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 95 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The four women in the  Nienta group are married mostly in monogamous and polygamous households. They are on average 46 years old with five children. They all live in the Sabalibougou neighborhood in the district of Bamako. They became acquainted through neighborhood ties and their income-generating activities at the Sabalibougou market.

Members of the group are retail traders of fish, grain cereals, clothes and charcoal. In order to resupply by paying cash, the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third group loan cycle.

Mrs. Mariam (the woman standing at the far left in the photo) has a great reputation in selling all kinds of fish. She intends to use her loan to buy 115 kilos of fresh fish in Kabala along the Niger River. Retail sales are for cash and on credit, at the market and as an itinerant vendor, to a mixed clientele.

With this loan Mrs. Mariam hopes to achieve average monthly profits of 95,000 CFA francs, to be reinvested in the business and used to ensure their children's well-being.

loans.use: buy fish

loans.name: Sofik

texts.en:
Sofik is a nurse who has been working at a local clinic for 20 years. She lives in Gyumri town with her husband who is a teacher by profession. Their children are married and live separately with their families. 

Besides her work in the clinic, Sofik also provides different medical service from her house. She takes care of her clients very much and is available for them whenever they need her help.

By applying for this loan, Sofik is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders to be able to pay for medical tools and equipment that she needs for her work. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans, with soft conditions, to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will be a great help to Sofik and she waits for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for medical tools and equipment

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq  femmes du groupe Sabougnouma sont mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 40 ans et 7 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Sabalibougou dans le district de Bamako; Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Sabalibougou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits (pagnes wax, brodés et basins), de pains et  des produits de beautés. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Nana (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des habits (pagnes wax, brodés et basins). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 30 pièces de pagnes wax à Bamako en gros. La revente se fait  au comptant et à crédits à Sabalibougou et en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Nana espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien de mes enfants du foyer.
texts.en:
The five women of the Sabougnouma group are mostly married in monogamous households. They are on average 40 years old with seven children. They all live in the Sabalibougou neighborhood in the Bamako district, and became acquainted through neighborhood ties and their income-generating activities at the Sabalibougou market.

Group members are retail traders of clothing (pagnes wax, embroidered, and bazin fabrics), bread and beauty products. In order to pay cash when they resupply, the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second group loan cycle.

Mrs. Nana (the woman standing at the far right in the photo) has a great reputation in selling clothes (pagnes wax, embroidered, and bazin fabrics). She intends to use her loan to buy wholesale 30 lengths of pagne wax fabric in Bamako. Retail sales are conducted for cash and on credit in Sabalibougou and as an itinerant vendor, to a clientele consisting mainly of women.

With this loan Mrs. Nana expects to attain average monthly profits of 40,000 CFA francs, to be reinvested in the business and used to ensure her children's well-being.

loans.use: buy pagnes wax (colorful West-African fabric)

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva trabaja en un Laboratorio de medicamentos y de noche va a la facultad, está haciendo el último año de la carrera de Química y Farmacia.
Ella vive con su pareja y un hijo pequeño que tiene, por quienes está luchando para poder crecer y salir adelante. Sus metas futuras son la de trabajar en su profesión, y ser una profesional independiente.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas, y de esa forma seguir estudiando y luchando por sus sueños.
texts.en:
Eva works in a medicine laboratory and at night she goes to university. She is doing the final year of a Chemistry and Pharmacy degree. She lives with her partner and her young son, for whom she is fighting to grow and get ahead. Her future goals are to work in her field and be an independent professional. 

She is requesting this loan to be able to pay her tuition, so she can keep studying and fighting for her dreams.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Tatiana Marisol

texts.es:
La Señora. Tatiana está realizando su primer crédito en el grupo de crédito San Vicente y ha sido su abuelita quien le ha motivado a ingresar a este hermoso grupo, espera aprender todo lo bueno de sus compañeras para así salir en adelante, vive por los alrededores de la parroquia Victoria del Portete en Cuenca, en donde la mayor parte de su población se dedica a la ganadería y a la agricultura, mucha de su población ha salido a la ciudad a trabajar en varias actividades como también han migrado en busca de un mejor trabajo.
La Señora Tatiana tiene 19 años de edad, vive en unión libre y ha concebido dos niños de 2 años y su segundo hijo de apenas 6 meses, su esposo labora como albañil, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su abuelita con quien comparte los gastos de su hogar.
Doña Tatiana se dedica hacer bordados actividad que aprendió de su madre, ahora es su método de vida al igual que la cría de  cuyes, pollos y borregos. El dinero de su crédito es para la compra de  una vaca lechera. Su meta es de continuar creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Tatiana is doing her first loan with the communal borrowing group San Vicente. It was her grandmama who motivated her to join this lovely group, and she hopes to learn all good things from her co-lenders so she can move forward. She lives on the outskirts of the Victoria del Portete parish, in Cuenca, where most of the population works raising livestock and in agriculture. Many people have left to go to the city to work in various activities, since they also go to look for a better job.

Tatiana is 19 years old, is in a common-law marriage, and has two two-year old children, as well as her second son who is just six months old. Her husband works as a builder. They don't have their own house because they live in her grandmama's house, and share the household expenses with her. 

Tatiana does embroidery, which she learned from her mother. Now it is her livelihood, along with the raising of guinea pigs, chickens and lambs. The money from the loan is for buying a milking cow. Her goal is to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi est composé de 4 femmes mariées majoritairement dans des ménages polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Kalaban-Coro chef lieu de commune dans le cercle de Kati (dans la 2ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont  connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de produits cosmétiques (pommades,  crèmes à lèvre, parfums,…), des mèches, de l’arachide et d’habits. Dans le but de constituer  leurs stockes de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 4ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Ami (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des produits cosmétiques et de mèches de meilleures qualités. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 50 paquets de mèche en gros au grand marché. La revente se fait en détails à  Kalaban-Coro à une clientèle majoritairement composée de femmes. Madame Ami espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is composed of four women mostly married in polygamous households. They are on average 38 years old with six children. They all live in the village of Kalaban-Coro, capital of the Kati district (in the second administrative region of Mali) and became acquainted through neighborhood ties.

Members of the group are small retail traders of cosmetics (ointments, lip gloss, perfumes,...), hair extensions, peanuts and clothes. Wishing to set up their stock supply, the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their fourth group loan cycle.

Ms. Ami (the woman sitting on the far right in the photo) has a great reputation in selling cosmetics and better-quality hair extensions. She intends to use her loan to buy 50 packages of hair extensions wholesale at the great market. Retail sales are conducted in Kalaban-Coro to a clientele composed mostly of women.

Ms. Ami hopes to achieve with this loan an average monthly profit of 90,000 CFA francs to be reinvested in the business. She aims to buy a lot for residential use in this relationship with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: buy hair extensions

loans.name: Saykhonim

texts.ru:
Сайхоним 45 лет. Она опытный растениевод, живет в районе Хамадони. Сайхоним занимается выращиванием зерновых культур и овощей. Она более 8 лет занимается земледельческой деятельностью и любит наблюдать за плодом своих трудов. Сайхоним замужем за таксиста, у них трое детей старше 18 лет. Один ее сын сейчас находится на заработках в России.
Сайхоним уже провела весенний посев. Она посадила на своем участке земли пшеницу и картофель. Теперь ей необходимо обработать удобрением эти посевы. С такой целью Сайхоним обратилась за кредитом. Так как она хочет получить хороший урожай и надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Saykhonim is 45 years old. She is an experienced crop grower who lives in the Hamadoni District. Saykhonim grows grains and vegetables. She has been practicing agriculture for more than 8 years and loves to keep watch over the fruits of her hard work. Saykhonim is married to a taxi driver and they have three children, the eldest of whom is 18 year old. One of her sons works abroad in Russia.

Saykhonim has already carried out the spring sowing. She sowed wheat and potatoes on her plot of land. Now she must treat these crops with fertilizer. Saykhonim requested a loan for this purpose as she wants to receive a good harvest. She relies on your support.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers to grow wheat and potatoes.

loans.name: Derlis

texts.es:
Derlis vive en la ciudad de Carapeguá, está estudiando la carrera de Administración de Empresas,  y quiere al graduarse poder trabajar en su profesión.
Él quiere crear su propia empresa para poder ayudar a las demás personas por medio de su carrera.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de universidad, y también para cubrir sus gastos de manutención. Él agradece por la oportunidad de estudiar que recibe, que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Derlis lives in the city of Carapeguá.  He is studying business administration and he wants to work in his field after he graduates. 

He wants to start his own business to be able to help other people through his career.

He is requesting this loan to pay his university fees and also to cover his general expenses.  He is thankful for the opportunity to study that he has received, which will be of great use to him.

loans.use: to pay his university fees

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda started a farming business. Before, she was just depending on their farming business growing rice. With her desire to grow her business and increase her income as well, Imelda tried taking care of pigs. Imelda's desires brought her gradual development. She became a positive thinker as a small entrepreneur. Now, Imelda aims for continuous growth of her business, to have enough income and revolving capital to invest in their farm. Imelda is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy piglets to raise and feed for their maintenance. Borrowing a loan will bring her new hope towards growing her business.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and feed.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Cherry works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling peanuts in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice. Cherry is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase sacks of peanuts to sell for her business buying and selling peanuts.

Cherry has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of peanuts to sell

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es:
Yessica es estudiante del primer año de nutrición, está trabajando actualmente en uno de los comercios de la ciudad para pagar sus estudios.
Ella vive con sus padres y sus hermanos. Le motiva estudiar esta carrera, el poder ayudar a los niños con problemas y a adultos que necesitan de una nutricionista. También para que su trabajo como profesional le sirva para ser independiente.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la universidad, y de esa forma seguir luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Yessica is a first-year nutrition student.  She is currently working at a business in the city to pay for her studies.  

She lives with her parents and her siblings.  She is motivated to study this subject so she can help children with problems and adults who need a nutritionist.  She also hopes her work as a professional will allow her to be independent.  

She is requesting this loan to pay her university fees so she can keep working to improve living conditions for herself and her family.

loans.use: to pay her university fees

loans.name: Nuriniso

texts.en: Nuriniso is a married parent of three children. She is 46 years old. Nuriniso lives happily with her family in a rural area. Her husband is a taxi driver. She graduated medical college. For more than five years she has worked in a local maternity hospital as a midwife. She knows her deal well. Nuriniso has a good reputation. Her daughter is also a student of a medical college. She must pay for her tuition but she doesn't have money. Nuriniso is asking for a loan of 1500 USD to pay for tuition. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for the tuition of her daughter in medical college.

loans.name: Maftuna

texts.en: Maftuna some years ago lost her husband. Her husband died tragically. After the death of her husband she returned to her mother’s house. Now, she lives with her mother. Maftuna and her mother have been busy with animal husbandry. They have run this business more than 12 years. Maftuna is a very industrious woman. She works hard and tries to develop the business. The only family income is from animal husbandry, so it is not enough to buy all necessary things for living. For the last some months she has not had money. Maftuna is asking for a loan of 500 Somoni to buy food items for her family needs. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy food items for her family needs

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn, 61 years of age, is married to a farmer and blessed with three children. She has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost twenty-four years and earns a net income of PHP 1,500 daily. Due to insufficient capital to run her business, she would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase beverages, biscuits, canned goods, detergent soaps, and bread to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase beverages, biscuits, canned goods, detergent soaps, and bread to sell.

loans.name: Mirna Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mirna de 44 años de edad,  es una persona que  estudio noveno grado, esta casada, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura. Ella se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. Junto a su esposo  para realizar sus actividades diarias y sus 4 hijos le colaboran con las actividades.


Mirna se dedica a comercializar fruta de temporada, oficio que le ha enseño su madre, mientras su esposo trabaja en la parcela junto a sus hijos camina 2 kilómetros. Para llegar y en el transcurso de la tarde ella se dedica a buscar más frutas para el siguiente día ir a vender. 


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una vaca y podrá empezar a producir leche para la elaboración de queso que venderá en los alrededores de su residencia y así incrementar sus ingresos.

Mirna planea que con los ingresos que obtiene de la venta frutas y de la siembra y  del préstamo para la compra de las vacas podrá en un futuro  comprar más vacas para  la producción de leche.
texts.en:
Forty-four-year-old Mirna is a person with a ninth grade education.  She is married and her husband works in farming.  She gets up at 4:30 a.m. together with her husband to do her daily work and her four children help her with the duties. 

Mirna sells seasonal fruit for a living.  She learned this business from her mother.  While her husband works their plot of land together with their children, she walks 2 km to get where she's going and over the course of the afternoon she looks for more fruit to sell the following day.  

The loan she is requesting is to buy a cow to produce milk to make cheese, which she will sell in the area surrounding her home and increase her income.  

With the income from her fruit sales, her crops, and this loan to buy cows, Mirna plans to buy more dairy cows in the future.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Nune

texts.en:
Nune is from Gyumri town. She lives there with her husband and 26-year-old daughter. About five months ago, Nune started her retail business. Specifically she sells clothing and dressmaking supplies to locals in Gyumri town.

Realizing that the startup business is quite profitable and the income gathered from that business helps her to cover her family's daily costs, Nune applied for this loan. She asks lenders to support her in purchasing a new stock of clothing. Nune has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans, with soft conditions, to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a new stock of clothing to sell

loans.name: Marío Roberto

texts.es:
Mario es una persona acompañada. Se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. Junto a su esposa y nietos  que le apoyan en la actividades agrícolas y en el ordeño de los animales que poseen.


 Mario junto a sus hijos se dedican a la agricultura oficio que aprendió de sus padres,  para llegar a la parcelas camina 1.5 kilómetros y trabaja durante la mañana y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a cuidar las vacas.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una yunta de bueyes, que necesita para poder arar la tierra donde cultiva y podrá obtener un ingreso adicional por arar otras parcelas lo que le ayudara a mantener a su familia. 

Mario planea que con los ingresos que obtiene de la venta de leche, de la siembra, y del préstamo para la compra de la yunta de bueyes; podrá comprar mas vacas lecheras y poder producir lácteos para la venta.
texts.en:
Mario is married.  He gets up at 5:00 a.m. with his wife and grandchildren, who help with the agriculture activities and milking of the cows.

Mario and his children work in agriculture, which he learned from his parents.  He walks 1.5 km. to the land and works in the morning while his wife takes care of the houshold chores and the cows.
 
The loan he is requesting is to buy a pair of oxen to plow the land where he cultivates and other land where he hopes to earn more income to help support the family.

With the income from milk sales and from the harvest, in addition to the loan, Mario hopes to buy the pair of oxen.  He will also buy more dairy cows to produce more milk.

loans.use: To buy a pair of oxen to plow his cropland.

loans.name: Cherryl Joy

texts.en:
Cherryl Joy is 40 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school, Cherryl Joy works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a business buying and selling tobacco in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more bundles of tobacco to sell.

Cherryl Joy has been in this business for 13 years.

In the future Cherryl Joy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more bundles of tobacco to sell

loans.name: Paulita

texts.en:
Paulita is a responsible housewife who supports her husband in generating income. Aside from farming, she is also involved in a hog-raising business to have additional income. She would like to acquire more pigs to raise but she doesn't have enough capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP17,000 to buy the required hog feeds, vitamins and additional pigs to raise. 

She is a kind and industrious mother, and she believes that she will further improve the business and make it more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy hog feeds, vitamins and additional pigs to raise

location.town: Brgy. Ineangan, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Yessica Lisseth

texts.es:
En la fotografía aparece Yessica junto a su hija.

Yessica de 25 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado de primaria,  está acompañada y tiene dos niñas una estudia y la otra aun no, su compañero de vida es agricultor solo vive la familia incluyendo su suegra. Ella siempre se ha dedicado a los oficios domésticos, depende de los ingresos de su esposo como agricultor y su madre que le envía remesas de los EEUU.


El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar material para poner piso a la casa, ya que tiene una niña pequeña y no le gusta que juegue con el polvo, le gustaría ver a sus hijas graduadas de la universidad, ya que la más grande dice que le gustaría ser doctora para trabajar y ayudar a su madre
texts.en:
Yessica and her daughter are pictured in the photograph.  

Twenty-five-year-old Yessica studied through the sixth grade of primary school.  She is in a relationship and has two daughters; one is in school and the other is not  yet.  Her life partner is an independent farmer.  Her mother-in-law lives with their family.  She has always been a homemaker; she depends on her husband's income from farming and the money her mother sends her from the US. 

The loan she is requesting is to buy material to lay a floor in their home as they have a young daughter and she does not like her to play in the dirt.  She would like to see her daughters graduate from university as her oldest says that she would like to be a doctor so she can work and help her mother.

loans.use: to buy material to lay a floor on their home

loans.name: Lucio Alberto

texts.es:
Lucio de 53 años de edad, estudio hasta primer grado, está acompañado su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos tienen dos hijos que viven con ellos y Lucio es el responsable de mantener a su familia y nadie más vive con ellos.

 Desde hace cuatro años se dedica a la siembra de maíz y aprendió el rubro por su padres y también trabaja en una hacienda en ordeñar al ganado y darles de comer y le queda a dos kilómetros el trabajo y se va caminando desde antes de las 6 de la mañana. El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar fertilizantes y abonos ya que sembrara 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz.
texts.en:
Fifty-three-year-old Lucio has a first-grade education.  He is in a relationship and his partner is a homemaker.  They have two children who live with them; Lucio is the one responsible for supporting his family and no one else lives with them. 

He has been growing corn for four years and he learned this profession from his parents.  He also works at a farm milking and feeding cows and this job is 2 km away and he walks there before six in the morning.  The loan he is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to buy fertilizers and manures, as he will plant 7,000 square meters of corn.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and manures, as he will plant 7,000 square meters of corn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a chaff cutter and water pump

loans.name: Ruben Hipolito

texts.es:
Rubén, está soltero, no tiene hijos, se dedica a atender una tienda, en la que satisface a sus clientes con productos de la canasta básica, su jornada inicia a las 8:00 a.m. y finalizan a las 4:00 p.m., dicho oficio lo aprendió junto a su madre.
El préstamo que requiere lo invertirá en la compra de pan, galletas, gaseosas, jugos, boquitas, dulces, aceite, huevos, arroz, entre otros productos que le permitan surtir el inventario con lo que espera aumentar la clientela, incrementar sus ventas y estabilizarse económicamente.
Su objetivo es ampliar su negocio para tener un buen record crediticio y adquirir un vehículo en el que pueda trasladar la mercadería a su casa con mayor facilidad.
texts.en:
Ruben is single and has no children.  He runs a store and satisfies his customers by stocking basic goods.  He begins his day at 8:00 a.m. and finishes at 4:00 p.m.  He learned the trade from his mother.

The loan he is requesting is to buy bread, cookies, sodas, juices, snacks, sweets, oil, eggs, rice and other goods to stock his inventory.  His aim is to increase his customer base and sales, and stabilize the business economically.

His goal is to expand his business and have a good credit record.  He also wants to buy a vehicle so he can transport the merchandise to his house easier.

loans.use: To buy bread, cookies, sodas, juices, snacks, sweets, oil, eggs, rice and other goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To install running water at home.
